column1: TORONTO --   In a game between teams on extended home run binges
column2: a well - placed chopper down the line proved pivotal . 	 Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit a go - ahead
column3: two - run triple in the seventh inning and the Toronto Blue Jays rallied to beat the Yankees 5 - 4 Saturday
column4: handing New York its second straight loss following a season - high nine game winning streak . 	 " That was a big hit from Vlad today
column6: whose Blue Jays have won nine of 13 . " The last two days have been awesome for this team
column8: playing the best team in baseball and fighting back . " 	 Guerrero Jr. leads all big league rookies with 26 RBI since the All - Star break . 	 Gary Sanchez returned from injured list and hit a solo home run for the Yankees and Gio Urshela added a two - run drive . 	 The Blue Jays trailed 4 - 3 in the seventh when Bo Bichette drew a one - out walk from Adam Ottavino
column9: Cavan Biggio singled and Guerrero Jr. hit an 0 - 2 grounder down the first base line and into foul territory . Right fielder Aaron Judge initially mishandled the ball against a side wall
column10: and Guerrero slid in safely for the first triple of his career . 	 " I think it was a good pitch
column11: " Sanchez said through a translator . " A defensive swing by him and he was able to put the ball in play . It stayed inside the line and went down the line . Part of the game . Sometimes those things are going to happen where the ball is not hit solid but still finds a hole . " 	 The Yankees had gone ahead on DJ LeMahieu 's sacrifice fly in the top of the inning
column12: but Ottavino ( 5 - 4 ) could n't make it stand up . The right - hander allowed a run for the first time in 16 appearances
column13: a streak that dated to July 2 against the Mets . 	 Ottavino put both hands on his head as he watched Guerrero 's roll past first base . 	 " By the time I looked up
column14: I saw that the ball was over in that area
column15: " Ottavino said . " I looked over
column16: I saw ( the umpire ) call it fair . I was kind of in a little bit of disbelief . " 	 Teoscar Hernandez hit a three - run homer for the Blue Jays
column17: who have gone deep in 15 consecutive games . It is Toronto 's longest such streak since a 19 - game run in 2010 . 	 Blue Jays batters have hit 99 home runs since June 16 . Only the Yankees ( 100 ) have hit more in that span . 	 The Yankees have hit multiple home runs in nine straight games
column18: extending their season - best streak . New York lost for the ninth time in 61 games with multiple home runs . 	 Jason Adam ( 1 - 0 ) worked 1 1/3 innings for his first major league win and Derek Law got four outs for his third save in three opportunities . Five Blue Jays pitchers combined to hold the Yankees to five hits . 	 " Credit to them
column19: they mixed and matched and held us down enough today
column20: " manager Aaron Boone said . 	 Sanchez started in the cleanup spot after missing 16 games because of a strained left groin . He struck out swinging on three pitches against right - hander Wilmer Font in his first at - bat
column21: then provided the first hit of the game with a one - out homer off righty Jacob Waguespack in the fourth . It was Sanchez 's 25th home run of the season and his first since July 4 . 	 Sanchez later took a foul tip off the knuckles of his bare hand
column22: but said it was n't serious . 	 Toronto got its first hit
column25: who homered twice Friday
column26: greeted righty Chance Adam with a three - run drive into the second deck
column27: his 18th . 	 Urshela tied it at 3 with a homer into the center field party deck in the sixth
column28: his 17th . 	 Urshela had back - to - back
column29: two - homer games against Baltimore and Toronto on Wednesday and Thursday . Of his past 29 hits
column30: 20 have been for extra bases . 	 The Yankees lost for the first time in 12 games this season when using an opener
column31: with starter Chad Green pitching a scoreless inning . Six Yankees pitchers combined to walk eight and strike out 14 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Yankees : INF Gleyber Torres ( core injury ) hit on the field and took grounders before the game
column32: then flashed a thumbs - up to Boone as he exited . Torres has missed four straight . Boone said Torres might return Sunday . ... RHP Jonathan Holder ( right shoulder ) was placed on the 10 - day injured list
column33: retroactive to Aug. 7 . Holder will undergo an MRI when the team returns home Monday . " Hopefully it 's something that 's a little shorter term but he 's definitely got some impingement in there
column34: " Boone said . The Yankees recalled LHP Stephen Tarpley from Triple - A to replace Holder . Tarpley walked four in 2 1/3 innings . ... RHP Jonathan Loaisiga ( shoulder ) threw 48 pitches over three shutout innings at Triple - A Friday . " That 's really encouraging
column35: " Boone said . " He could potentially become an option for us some point this coming week . " ... LHP CC Sabathia ( right knee ) will throw a bullpen Sunday
column36: Boone said . ... OF Giancarlo Stanton ( right knee ) continues to hit off the tee and throw
column37: but has yet to ramp up his activity . " I know he 's been doing a lot of agility - type stuff
column38: strengthening - type stuff and he 's responded pretty well to that
column39: " Boone said . 	 Blue Jays : RHP Ken Giles ( elbow ) was unavailable and may need to go on the injured list
column40: Montoyo said after the game . ... RHP John Axford had season - ending elbow surgery Thursday . Axford did not pitch for Toronto this season . 	 ROSTER REPORT 	 To make room for Sanchez
column41: the Yankees optioned C Kyle Higashioka to Triple - A Scranton / Wilkes - Barre . 	 HARD CONTACT 	 Guerrero lined a single off the left field wall in the fifth . The ball left his bat at 118.7 miles per hour
column42: the fourth - hardest hit ball in the majors this season . Guerrero leads all players with eight batted balls of 115 mph or greater . Stanton ( 120.6 mph on March 28 ) has the hardest hit of 2019 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Yankees : RHP Masahiro Tanaka ( 7 - 6

column1: BOSTON --   Mike Trout can cross Fenway Park off his home run to - do list . 	 Trout hit the first home run of his career at Fenway and the Los Angeles Angels snapped an eight - game losing streak with a 12 - 4 rout of the Boston Red Sox on Saturday . 	 With his 428 - foot drive over the Green Monster in the sixth inning
column2: Trout has now homered in every American League ballpark . He had played 21 games in Boston without connecting . 	 " I did n't think about it
column3: " Trout said . " I think I got reminded about it every time I 've come here . " 	 After two at - bats against Red Sox starter Rick Porcello in which he struck out and grounded out
column4: Trout came up again and Porcello missed on a fastball that went straight over the middle of the plate . 	 Trout made him pay for it . 	 " I hit it good
column5: " Trout said . " He pitched me tough my first two at - bats . I was looking for a pitch to hit and I got one . " 	 The homer was Trout 's 39th this season
column6: tying for the major league lead with Milwaukee 's Christian Yelich . 	 Trout was replaced in the seventh
column7: having been hit in his shoulder by a pitcher earlier in the game . Trout was feeling fine . 	 Justin Upton added a three - run homer in the first inning . 	 The Angels scored seven times in a sloppy seventh inning by Boston in which it issued two walks
column8: hit two batters and gave up four singles . The Red Sox also had an error and a passed ball . 	 The loss denied Boston its first three - game win streak since it won three straight games against the Yankees last month . It 's also yet another head - scratching setback for the defending World Series champions
column9: who looked to be turning a corner following an eight - game losing streak last month . 	 " We 'll keep working
column11: " manager Alex Cora said . " There were some positives
column12: but obviously at the end we need results as a team . " 	 Taylor Cole ( 2 - 3 ) pitched 1 2/3 innings of scoreless relief to pick up the win . 	 Porcello ( 10 - 9 ) took the loss
column13: giving up both home runs . He lasted five innings
column14: allowing five earned runs off five hits
column15: walking one and striking out four . 	 " Sixth inning I throw three pitches
column16: give up two runs . It 's tough
column17: I got to be better
column18: " Porcello said . 	 Porcello retired 14 batters in a row after Upton 's homer
column19: but for the first time in several starts did n't get run support . 	 Porcello entered the night having won five of his previous six starts despite allowing 26 earned runs in 34 1/3 innings .   But he had also benefited from a major - league - leading 7.3 runs per start by Boston 's offense . 	 The runs were n't there for him on Saturday . 	 The Red Sox left 11 runners on base after outscoring the Angels 19 - 4 in the first two games of the series . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : Shohei Ohtani threw a 40 - pitch bullpen session Saturday and said his velocity is improving . " Before I get into the breaking balls
column20: I need to hit my velocity
column21: but I think we 're getting close
column22: " Ohtani said through a translator . He reached as high as 82 mph and joked that put him at " probably about 82 percent " of his goal . Angels manager Brad Ausmus is pleased at the progress . " He was good . No complaints
column24: " he said . 	 Red Sox : 1B / OF Steve Pearce ( low back strain ) hit in the cage and ran lightly in the outfield . He said he can do everything but run sprint after being set back by a partially torn ACL . " In this game you have to be able to run and you need to be able to burst and that 's what I 'm having trouble doing right now
column25: " he said . Pearce said the ACL injury wo n't require surgery and is being treated with exercise as he tries to build the muscles around it . 	 FIRST STRIKE 	 The Angels improved to 38 - 18 when scoring first this season . They have scored three or more runs in the first inning 11 times this season
column26: going 8 - 3 in those games . 	 UP NEXT 	 Angels : LHP Patrick Sandoval ( 0 - 0
column27: 3.60 ERA ) is making his second appearance for the Angels this season after getting a no - decision in his major league debut at Cincinnati . 	 Red Sox :   RHP Andrew Cashner ( 10 - 7
column28: 4.68 ERA ) is a win shy of matching his career high of 11
column29: set with the Rangers in 2017 . He 's pitched six or more innings in each of his last three career starts against the Angels . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: SAN FRANCISCO --   Jeff Samardzija spent extra time watching video
column2: and it paid off . 	 He pitched eight stellar innings of two - hit ball
column3: Evan Longoria and Kevin Pillar each homered
column4: and the San Francisco Giants beat the Philadelphia Phillies 3 - 1 on Saturday . 	 Samardzija ( 9 - 9 ) gave up one run
column5: struck out five and walked none . He retired 20 straight after giving up a solo homer to Corey Dickerson with two outs in the top of the first inning . Samardzija 's streak ended with Cesar Hernandez 's one - out single in the eighth . 	 Samardzija was facing the Phillies for the second time in less than two weeks . He pitched six shutout innings of three - hit ball in a 5 - 1 win at Citizens Bank Park on July 31 . 	 " I went back and watched the film and just saw a couple of spots where we could improve on
column6: and ultimately do a little bit different there so we 're not doing exactly the same stuff
column7: " Samardzija said . 	 " A very dangerous lineup
column8: so really you ca n't really let off the gas and I did n't do that today . " 	 The 34 - year - old right - hander is 5 - 2 with a 1.95 ERA in eight starts since July 1 . He 's 2 - 0 with a 1.13 ERA and 19 strikeouts over his last four starts . 	 " They just saw him and he threw another beauty
column9: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . 	 " He 's in a really good place as far as commanding the ball
column10: all four pitches . That was just a great job of executing your pitches for eight innings . " 	 Vince Velasquez ( 4 - 7 ) gave up three runs in five innings of three - hit ball . He struck out three and walked one . 	 Pillar homered leading off the fifth off Velasquez to give San Francisco a 3 - 1 lead . Pillar golfed an 0 - 2 slider below his knees for his 15th homer and career - high 60th RBI . 	 The Giants took a 2 - 1 lead on Longoria 's two run homer to left off Velasquez in the second . His 14th homer came on a hanging slider . 	 Longoria 's homer was his first since July 12 . The three - time All - Star missed 19 games with left foot plantar fasciitis . 	 " It really did a lot for the club because first inning
column11: we looked a little flat there
column12: but we woke up because of Longo
column13: " Bochy said . 	 Dickerson 's seventh home run was Samardzija 's only mistake on the day -- a 90 - mph fastball he left over the middle of the plate . It was his third homer since coming over from the Pirates in a July 31 trade . 	 " He has a fastball - cutter combination
column14: " Phillies manager Gabe Kapler said of Samardzija . " It 's difficult to pick up which is which
column15: and he does a really good job of changing eye levels . " 	 Will Smith worked around a hit and walk in the ninth to notch his 28th save in 30 tries . The Giants closer struck out Dickerson swinging with the tying runs on base . 	 Phladelphia lost for the fourth time in five games . 	 HANDLING HARPER 	 Leadoff man Bryce Harper is a career .136 hitter ( 3 for 22 ) against Samardzija after the 2015 NL MVP was hitless in three at - bats against the pitcher . Harper finished the day 0 - for-4 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Giants : RHP Johnny Cueto ( Tommy John surgery ) pitched two innings for the Giants ' Arizona Rookie League affiliate on Friday . The two - time All - Star threw about 20 pitches and hit 92 mph before throwing an additional 15 pitches in the bullpen
column16: manager Bruce Bochy said . He 's expected to throw 40 pitches in a rehab game with Single - A San Jose on Wednesday or Thursday
column17: Bochy said . ... 2B Scooter Gennett stayed in the game after getting hit in the right forearm by a 91.8 - mph two - seam fastball from Velasquez . ... OF Alex Dickerson ( right oblique strain ) will likely start a rehab assignment with Triple - A Sacramento on Tuesday
column18: Bochy said . 	 UP NEXT 	 Phillies : RHP Jake Arrieta ( 8 - 8

column1: DETROIT --   Mike Montgomery finally got Kansas City a win
column2: 11 years after being drafted by the Royals . 	 The 30 - year - old Montgomery struck out a career - high 12 in seven innings as the Royals beat the Detroit Tigers 7 - 0 Saturday . 	 " It took a little while to get my first win as a Royal
column4: " Montgomery said . " We needed this one
column5: which makes it even better . " 	 Montgomery was selected in the first round of the 2008 draft
column6: but went to Tampa Bay in a trade for Wade Davis and James Shields in 2012 . He made his major - league debut with the Mariners in 2015 before winning a World Series ring with the Cubs in 2016 . 	 On July 15
column7: he returned to Kansas City in a trade for catcher Martin Maldonado . 	 " I would have never believed it if you would have told me it would take this long to win for Kansas City
column8: " he said . " I 've had a lot of experiences since I was last with the Royals
column9: so to win this game and do it with a career - high in strikeouts makes it even sweeter . " 	 Jorge Soler homered and scored twice for the Royals
column10: who had lost six of seven . 	 The Tigers were trying to win three straight games for the first time since May 28 - 31
column11: against the Orioles and Braves . 	 " He had a great changeup and he came hard inside on a lot of guys
column12: " Tigers manager Ron Gardenhire said . " We really did n't even hit many balls hard . " 	 Montgomery ( 2 - 5 ) picked up his first win of the year as a starter
column13: allowing four singles without walking a batter . He struck out 10 Royals for Seattle on June 13
column15: " Royals manager Ned Yost said . " You could tell right from the outset that he was on his game . " 	 Spencer Turnbull ( 3 - 10 ) pitched six innings
column16: allowing two runs on three hits and a walk . 	 Neither team had a baserunner until Whit Merrifield singled to start the fourth . Turnbull retired the next two batters before Jorge Soler homered off the brick wall behind the stands in right - center . 	 " I knew he hit it hard

column1: MIAMI --   Martin Prado hit a sacrifice fly that scored Harold Ramirez in the bottom of the 10th inning as the Miami Marlins rallied for a 7 - 6 win over the Atlanta Braves on Saturday night . 	 Playing in front of a season - high home crowd of 29
column3: the Marlins erased a 6 - 2 deficit by scoring four in the bottom of the ninth . 	 Ramirez led off the 10th with a single off Atlanta reliever Sean Newcomb ( 5 - 2 ) . Ramirez advanced two bases on an errant pickoff throw by Newcomb . Prado lifted a fly ball deep to left field that scored Ramirez with the winning run . 	 Jeff Brigham ( 2 - 1 ) pitched a perfect 10th for the win . 	 Miami tied it at 6 in the ninth when Starlin Castro hit a two - run double with the bases loaded off Atlanta reliever Shane Greene . Miami 's Isan Diaz attempted to score from first on the hit but was thrown out at the plate on shortstop Charlie Culberson 's relay throw from left - fielder Adam Duvall . A video review confirmed the call . 	 Braves reliever Mark Melancon started the ninth and got the first out before allowing four consecutive singles that cut Atlanta 's lead to 6 - 3 . Greene relieved Melancon and allowed Diaz 's bases - loaded single . 	 Mike Siroka had a solid outing against the last - place team in the NL East . Soroka pitched seven shutout innings
column6: and walked one . He lowered his ERA to 0.41 against Miami in 2019 . 	 Ozzie Albies hit a two - out double off Miami starter Sandy Alcantara in the eighth that gave the Braves a 1 - 0 lead . In the seventh pitch of the at - bat
column7: Albies hit a shot off Alcantara 's left heel that caromed into left field and allowed Charlie Culberson to score from second . Ronald Acuna Jr. advanced to third . 	 Alcantara was lifted after Albies ' hit
column8: and Freddie Freeman drove the first pitch from reliever Jarlin Garcia into centerfield for a single that scored Acuna and Albies . 	 The outing was Alcantara 's longest since a similar 7 2/3 inning effort at Philadelphia on June 21 . Alcantara allowed three runs
column10: struck out six and walked two . 	 Curtis Granderson 's one - out pinch hit home run off Braves reliever Anthony Swarzak in the eighth got Miami to within 3 - 1 . Luke Jackson relieved Swarzak and allowed Brian Anderson 's run - scoring single before striking out Garrett Cooper to end the inning . 	 Atlanta padded its lead in the ninth when Johan Camargo hit a pinch - hit
column11: three - run homer off Miami reliever Ryne Stanek . Camargo 's blast
column13: landed in the Braves bullpen behind the right - center field fence . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM : 	 Marlins : RHP Jose Urena ( herniated disc ) threw his third bullpen session Friday and manager Don Mattingly said he could soon progress to a rehab start before a possible call - up next month . 	 UP NEXT : 	 Braves : RHP Mike Foltynewicz ( 3 - 5
column14: 6.26 ) will make his second start since being recalled from Triple - A Gwinnett . Once cleared to pitch after beginning the season on the injured list
column15: Foltynewicz was ineffective for most of his 11 starts and got demoted to the minors . 	 Marlins : RHP Hector Noesi ( 0 - 1 . 9.00 ) will start the series finale
column16: five days after his season debut when he allowed five runs in a five - inning effort against the New York Mets . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: BALTIMORE -- Houston manager A. J. Hinch was awestruck by his team 's extraordinary display of power . 	 The Astros are n't showing any type of weakness heading into the final stretch of the season . 	 Rookie Yordan Alvarez hit three of Houston 's six homers and drove in a career - high seven runs to help the Astros to the highest scoring game in franchise history with a 23 - 2 rout of the Baltimore Orioles on Saturday night . 	 " It was obviously a pretty explosive night from the beginning
column2: " Hinch said . " From top to bottom just incredible at - bats
column4: explosive at - bats and ultimately a comfortable win . " 	 The victory was the eighth straight for the Astros
column5: who became the latest team to feast on the reeling Orioles . Baltimore has allowed a major league - leading 240 homers and lost five straight . 	 It was the second 20 - run game in Astros history . Houston also beat the Arizona Diamondbacks 21 - 5 on Oct. 2
column6: 2015 . The 13 extra - base hits set a franchise record . 	 Alex Bregman
column8: and Alvarez set the tone with back - to - back homers in the first inning . Alvarez added the grand slam in the seventh and a two - run shot in the ninth . 	 Jose Altuve hit his fourth home run in his last seven games in the second . Carlos Correa hit another home run an inning later with a 474 - foot shot that cleared the bullpens in straightaway center . 	 " It 's really hard to explain what happened today
column9: " Altuve said . " A great game for us . A lot of good at - bats put together . " 	 Yuli Gurriel tied a career - high with four hits for Houston . 	 Aaron Sanchez ( 5 - 14 ) made his second start for the Astros after being acquired from Toronto on July 31 . He allowed one run and three hits with six strikeouts and three walks over five innings . 	 The Orioles are coming off a series where they tied an MLB record by allowing 16 home runs in three games against the Yankees . Baltimore did not allow multiple homers for the first time in 12 games in the opener against Houston . 	 However
column10: the Astros had a power surge the following night . 	 The Astros took an early 3 - 0 lead off Orioles starter Aaron Brooks ( 2 - 6 ) on a two - run homer by Bergman followed by Alvarez 's solo shot . It was the ninth time Houston has hit back - to - back home runs this season . 	 Houston pulled away with five runs in the second . Josh Reddick started the barrage with an RBI single followed by a two - run homer by Altuve . Bregman had an RBI double and scored on a balk by Brooks . Correa 's solo shot in the third extended the lead to 9 - 1 . 	 Brooks allowed a career - high nine runs and four homers over just three innings . 	 " Just ran into a good offense
column11: did n't execute pitches and had a few things not go my way
column12: " Brooks said . 	 Rio Ruiz managed his first career pinch - hit home run for the Orioles in the seventh . Baltimore outfielder Stevie Wilkerson made his fourth appearance this season as a reliever
column13: allowing three runs in 1 1/3 innings . 	 " By the third inning
column14: probably I was planning how was I going to finish this game
column15: and somehow we finished it
column16: " Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said . 	 MORE MILESTONES 	 Alvarez has 51 RBI through his first 45 career games
column17: the most in major league history over that stretch
column18: surpassing Ted Williams ' record of 47 RBI in his first 45 games in 1939 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : RHP Brad Peacock ( shoulder ) was scheduled to pitch Saturday for Double - A Corpus Christi . Peacock
column19: who has been on the IL since June 28
column20: will pitch again Sunday if there are no setbacks . 	 Orioles : OF DJ Stewart is " symptom - free " after being placed on the 7 - day concussion list with a concussion Tuesday
column21: manager Brandon Hyde said . 	 UP NEXT 	 Astros : Justin Verlander ( 15 - 4

column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   Someone needed to toe the mound for the Minnesota Twins and take control . 	 " Might as well be me
column2: " Jake Odorizzi said . " I kind of pride myself on that . " 	 Odorizzi earned his career - high 13th win and the Twins broke a tie with Cleveland atop the AL Central
column3: beating the Indians 4 - 1 Saturday night to snap a four - game losing streak . 	 The Indians had won the first two in the four - game series at Target Field
column4: tying for the division lead after trailing by 11   1/2 games in early June . 	 The game was delayed 1 hour
column5: 50 minutes at the start by rain . Once it began
column7: leaving a runner in scoring position in every inning he worked . 	 Odorizzi ( 13 - 5 ) scattered five hits and four walks over 5 2/3 shutout innings . 	 " As long as they do n't score
column8: that 's what my job is -- to keep them out from touching home
column10: who has a 1.04 ERA over his last three starts
column11: all Twins victories . 	 Taylor Rogers worked the final two innings for his 18th save of the season . 	 Max Kepler and Marwin Gonzalez homered for the Twins . 	 Yasiel Puig homered
column12: doubled and singled for the Indians
column13: who stranded eight runners in the first four innings and were 0 for 10 with runners in scoring position . 	 " Tip of the cap -- I thought Odorizzi actually pitched fantastic tonight
column14: " Indians second baseman Jason Kipnis said . " We had good at - bats . We had guys on . we just did n't come through . " 	 Adam Plutko ( 4 - 3 ) gave up four runs on nine hits over six innings . 	 " This one 's going to sting for me for a while
column15: " said Plutko
column16: who was cruising through the first three innings before the Twins broke through in the fourth to take the lead . 	 With two outs
column17: Mitch Garver doubled
column18: Luis Arraez tripled and C.J. Cron followed with a single to make it 2 - 0 . 	 Kepler led off the fifth with his 32nd homer of the season
column19: a line drive to left that made the score 3 - 0 . 	 Puig got the Indians on the board with a two - out solo home run in the seventh
column20: a 455 - foot drive off reliever Sergio Romo . But Gonzalez got that back in the bottom half of the inning with a solo shot of his own . 	 DROUGHT RELIEF 	 Arraez 's RBI triple in the fourth gave the Twins their first lead in 40 innings . Their last victory came on Miguel Sano 's walk - off home run against the Braves on Monday . They lost their next four -- two to Atlanta and the first two against Cleveland -- without leading in any of the games . The Twins trailed 11 - 0
column22: 4 - 0 and 6 - 0 in those four losses . 	 ADRIANZA SHINES 	 Ehire Adrianza went 2 for 2 with a walk
column23: but his two biggest contributions were on the defensive end
column24: where he spelled Jorge Polanco at shortstop . First
column25: with Greg Allen on second and two outs in the second
column26: Adrianza made a diving stop of Tyler Naquin 's grounder up the middle to keep Allen from scoring . Odorizzi then retired Francisco Lindor on a weak grounder to first to end the inning and preserve the scoreless tie . 	 " I think the play that AD made changed the game
column27: " Odorizzi said . " It kept the ball in the infield
column28: it kept it scoreless and we know how it played out from there . Little things like that are the things that propel you through outings because there 's a lot of things that go unnoticed by the common person watching the game . " 	 Then in the eighth
column29: after Kipnis led off with a single
column30: Allen hit a hot shot to Cron at first base . Cron 's throw to second was a bit high
column31: but Adrianza caught it on the run
column32: stepped on the base and fired back to first in one motion to complete the double play . Rogers went on to retire the final for Cleveland hitters to close out the win . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Indians : RHP A.J. Cole was placed on the 10 - day IL with a right shoulder impingement . RHP Hunter Wood was recalled from Triple - A Columbus to take his spot on the roster . 	 Twins : Manager Rocco Baldelli said he expects DH Nelson Cruz ( ruptured tendon in wrist ) and RHP Michael Pineda ( right triceps strain ) to travel with the team on next week 's road trip to Milwaukee and Texas . Cruz is scheduled to see a specialist in New York on Monday . Pineda threw a bullpen session on Saturday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Indians : RHP Aaron Civale ( 1 - 1
column33: 0.75 ERA ) will make his third major league start for Cleveland in the season finale Sunday afternoon . Civale threw six scoreless innings against Detroit in his debut on June 22
column34: then gave up one run in six innings in a 1 - 0 loss to Texas on Aug. 5 . 	 Twins : RHP Jose Berrios ( 10 - 6
column35: 3.24 ) is looking to bounce back from the worst start in his career . He allowed nine earned runs in 5 2/3 innings against the Braves on Tuesday . column1: CHICAGO --   Reynaldo Lopez has three keys when he takes the mound : focus
column2: execution and perform . 	 " For me those are the three keys that I trust and that I try to remember every time that I 'm on the field
column3: " he said . 	 It 's working quite well for him at the moment . 	 Lopez pitched shutout ball into the seventh inning
column4: Eloy Jimenez homered on his bobblehead night and the Chicago White Sox beat Tanner Roark and the Oakland Athletics 3 - 2 on Saturday . 	 Lopez ( 7 - 9 ) allowed six hits
column5: struck out three and walked three in his second straight win . The 25 - year - old right - hander improved to 3 - 1 with a 2.13 ERA in his last six starts
column6: continuing one of the best stretches of his career . 	 " I think he 's pitching with a little more urgency
column8: " manager Rick Renteria said . " He 's trusting his stuff again . " 	 Oakland pulled within one when Chad Pinder and Marcus Semien scored on third baseman Ryan Goins ' two - out error in the ninth . But Alex Colome struck out Khris Davis with the bases loaded to earn his 23rd save in 24 chances . 	 " It was a frustrating night
column9: " Oakland center fielder Mark Canha said . " But it shows the character of our team . We always seem to do that and fight back in the ninth . " 	 The Athletics got another solid performance from Roark
column10: but dropped to 2/3 on their weeklong stay in Chicago . The A 's
column11: who are in the mix for an AL wild card
column12: lost two of three against the Cubs before winning 7 - 0 in the series opener against the White Sox on Friday . 	 Roark ( 7 - 8) allowed three runs and six hits in 6 2/3 innings in his second start since he was acquired in a trade with Cincinnati on July 31 . The right - hander
column14: Illinois native who played college ball at the University of Illinois
column15: won his Oakland debut last Sunday
column16: working five effective innings in a 4 - 2 victory over St. Louis . 	 " I just felt like I got beat
column17: " Roark said . " It was a pitcher 's duel for the most part and Lopez came out on top . " 	 Chicago had a 2 - 0 lead when Renteria pulled Lopez after he walked Stephen Piscotty with one out in the seventh . Lopez was saluted with a standing ovation from the crowd of 27
column18: 026 as he walked toward the dugout . 	 A pair of two - out walks loaded the bases for Pinder
column19: who sent a pinch - hit drive off Aaron Bummer toward the gap in right - center . But Jon Jay made a sliding
column20: over - the - shoulder grab to rob Pinder of extra bases . 	 Bummer waited in front of the dugout to greet Jay as he came in from the outfield after the terrific catch . The White Sox also turned three double plays in their fifth win in seven games . 	 " Defense was off the charts tonight
column21: " shortstop Tim Anderson said . 	 Jimenez connected for his 19th homer in the fifth
column22: sending a solo drive over the wall in right - center . The crowd celebrated with their bobbleheads commemorating the rookie 's first career homer April 12 against the New York Yankees . 	 Chicago also scored an unearned run in the third when Leury Garcia stole second and third and came home on catcher Chris Herrmann 's throwing error . Welington Castillo added an RBI single in the seventh . 	 WORTH NOTING 	 The White Sox optioned reliever Jose Ruiz to Triple - A Charlotte after the win . They said they will make a corresponding move before the series finale . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Athletics : C Josh Phegley ( left thumb contusion ) will begin a rehab assignment with Triple - A Las Vegas on Sunday . ... RHP Marco Estrada ( lumbar back strain ) allowed three runs and five hits in 2 2/3 innings in a rehab assignment with Single - A Stockton on Friday . " He gave up a couple home runs
column23: but I think he felt OK
column24: " Oakland manager Bob Melvin said . " Until we get five or six innings with him it 's more about health than anything else . These last few times he 's felt good enough to up the pitch count the next time . " 	 White Sox : 3B Yoan Moncada ( strained right hamstring ) worked out
column25: hit and fielded grounders before the game . " I 've been feeling better
column26: way better
column27: " he said through a translator . " I still have some discomfort
column28: just a little bit
column29: not a big deal . But thank God
column30: I 've been feeling very
column31: very good . I would n't say 100 percent
column32: but much better . " Moncada was placed on the 10 - day injured list Aug. 1 . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox right - hander Lucas Giolito ( 12 - 5
column33: 3.44 ERA ) goes for his second straight win Sunday . He tossed six innings of three - run ball in Chicago 's 7 - 4 victory at Detroit on Monday . Chris Bassitt ( 7 - 5
column34: 3.80 ERA ) pitches for Oakland . The right - hander
column35: who made his major league debut with the White Sox in 2014
column36: is 2 - 1 with a 2.48 ERA in his last five starts . 	 --- 	 Jay Cohen can be reached at https://twitter.com/jcohenap 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: MILWAUKEE --   Milwaukee Brewers pitcher Adrian Houser might just take the woozy feelings he had on the mound Saturday night if he has the same success . 	 Houser struck out a career - high 10 and rookie Keston Hiura hit his 14th home run as the Brewers beat the Texas Rangers 3 - 2 and extended their winning streak to five games . 	 Houser had a similar unsettled feeling in June when he vomited near the mound twice during a relief appearance against the Philadelphia Phillies . 	 Against Texas
column2: he again had to step off the mound for a moment in the first inning . 	 " I felt good
column4: who struck out his first two batters but misplayed a ground ball by Elivs Andrus before the momentary illness . " I did n't feel sick at all . It was kind of like last time . It just snuck up on me . 	 " I have no idea ( what happened )
column5: but if I keep pitching like that
column6: I 'll take it every time . " 	 So will the Brewers
column7: who watched as Houser held the Rangers without another baserunner through four innings . Nomar Mazara led off the fifth with a walk and Logan Forsythe followed with a single to break up the no - hit bid before Houser worked out of the jam . 	 Danny Santana 's one - out solo shot an inning later marked the only blemish of the outing for Houser
column8: who scattered three hits and a walk over six innings . 	 " He pitched a wonderful game
column9: " Brewers manager Craig Counsell said . " From the start
column10: he knew what he was doing and it looked like it was going to be a pretty good night . " 	 Pedro Payano threw a bases - loaded wild pitch that put Milwaukee on the board in the opening inning and lasted just three frames
column11: allowing two runs on five hits and three walks
column12: including a solo home run by Hiura . 	 " He could n't get anything going
column13: " Houston manager Chris Woodward said . " He just could n't find the strike zone . Then
column14: when he did in the third inning
column15: he left some balls over the middle of the plate and got hit . It 's a learning experience for him . " 	 WHOOPS 	 Shin - Soo Choo 's one - out solo home run in the eighth off Drew Pomeranz pulled the Rangers within one
column16: and it looked as if they might at least tie the game after Pomeranz walked the next two batters
column17: bringing up Rougned Odor . 	 Odor worked a 3 - 1 count on Pomeranz before swinging and missing at a pair of fastballs for the second out . Santana and Andrus
column18: meanwhile
column19: had taken off from second and first base
column21: on strike three . Brewers catcher Yasmani Grandal made a perfect throw to get Andrus at second
column22: ending the inning without further damage . 	 " Little miscommunication on running right there
column24: " Woodward said . " Our guys have been running the bases aggressively . So
column25: I 'm not going to fault them for making an aggressive mistake there . Yasmani made a pretty good throw . " 	 ALBERS STEPS IN AGAIN 	 With Josh Hader unavailable after throwing 40 pitches over two innings a night earlier
column26: Counsell turned to Alex Claudio to open the ninth inning . When Claudio allowed a single to left - handed hitting Mazara
column27: Counsell called on Matt Albers to close it out
column28: and the right - hander responded by getting Forsythe to bounce into a double play and pinch - hitter Hunter Pence to ground out to short for his third save of the season . 	 " He 's just doing a tremendous job
column29: " Counsell said . " I 'm happy for him because last year was a struggle but he 's bounced back in a huge way and having a really nice season . We 're counting on him for big stuff and he 's been delivering . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Rangers : LHP Joe Palumbo allowed a run over five innings Friday night in a rehab start with Triple - A Nashville as he continues to work his way back from a strained left foot . The Rangers ' No . 6 prospect coming into the season
column30: Palumbo posted an 11.00 ERA in three big league appearances
column31: but is 2 - 0 with a 3.25 ERA and 1.19 WHIP in 16 games ( 15 starts ) for Nashville and Double - A Frisco this season with 101 strikeouts in 72 2/3 innings of work . 	 " We 'll see him at some point
column32: I just do n't know when
column33: " manager Chris Woodward said . " He 's getting closer . " 	 Brewers : Christian Yelich said he was " better than ( he ) was yesterday " but sat out for a fifth straight game due to a recent bout of back spasms . Manager Craig Counsell said he was n't sure yet if Yelich would return Sunday
column34: a possibility with the Brewers scheduled to get Monday off . 	 " Let 's see how he 's doing
column35: " Counsell said . 	 UP NEXT 	 The series wraps up Sunday with Milwaukee RHP Jordan Lyles ( 7 - 7
column36: 4.97 ERA ) taking on Rangers LHP Mike Minor ( 10 - 6
column37: 3.06 ) . Lyles has a 1.80 in two starts for the Brewers
column38: who acquired him from Pittsburgh ahead of the trade deadline
column39: while Minor is 2 - 2 with a 5.24 ERA in five starts since the All - Star break . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: NEW YORK -- As Mets rookie Luis Guillorme stepped in to lead off the eighth inning
column2: teammate J.D. Davis was in the clubhouse
column3: studying video of Washington 's struggling bullpen . He had just queued up tape of Daniel Hudson -- a hard - throwing right - hander warming in the bullpen -- when he heard a roar from down the tunnel . 	 It was hard to imagine a few weeks back
column4: but this fervor in Flushing is making waves across the National League . 	 " We have all the confidence in the world right now with us
column5: " Davis said . " But some things that we 're doing right now
column6: we 're surprising ourselves . " 	 Guillorme picked a perfect time for his first big league homer -- a tying shot to start the eighth -- Davis added a go - ahead sacrifice fly a few batters later
column7: and New York worked its magic again
column8: beating the Nationals 4 - 3 on Saturday for a season - best eighth straight victory . 	 The Mets have won 15 of 16 and are on their best roll since a 16 - 1 run in 1990 . They pulled within a half - game of Washington for the first wild card and will try for a three - game sweep on Sunday -- just a month after having the second - worst record in the National League . 	 They did it by beating Washington 's bullpen for the second consecutive night . Juan Soto put the Nats ahead 3 - 2 with his second home run of the game in the eighth inning
column9: but Guillorme countered with a pinch - hit no - doubter off Fernando Rodney in the bottom of the inning . Guillorme entered with a .192 average in 56 major league games
column10: and sold - out Citi Field had already erupted before he realized the line drive would easily clear the fence . 	 " I think it took a split - second to know
column12: who had the home run ball waiting in his locker . " I do n't hit many of those . It was a great feeling . " 	 Mets manager Mickey Callaway said a home run was " toward the end " of his list of potential outcomes for Guillorme in that spot . 	 " You just want a good at - bat
column13: whether he makes him throw some pitches
column15: or single
column16: " Callaway said . " But we 'll take the homer . " 	 After two more Mets reached against Rodney ( 0 - 5 )
column17: manager Dave Martinez went to Hudson . The right - hander got one out
column18: intentionally walked slugger Pete Alonso
column19: and then Davis drove an 0 - 2 pitch to deep right field that brought in newcomer Joe Panik for the tiebreaking run . 	 Wilson Ramos
column21: followed with a two - out drive to right - center
column22: but Victor Robles made a leaping catch against the wall to end the inning . 	 It was the second consecutive blown save for Washington 's bullpen and 22nd this season
column23: tying the Mets for most in the majors . Closer Sean Doolittle allowed four runs in the ninth inning of a 7 - 6 loss on Friday . 	 " We 've got to come back tomorrow and will it
column24: " Martinez said . " I told the boys
column25: ' Hey
column26: we 've got to will it tomorrow . " 	 Soto hit a two - run drive in the first inning against Noah Syndergaard
column27: and the 2 - 0 lead held until Davis and Ramos hit consecutive solo shots off Patrick Corbin in the fourth . 	 Soto struck again in the eighth against Seth Lugo ( 5 - 2 )
column28: ending the reliever 's string of 14 consecutive scoreless appearances . Lugo got two outs to tie the Mets ' record with 26 consecutive batters retired before Soto hit a no - doubter to right field . 	 Soto has 24 homers this season
column29: and the 20 - year - old already has four career multihomer games . 	 " He 's feeling the energy
column30: " Martinez said . " He 's very poised
column31: he goes out there
column32: and he 's getting pitches to hit . He 's taking pitches that he should be taking . He 's doing really well . " 	 Lugo also pitched the ninth as All - Star closer Edwin Diaz warmed in the bullpen . Callaway said he wanted to ride the converted starting pitcher
column33: figuring he 'd be unavailable Sunday regardless . Diaz has had his struggles in the closer role this year
column34: but Callaway said he would be New York 's go - to reliever if it faces a save situation Sunday . 	 Fans lined up outside Citi Field five hours before first pitch
column35: and many stood and clapped for lineup introductions as if it were Opening Day . The buzz died a bit after Soto 's first - inning homer
column36: but Davis and Ramos got it rocking again in the fourth . The park had an October feel the rest of the night . 	 " I think it 's pretty reminiscent of what happened in 2015
column37: " said Syndergaard
column38: referencing New York 's run to the World Series
column39: in which it lost to Kansas City . 	 Aside from homers by Davis and Ramos
column40: Corbin allowed only one other hit . He struck out eight over six innings . 	 Syndergaard
column41: pitching to Ramos for the first time since June 15
column42: threw seven innings of two - run ball with five strikeouts and seven hits allowed . 	 GOOD HANDS 	 Quality control coach Luis Rojas presented New York 's lineup card to umpires during a seven - game winning streak from July 25 to Aug. 1 . A game after the string ended
column43: Callaway passed the responsibility to third - base coach Gary DiSarcina and challenged him to do better . New York started this eight - game run that day . 	 " Call me superstitious
column44: but I think it 's about who takes the card out
column45: " Callaway said . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Nationals : RHP Max Scherzer ( mild strain in upper back ) threw a 36 - pitch bullpen at nearly full effort and came out feeling well . The club will evaluate him Sunday before determining the next step
column46: but manager Dave Martinez said Scherzer will likely throw at least one more bullpen before getting into a game . 	 Mets : OF Tim Tebow is expected to miss the rest of the minor league season due to a cut on his left hand . The 31 - year - old hit .163 in 77 games during his first season with Triple - A Syracuse but has n't played since July 21 after injuring himself while fielding a ball in the outfield . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mets ace Jacob deGrom ( 7 - 7
column47: 2.77 ) is 3 - 0 with a 1.35 ERA in his past six starts . He 'll try to stay hot against National RHP Anibal Sanchez ( 7 - 6
column48: 3.67 ) in Sunday 's series finale . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column1: CINCINNATI --   Rookie Aristides Aquino is n't keeping mementos from his prodigious power display
column2: the one reminding everyone of another Reds outfielder who wore No . 44 and slashed homers with a whiplash swing . 	 After taking so long to get this far
column3: the thrills are enough . 	 Aquino homered in his first three at - bats
column4: tied a major league record for homers by a newcomer
column5: and matched Eric Davis ' rookie mark Saturday night during a 10 - 1 victory over the mesmerized Chicago Cubs
column6: who have watched him wallop everything thrown his way . 	 " Is it him or is it Eric Davis ? " Cubs manager Joe Maddon said . " I do n't know . Same number . He used to do that kind of stuff . Give him credit . He did n't miss anything . He has n't missed anything this series . " 	 The 25 - year - old outfielder got his chance when fan favorite Yasiel Puig was traded to the Indians on July 31 . He 's become an overnight sensation in Cincinnati . 	 " I could go on and on about him
column7: " manager David Bell said . " We knew he 'd have success
column8: but not like this . " 	 Aquino connected in the second and third innings off Kyle Hendricks ( 8 - 9 ) and again in the fourth off Dillon Maples
column9: becoming the first major league rookie to homer in three consecutive innings in one game . His seven homers in his first major league 10 games ties Trevor Story 's record with the Rockies in 2016 . 	 And that 's not all . 	 He joined Davis -- the Reds ' center fielder on their 1990 World Series title team -- as the only Cincinnati rookies to homer in four straight games . Davis did it in 1984 . 	 " I 'm enjoying the moment
column10: " Aquino said . 	 So are Reds fans who have a new
column11: unexpected rooting interest . Aquino spent six years at rookie or Single - A ball struggling to hit
column12: but a change that opened his stance helped him become an International League All - Star in line for his promotion . 	 His third homer brought a curtain call and a standing ovation when he returned to the field . The 39
column13: 866 fans had one of the most revered records in mind in his last two plate appearances . 	 Eighteen players have hit four homers in a game
column14: a feat that 's never been achieved by a rookie . J.D. Martinez was the last to homer four times
column15: on Sept. 4
column17: for Arizona . Scooter Gennett homered four times for the Reds at Great American Ball Park on June 6
column18: 2017 . 	 Fans booed as Alec Mills walked him in the sixth
column19: throwing a breaking ball on a 3 - 0 count . Mills fanned Aquino on a low breaking ball to end the seventh
column20: but the outfielder got another round of applause as he returned to the dugout . 	 " That 's why I 'm out there
column21: for the fans to enjoy the game
column22: " Aquino said . 	 The Reds hit six home runs overall and piled up 18 hits while moving six games behind the NL Central - leading Cubs . Eugenio Suarez hit his 32nd and Nick Senzel and Kyle Farmer also connected . Sonny Gray ( 6 - 6 ) allowed two hits in six innings and singled home a pair of runs . 	 BAD NIGHT 	 Hendricks suffered his worst loss since returning from a sore shoulder on July 2 . Hendricks gave up seven runs and a season - high 12 hits in only 2 2/3 innings
column23: his shortest since he went the same distance against the Dodgers on June 27 last season . 	 " Did n't go great at all
column24: " he said . 	 THREE PEAT 	 Aquino is the second Red to hit three homers this season
column25: joining Derek Dietrich . The club record for homers in consecutive games is five
column26: accomplished eight times
column27: including by Suarez last season . 	 ROAD WOES 	 The Cubs brought their white home jerseys and hung them in their lockers at Great American
column28: hoping their Wrigley Field success would finally translate to the road . So far
column29: it 's not working . Chicago has dropped 13 of its last 19 on the road
column30: leaving it 22 - 35 overall away from home . 	 PRICE PAID 	 Reds reliever Jared Hughes completed his three - game suspension for his role in a brawl with the Pirates on July 30
column31: one of eight suspensions handed down . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cubs : Reliever Steve Cishek went on the 10 - day injured list with a sore left hip
column32: joining relievers Craig Kimbrel ( inflamed right knee ) and Brandon Kintzler ( sore chest muscle ) on the list . 	 Reds : Shortstop Jose Iglesias got a day of rest for a sore right biceps . He could return for the final game of the series . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cubs : Jon Lester ( 9 - 8) gave up 11 runs -- matching his career high -- in his last start against Oakland . In his last two starts
column33: the left - hander has slowed 14 earned runs in nine innings . 	 Reds : Luis Castillo ( 11 - 4 ) has won his last two starts
column34: allowing three runs in 14 innings while beating the Pirates and Angels . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: ST . LOUIS --   Adam Wainwright got off to a rocky start when his first pitch sailed over the right field wall . 	 The rest of the game
column2: that went a lot better . 	 Wainwright tossed six scoreless innings after Adam Frazier 's leadoff home run
column3: and the St. Louis Cardinals beat the Pittsburgh Pirates 3 - 1 Saturday night . 	 For the 37 - year - old Wainwright
column4: it 's been a season of satisfaction after being sidetracked in the past with troubles in his right arm . 	 " It feels nice to be able to go out there
column7: and see a number you used to see when I was pitching
column8: " Wainwright said . " It 's good to execute . " 	 The contending Cardinals won their second in a row after ending a five - game losing streak . 	 " Give him the credit
column9: " Cardinals manager Mike Shildt said . " He had good tempo
column12: engaged your defense . This is not a real big secret
column13: we 're always going to play better defense when our pitchers have that rhythm . " 	 Wainwright ( 8 - 8) allowed six hits and struck out eight . He improved to 6 - 2 this season at home . 	 " It 's fun when you can play his curveball with the 93 mile per hour fastball
column14: " catcher Matt Wieters said . " We had a lot of success . " 	 Giovanny Gallegos pitched 2 1/3 innings of scoreless relief before yielding to Carlos Martinez
column15: who got two outs for his 12th save in 15 chances . 	 Joe Musgrove ( 8 - 11 ) gave up three runs in 5 1/3 innings to fall to 0 - 4 against St. Louis this season . He is the first Pirates pitcher with four losses to the Cardinals in a single season since Ryan Vogelsong went 0 - 4 in 2004 . 	 Pittsburgh has lost seven in a row and dropped 23 of 27 games since the All - Star Break . 	 " We ca n't catch a break right now
column16: " Musgrove said . " We hit the ball hard in a lot of situations tonight with runners on base and either hit it right at somebody or they made a good play . " 	 Tommy Edman doubled in the Cardinals sixth and scored the go - ahead run when shortstop Kevin Newman 's relay throw to third evaded Colin Moran and rolled into the Pittsburgh dugout . 	 " The throw needs more conviction
column17: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " The ball needs to get there . It needs to be not a short - hop bounce . Moran got caught in between and at the end of the day if you 're a third baseman you 've got to do everything you can to keep the ball in front of you . We were n't able to do that . Third part of it
column18: Musgrove 's got to be backing up . " 	 Paul Goldschmidt followed with a single
column19: Marcell Ozuna doubled and Paul DeJong hit an RBI single . 	 St. Louis made it 1 - all when Ozuna grounded into a double play with the bases loaded and no out for the second straight night in the bottom of the first . 	 FLASHING LEATHER 	 St. Louis has not committed an error in a season - best eight consecutive games for its best stretch since going 10 games without a miscue from June 10 - 20
column20: 2017 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Pirates : C Francisco Cervelli has been cleared to return to catching and will begin a rehab assignment with Double - A Altoona Sunday . He has not played since suffering a concussion on May 25 against the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 Cardinals : OF Tyler O'Neill received an injection in his left wrist as he continues to recover from a strain that sent him to the injured list retroactive to Aug. 1 . Shildt expects O'Neill will go out on a rehab assignment once the injection takes effect Monday or Tuesday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Pirates LHP Stephen Brault ( 3 - 1
column21: 4.09 ERA ) opposes Cardinals RHP Miles Mikolas ( 7 - 12
column22: 3.94 ) in Sunday 's series finale . Brault is 2 - 0 with a 3.35 ERA in 10 starts this season and will be making his second start since being activated from the injured list . Mikolas is 2/3 with a 1.59 ERA and has not allowed more than two runs in any of his five career starts against Pittsburgh at Busch Stadium . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: SAN DIEGO --   The San Diego Padres ' outfielders could n't have come through any bigger than they did in beating the staggering Colorado Rockies on Saturday night . 	 Center fielder Manuel Margot hit a go - ahead
column2: two - run homer in the eighth inning and right fielder Hunter Renfroe had a homer among his three extra - base hits and scored four runs to help the Padres win 8 - 5 . 	 Rookie left fielder Josh Naylor reached base three times and scored once
column3: and Wil Myers had a pinch - hit homer in the eighth . 	 " There were a lot of guys did a lot of good things in the outfield today . It was huge for us
column4: " manager Andy Green said . " It 's going to be a tough decision tomorrow . I do n't have four spots out there . We have three . But all those guys did a great job . I 'm really happy for Manny Margot . " 	 Margot 's 10th homer came an inning after Yonder Alonso hit a tying
column7: who have lost five straight and 19 of their last 25 to drop a season - worst 13 games under .500 . 	 Renfroe drew a leadoff walk in the eighth off Jairo Diaz ( 4 - 3 ) and Margot then homered to left . Myers homered with two outs off Jake McGee
column8: his 14th . 	 " It was really exciting because you 're able to give the team the lift that it needs
column9: " Margot said through a translator . 	 All four outfielders have played well since the Padres traded Franmil Reyes and his 27 home runs to the Cleveland Indians on July 31 as part of a three - way deal that sent Trevor Bauer to Cincinnati . 	 " We believe in all of them
column10: and have and that 's why we felt comfortable doing that
column11: " Green said . " Even as much as we love the guy who walked out the door that day
column12: we believe in that group as a whole . Wil is starting to come back to life and it made a lot of sense for us . We know for us to be as good as we can be
column13: we have to have a lefty in that mix . We trust Josh 's bat a lot . " 	 Naylor batted second Saturday night . 	 " It 's a big deal for us to have a little bit more balance in the lineup and not just be running eight righties out there sometimes
column14: " Green said . 	 Rookie Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a triple to extend his hitting streak to a career - best 14 games for the Padres
column15: who have won the first three games of this four - game series and four of five overall . 	 Andres Munoz ( 1 - 1 ) pitched the eighth for the win and All - Star Kirby Yates worked the ninth for his 33rd save . 	 Renfroe hit a tying home run in the fourth inning and an RBI double in the three - run fifth . 	 San Diego 's Manny Machado
column16: Alonso 's brother - in - law
column17: hit an RBI double to snap an 0 - for-19 slump . 	 Padres rookie right - hander Chris Paddack left after six with a 5 - 3 lead . Craig Stammen started the seventh and promptly allowed Chris Iannetta 's double to right followed by Alonso 's homer that just cleared the wall in right as Hunter Renfroe leaped for it . 	 It was the second pinch - hit homer of Alonso 's career
column18: his ninth overall this season and his second with the Rockies . He was released by the Chicago White Sox on July 3 and signed to a minor league contract by the Rockies on July 10 . His contract was selected from Triple - A Albuquerque on July 23 . 	 " It was a tough at - bat
column19: " Alonso said . " Got in there with two strikes and he was able to hang a curveball and I was able to put a good swing on it . That 's what you have to do as a bench player . You 've got to understand the situation . You 've got to be ready at all times . " 	 Nolan Arenado gave the Rockies a 2 - 1 lead with his 26th homer
column20: a 399 - foot shot off Paddack into the balcony on the third level of the Western Metal Supply Co. Building in the left - field corner with one out in the fifth . 	 Renfroe tied it leading off the bottom of the inning with a moonshot homer into the stands in left
column21: his 31st . 	 " Could n't keep it
column22: " Rockies manager Bud Black said . " We 'd get a run
column23: they got a run . We get a run
column24: they get a run . It 's a little frustrating . Our starting pitching has not been able to really go back out there and put a zero up after we score . " 	 The Padres added three runs on four hits off Chi Chi Gonzalez in the fifth to take a 5 - 2 lead . Naylor and Machado hit consecutive one - out doubles . With two outs
column25: Renfroe hit an RBI double and scored on Margot 's single . 	 The Rockies got one back in the sixth when Trevor Story hit a one - out double and scored on Arenado 's two - out single . They loaded the bases but could n't add on . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : Announced LHP Jose Castillo will miss the rest of the season after injuring the middle finger on his pitching hand Thursday night . Castillo was activated from the 60 - day injured list earlier Thursday and lasted just four batters before getting hurt . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rockies : RHP German Marquez ( 10 - 5

column1: LOS ANGELES --   Kenta Maeda 's confidence was waning after going more than two months without a win and he knew he had to make some changes . The Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher made his adjustments between starts and
column3: appeared dominant . 	 The Japanese right - hander allowed only three hits over seven innings and struck out six as the Dodgers defeated Arizona 4 - 0 Saturday . 	 " Tonight
column4: to give us seven strong innings
column7: " manager Dave Roberts said . " More importantly
column8: it was good for our ballclub and our confidence . " 	 Maeda admitted his mechanics were off the last two months as he went 0 - 6 in his previous 11 starts . The last three were his worst of the season
column9: allowing 14 runs ( 13 earned ) in 11 innings . 	 Maeda ( 8 - 8) made two big adjustments going into Saturday 's start -- he adjusted his arm slot so that it was higher and he was more aggressive with his fastball early . 	 He retired the side in order his first time through the lineup before Jarrod Dyson led off the fourth with a single . Ketel Marte was the only Arizona player to reach scoring position when he singled to left
column10: stole second with two outs and advanced to third on a wild pitch . The shortstop failed to score as Maeda struck out David Peralta to end the frame . 	 " By getting the win tonight I was able to bring myself up and feel more confident
column12: who pitched seven or more scoreless innings in a start for the fifth time in his career . " I was able to mix in everything tonight . The fastball conviction was there and I was able to execute my game plan . " 	 Maeda also helped his cause at the plate with a pair of sacrifice bunts
column13: including one in the fourth inning in which Corey Seager beat pitcher Alex Young 's throw to home plate
column14: extending Los Angeles ' lead to 4 - 0 . 	 Caleb Ferguson
column15: Joe Kelly and Kenley Jansen pitched the final two innings as the Dodgers recorded their major - league leading 13th shutout of the season and second of the homestand . 	 " He just was throwing balls off the edge of the plate
column16: crowding us when he needed to at the right time
column17: and just really did n't give us a chance to get some extension and do the things that we do best
column18: " Arizona manager Torey Lovullo said of Maeda . 	 Max Muncy homered and Russell Martin had two hits and drove in a run for the Dodgers
column19: who have won seven of nine on their current homestand . 	 Muncy 's solo shot to center off Young in the second inning broke a three - game home run drought . It was only the second homer in the last 16 games for Muncy
column20: who had gone deep four times in the first eight games after the All - Star break . 	 Young ( 4 - 2 ) surrendered four runs on five hits over 3 1/3 innings . The rookie left - hander had allowed only four earned runs in 18 2/3 innings on the road coming into the game . 	 " I was just trying to be too perfect
column21: and I feel like I was in an uphill battle from basically the third inning on
column22: " Young said . " I 'm just not hitting my spots . I 'm just trying to nibble at the corners where most of the time I throw where I want to . " 	 BLUE HEAVEN ? column23: who entered the game in the fourth inning

column26: in a game that included a bench - clearing postgame confrontation between the NL West rivals . Cooler heads prevailed 24 hours later
column27: with no incidents or retaliatory pitches . 	 " I do n't personally believe in it

column29: " Arizona first baseman Jake Lamb said . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Dodgers : RHP Ross Stripling is likely to return as a reliever once he is able to recover from a sore neck . column1: SEATTLE --   Mike Zunino 's return to Seattle could n't have gone much better . 	 Zunino started at catcher for the Tampa Bay Rays on Saturday
column2: his first game in Seattle since being traded by the Mariners this offseason . He received cheers when he was announced before his first at - bat
column3: and he hit a three - run homer to center in his second at - bat
column4: the biggest blast in Tampa Bay 's 5 - 4 win . 	 " That one was a good one
column5: " Zunino said . " It 's time to close a chapter and open up a new one . " 	 It was Zunino 's eighth home run of the season
column6: and his third in the last six games . 	 " I think I finally stumbled across something that 's working
column7: " he said . 	 Kevin Kiermaier and Avisail Garcia also went deep for Tampa Bay . 	 Zunino said he talked with some of the Seattle fans in the standing - room area ringing the bullpen before the game
column8: and watched the pregame ceremony honoring Hall of Famer Edgar Martinez
column9: who worked with Zunino as Seattle 's hitting coach . Zunino appreciated the warm reception he got from the Mariners fans
column10: but there was no question what was the best part of the night . 	 " I was so happy for him
column11: " Rays starter Charlie Morton said . " For Z to come back here and do what he did tonight
column12: it 's pretty special . " 	 Morton ( 12 - 4 ) gave up four runs on a season - high nine hits
column13: and struck out 10 in six innings . 	 " I gave up a bunch of runs and a bunch of hits
column14: so it 's hard to feel really good about it
column15: " Morton said . " But at the same time
column16: I did n't walk anybody
column17: I struck a bunch of people out -- I really do n't know how to feel about that one . " 	 Kiermaier followed Zunino 's fifth - inning homer with his solo shot
column18: and Garcia led off the sixth with his 16th home run . 	 Seattle used reliever Matt Wisler as an opener . He pitched two scoreless innings before giving way to Tommy Milone ( 1 - 7 ) . Milone allowed five runs on six hits
column19: including three home runs . 	 The Mariners scored first on Lopes ' sacrifice fly in the second

column21: Mallex Smith tripled and scored on J.P. Crawford 's groundout
column22: and Omar Narvaez hit his 17th home run
column23: cutting the deficit to 4 - 3 . Lopes also had a run - scoring single in the bottom of the seventh . 	 You score four runs you think you 're in pretty good shape
column24: " Seattle manager Scott Servais said . " The guys hung in there
column25: battled
column26: did some decent things
column27: but just a little bit short . " 	 HONORING EDGAR 	 Edgar Martinez was honored before the game for his recent induction into the Hall of Fame . During the ceremony
column28: Mariners chairman John Stanton announced the team will erect a statue of Martinez outside of T - Mobile Park for next season . 	 ROSTER MOVE 	 Mariners 2B Dee Gordon
column29: recovered from a left quad strain

column1: BOSTON --   Anthony Bemboom finally lived his dream after a long day and a longer journey back to the Los Angeles Angels . 	 Bemboom hit a go - ahead single in the 10th inning after Kole Calhoun 's solo homer tied it in the eighth
column2: leading the Angels past the Boston Red Sox 5 - 4 Sunday for a split of their four - game series . 	 Called up earlier in the day from Triple - A Salt Lake
column3: Bemboom flew into Boston from Des Moines
column5: arrived around noon and showed up at Fenway Park about 20 minutes before the first pitch . 	 A little less than 4 1/2 hours later
column6: he grounded his hit to right . 	 " That 's something you dream about -- think about when you get drafted with the team . In a way it happened
column8: standing in front of his black and gold Salt Lake Bees ' equipment bag lying on the floor . 	 He was drafted by Los Angeles in the 22nd round of the 2012 amateur draft . After being taken by Colorado in the 2016 Rule 5 draft
column9: he became a free agent and signed with Tampa Bay . 	 The 29 - year - old catcher was up with the Rays earlier this year before Los Angeles purchased him from the Rays on July 16 . 	 " We would n't have won it without him
column10: " Angels manager Brad Ausmus said . 	 Shohei Ohtani had three hits with a two - run single for Los Angeles
column11: which won for only the second time in 10 games . The Angels had halted an eight - game losing streak Saturday and finished a nine - game trip 2 - 7 . 	 Christian Vazquez hit a two - run homer for Boston
column12: which rallied from an early 3 - 0 hole . Rafael Devers added two hits and started the front end of nifty 5 - 4 - 3 double play
column13: making a backhanded stab on Albert Pujols ' hard grounder . 	 " It 's something we 've been doing the whole season . We 've been talking about it
column15: " Boston manager Alex Cora said of the split . " That way
column16: it 's tough to make it to the playoffs . " 	 The defending World Series champion Red Sox have blown 22 saves
column17: tied for most in the majors
column18: and are currently out a playoff spot . 	 Calhoun hit his leadoff homer off reliever Matt Barnes after Boston 's bullpen held the Angels scoreless on two hits over 5 1/3 innings following a rough start by Andrew Cashner . 	 Bemboom hit his single off Ryan Weber ( 1 - 2 ) after Calhoun had a leadoff walk and advanced on a ground out and fly out . 	 Hansel Robles ( 4 - 0 ) got four outs for the victory . 	 Making his second big league start
column19: Angels left - hander Patrick Sandoval gave up four runs in 4 2/3 innings . He was lifted with the bases loaded before Boston took a 4 - 3 lead on Max Stassi 's passed ball on Ty Buttrey 's pitch . 	 Los Angeles had built their edge with a run in the first on Pujols ' double - play and Ohtani 's single in the second before the Red Sox tied it . 	 Jackie Bradley Jr. drew a base - loaded walk in the second and Vazquez 's shot -- that completely left Fenway Park over the Green Monster -- tied it in the fourth . 	 NICE GIFT 	 After Red Sox lefty Chris Sale finished his off - day throwing in the outfield and signed some autographs for fans in the stands along the right - field line about an hour before the game
column20: he noticed a young boy in a wheelchair off in the distance with his mom and dad . 	 Sale approached the 6 - year - old -- named Joey -- chatted for a while and gave him his glove before heading back into the clubhouse . 	 WILD THING 	 Cashner got just five outs
column21: giving up three runs and three hits
column22: walking five and left to loud boos when he was pulled . 	 " It was tough . I did n't really command my fastball
column23: " he said . " Five walks is never good . Did n't give us really a chance to win
column24: but amazing job by the bullpen today . " 	 THAT 'S PEACHY 	 Marie Mansfield Kelley
column25: who played for the Rockford Peaches of the women 's professional baseball league from 1950 - 54
column26: threw out the ceremonial first pitch . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : Pujols was back in the lineup after having Saturday off . ... C Kevan Smith was placed on the 10 - day injured list with a lumbar strain and Bemboom was recalled from Triple - A. 	 Red Sox : OF Mookie Betts had the day off before entering as a pinch runner and popping out in the 10th . ... Selected infielder Chris Owings from Triple - A Pawtucket and optioned RHP Hector Velazquez . The 27 - year - old Owings was signed as a minor league free agent on June 17 and hit .325 with 11 homers in 44 games with Pawtucket . He batted leadoff with Betts out and went 0 for 5 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Angels : LHP Jose Saurez ( 2 - 3
column27: 6.22 ERA ) is slated to start the opener of a three - game series against Pittsburgh at Angels Stadium . It 's the Pirates ' first visit since 2013 . 	 Red Sox : LHP Eduardo Rodriguez ( 13 - 5
column28: 4.17 ) is in line to start the opener of a three - game series in Cleveland on Monday . The Red Sox are 17 - 4 in his last 22 starts ( with a suspended game on Wednesday included ) . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: BALTIMORE -- Justin Verlander lasted only five innings against the Baltimore Orioles and walked off the mound in position to take his first loss since early July . 	 His struggle foreshadowed the shocking end of both the game and Houston 's lengthy winning streak . 	 Rio Ruiz hit a two - run homer with two outs in the ninth to carry Baltimore to an 8 - 7 victory Sunday
column2: snapping the Orioles ' five - game skid . 	 Houston scored three runs in the top of the ninth to go up 7 - 5 before the Orioles answered in the bottom half against closer Roberto Osuna ( 3 - 3 ) . After Chris Davis hit a sacrifice fly
column3: Chance Sisco was at first base when Ruiz launched a 2 - 2 pitch over the right - field wall . 	 " I knew that I got it
column4: " Ruiz said . " I kind of looked in the dugout
column5: saw everybody going crazy and I went crazy . Pretty awesome feeling . " 	 Osuna gave up a double and a homer and hit a batter in his fifth blown save . 	 " The guys did a great job coming back and get the lead and expected me to get the job done
column6: " Osuna said . " Not being able to do that
column7: it 's a bad day . " 	 Coming off a 23 - 2 defeat less than 24 hours earlier
column8: Baltimore took the lead in the fifth against Verlander
column9: the 2011 Cy Young winner and an eight - time All - Star who gave up four runs and a season - high nine hits . 	 Baltimore 's offense exploded in the ninth against Osuna
column10: who came in with 26 saves . The loss ended the Astros ' eight - game win streak and was only their fourth loss in 22 games . 	 " When you 're playing great baseball it seems like the losses even hurt that much more
column11: " Verlander said . " We put ourselves in a position to win ; our guys did a fantastic job battling back . Just one pitch early in the game
column12: a couple pitches that I made that were mistakes . 	 " But I think sometimes you 've got to look at the bigger picture and understand that we 're playing good baseball . Do n't let this be too much of a Debbie downer
column13: " he added . 	 Houston trailed by two runs in the seventh and 5 - 4 in the ninth before striking against Mychal Givens . George Springer led off with a single and went to second when Jose Altuve beat out a bunt . Michael Brantley followed with a liner that rolled into the right - field corner . Anthony Santander fumbled with the ball and botched the throw
column14: earning an error while Brantley ended his foray around the bases with a head - first slide . 	 Richard Bleier ( 3 - 0 ) finished the inning
column15: and turned out to be the winning pitcher in a game that concluded a homestand that featured three losses to the Yankees and two more against Houston
column16: including that 23 - 2 debacle on Saturday night . 	 " It was a fun way to win a game
column17: a fun way to get out of the homestand
column18: " said Jace Peterson
column19: who had three hits and two RBI . " Obviously
column20: this homestand did n't go as we wanted it to ( but ) to leave here with a win like that over a team like that is great . " 	 Carlos Correa hit a three - run homer for the Astros
column21: whose ninth - inning surge enabled Verlander to keep his five - game winning streak intact . The right - hander struck out 11 to reach double digits in a fifth consecutive outing but also gave up at least one hit every inning . 	 " Very unusual for him to go five innings and be out of the game
column23: " Astros manager AJ Hinch said . 	 4 K DAVIS 	 Davis struck out four times to bring his total for the season to 118 . With Davis leading the way
column24: the Orioles struck out 16 times . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : RHP Brad Peacock ( shoulder ) threw 16 pitches for Triple - A Round Rock on Saturday and was slated to throw 15 - 20 pitches Sunday for the same club . " We did n't want to extend him too far pitch - wise ( Saturday )
