column1: PITTSBURGH --   Kris Bryant heard a voice from the crowd just before he homered to put the Chicago Cubs ahead in the seventh inning Saturday . 	 After committing an error at third base each of the previous two innings
column2: Bryant watched Steven Brault lift his leg . That 's when he could just make out what a fan had shouted . 	 " He was making fun of me because I made two errors
column3: " Bryant said . " I hit a home run . " 	 The Cubs certainly appreciated Bryant 's contribution . After getting out of three bases - loaded jams
column4: Chicago snapped a four - game skid with a 2 - 0 win over the Pittsburgh Pirates . The Cubs moved back into a first - place tie in the NL Central when St. Louis lost to Cincinnati later Saturday . 	 Bryant
column5: who also walked in the ninth
column6: drove the first pitch of the seventh from Brault ( 3 - 2 ) into the left - field bleachers to give Chicago a 1 - 0 lead . It was Bryant 's 25th homer this season and third in five games . 	 " ( Bryant ) deserves a lot of credit for coming back the way he did
column7: " Cubs manager Joe Maddon said . " Even his last at - bat
column9: but to draw that walk on ( Francisco ) Liriano was a nice at - bat . " 	 Jon Lester ( 10 - 8) gave up four hits and five walks in six innings after allowing Pittsburgh to load the bases with one out in the first and nobody out in the fifth . He got Kevin Newman to fly out to right in the fifth before striking out Bryan Reynolds and getting out of it when Starling Marte flied to center . 	 " I think
column11: I got out of my hard - headedness as far as challenging guys
column12: falling behind in counts and kind of giving in
column13: " Lester said . " I feel like that 's really bitten me in the rear end this year as far as still thinking I can throw my heater by guys . ... Regardless of the baserunners
column14: I knew I just could n't give in and throw a heater . " 	 Pittsburgh stranded 11 runners and fell to 7 - 26 since the All - Star break . It loaded the bases a third time with two outs in the seventh . 	 After Ian Happ fully extended in left field to catch a sharp line drive from Reynolds for the second out with runners on first and second
column15: Cubs reliever Tyler Chatwood hit Marte with a pitch . Josh Bell bounced to second to end the inning . 	 " At the end of the day
column16: I think we were 0 for 12 with men in scoring position
column17: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " We left 11 men on base and 0 for 6 with the bases loaded . Pretty much wraps up the story for today . " 	 Happ scored from third on a throwing error by catcher Elias Diaz in the eighth . 	 Rowan Wick came in after Chatwood walked Adam Frazier to lead off the ninth . He retired each of the three batters he faced for his first major league save . 	 Brault did n't allow a hit until Addison Russell singled to third with one out in the fifth . He reached career highs in innings pitched with seven and strikeouts with eight
column18: and allowed one run on two hits with one walk . 	 " You 've got two major league pitchers going against each other
column19: " Brault said . " Jon Lester has been around for a while . He pitched himself out of some jams . It happens . It would have been nice to win
column21: but I did what I could . So I feel good about what happened . Sometimes it goes that way . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cubs : RHP Steve Cishek said he was pain - free following a bullpen session Saturday . He could be activated for Chicago 's game against San Francisco on Tuesday . Cishek was placed on the 10 - day injured list with left hip inflammation on Aug. 10 . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cubs : LHP Jose Quintana ( 10 - 7
column22: 4.11 ERA ) will try to avoid taking a loss for the first time in nearly two months when he takes the mound at the MLB Little League Classic in Williamsport
column24: against Pittsburgh on Sunday . He is 6 - 0 in eight starts since last losing June 22 . 	 Pirates : RHP Mitch Keller ( 1 - 1
column25: 7.94 ) will make his second start on Sunday since being recalled from Triple - A Indianapolis on Aug. 12 . The 23 - year - old rookie picked up his first major league win in four starts by allowing two runs ( one earned ) on five hits against the Angels on Monday . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: TORONTO --   Kyle Seager got a kick out of displacing Alex Rodriguez from the Seattle Mariners ' record book . 	 Seager hit a tiebreaking home run in the eighth inning
column3: and the Seattle Mariners beat the Toronto Blue Jays 4 - 3 Saturday . 	 Seager 's two - out drive off the right field foul screen came on the first pitch from left - hander Tim Mayza ( 1 - 2 ) . 	 " At the end
column4: it started hooking a little bit hard on me
column5: " Seager said . " I 'm not mad at it for staying fair . " 	 Seattle won for the third time in five games after losing eight of the previous nine . 	 Seager 's home run extended his hitting streak to 11 games . The third baseman has reached safely in 21 of his past 22 and has hit nine of his 15 home runs in that stretch . 	 " You want to get on runs like that
column6: " Seager said . " That 's kind of how it goes in the power department . You know
column8: at least I have . " 	 Since July 22
column9: Seager has raised his batting average from .186 to .242 . 	 " His timing is really good . He 's not in a hurry at the plate
column10: " manager Scott Servais said . " He 's got a lot of confidence . He should . " 	 The homer was Seager 's 190th
column11: the most ever by a Mariners infielder . Rodriguez hit 189 homers in his seven seasons with Seattle . 	 " That 's definitely something that I do n't take lightly
column12: " Seager said of the record . " I 'm very proud of that . " 	 Blue Jays rookie third baseman Vladimir Guerrero Jr. left after two innings because of a sore left knee and was replaced by Brandon Drury . 	 In the second
column13: Guerrero cut in front of shortstop Bo Bichette to field Nola 's grounder and made an awkward throw across his body
column14: too late to record the out . He finished the inning but did not return in the third . 	 Manager Charlie Montoyo said Guerrero " felt a little tweak in his knee . " Guerrero was not available after the game because he had left to undergo an MRI . 	 " We took him out just in case
column15: " Montoyo said . 	 Nola scored later in the second on a sacrifice fly by Keon Broxton
column16: but Toronto answered in the bottom half on Billy McKinney 's two - out RBI single . 	 Nola homered off right off Trent Thornton to begin the fourth
column17: his fifth
column18: and Broxton added a second sacrifice fly later in the inning
column19: but the Mariners could n't hold the two - run lead . 	 Bichette trimmed it to 3 - 2 with a two - out blast off Taylor Guilbeau in the fifth
column20: and Reese McGuire tied it in the seventh
column21: homering on the second pitch from Anthony Bass . Bichette 's homer was his fifth
column22: while McGuire 's was his third . 	 Bass ( 2 - 4 ) worked one inning for the win and Sam Tuivailala pitched the eighth . Matt Magill pitched around a two - out double in the ninth to earn his first career save
column23: catching Bichette looking to end it . 	 Guilbeau made his major league debut in the fourth
column24: becoming the 40th pitcher and 62nd player to appear for the Mariners this season . Seattle also used 40 pitchers in 2017
column25: while 62 players breaks the team mark set two years ago . 	 Thornton allowed three runs and five hits in six innings . 	 Right - hander Reggie McClain opened for Seattle
column26: allowing one run and three hits in two innings . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Mariners : OF Domingo Santana ( rest ) sat for the third straight game . Santana is hitless in nine at bats . Santana is expected to DH Sunday . 	 Blue Jays : Guerrero missed more than a month at Double - A New Hampshire last season because of a strained ligament in his left knee . column2: Calif. --   Chris Bassitt believes the Oakland Athletics ' struggles against the Houston Astros are due in part to the perception that the 2017 World Series championship are unbeatable . 	 He helped pierce that aura of invincibility on Saturday . 	 Matt Chapman doubled among his three hits and Mark Canha had two hits and three RBI to back Bassitt 's six solid innings in the Athletics ' 8 - 4 victory over the Astros . 	 Matt Olson and Josh Phegley each had two hits for Oakland
column3: which finished with 13 hits -- just two for extra bases . The A 's have won four straight games and 11 of their last 16 . They have gained four games in four days on the Astros
column4: closing to within 6 1/2 games of the AL West leaders . 	 Oakland has won the first three of a four - game series against Houston after dropping nine of its first 11 games to the Astros . 	 " To me personality
column6: " Bassitt said . " Are they a great team ? Yeah . Are they a top two or three team in all of baseball ? Yeah . But when you give them more credit than they deserve everything snowballs on you . 	 " When you go on the attack and you attack them
column7: it makes life a whole heck of a lot easier . " 	 Chapman offered a more measured perspective . 	 " I would just chalk it up to us being confident and playing really well right now
column8: " he said . 	 Bassitt ( 9 - 5 ) gave up three runs and eight hits with two walks . In seven starts since the All - Star break he 's 4 - 1 with a 2.36 ERA . Bassitt threw 116 pitches
column9: a career high for the 30 - year - old who missed all of 2017 recovering from Tommy John surgery . 	 The A 's won for just the third time this season in game in which they did n't homer . 	 " When we play like that
column10: when we do n't hit a home run and we win
column11: I think that 's good for our psyche
column12: " A 's manager Bob Melvin said . 	 Yordan Alvarez homered twice for Houston
column13: which has lost five straight and six of seven after winning eight in a row and 18 of 21 . 	 The A 's scored five runs against rookie starter Rogelio Armenteros ( 1 - 1 ) in the third
column14: when the first seven hitters reached base safely . Canha 's two - run single highlighted a rally that gave the A 's a 5 - 2 lead . 	 Armenteros gave up five runs and seven hits with one walk in four innings . The 25 - year - old was called up from Triple - A Round Rock to make his second career start and fifth appearance with starter Gerrit Cole missing his second turn in the rotation with a right hamstring injury . 	 " It did n't happen the way I wanted
column15: " Armenteros said through a translator . " They found my holes in my execution . I have to keep focusing on all aspects of the game
column16: pitch selection
column17: execution and command . " 	 Oakland opened up an 8 - 3 lead in the fifth
column18: when four straight batters reached safely to start a three - run inning . 	 Alvarez hit his 19th homer off reliever Ryan Buchter leading off the eighth . He homered off Bassitt in the fifth . 	 Michael Brantley was 2 for 4 with his fourth straight multi - hit game for Houston . 	 MOVES 	 Armenteros was optioned to Triple - A Round Rock after Saturday 's game . ... Astros RHP Francis Martes was reinstated from the restricted list and placed on the minor league injured list . Martes
column19: who had Tommy John surgery on Aug. 15 of last year
column20: was suspended for 80 games for testing positive for a performance enhancing drugs in March . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : RHP Brad Peacock ( right shoulder ) is expected to be activated from the injured list on Sunday
column21: manager A.J. Hinch said . Peacock 's return would be a welcome addition a taxed Astros bullpen . Going into Saturday four relievers ( Hector Rondon
column23: Will Harris and Joe Smith ) had pitched in three of their previous four games . ... RHP Cy Sneed was optioned to Round Rock to make room on 25 - man roster for Armenteros . 	 Athletics : OF Stephen Piscotty injured his right ankle sliding into second base on a pickoff attempt . He left the game for a pinch - runner . Melvin said the injury is n't believed to be serious but Piscotty will likely sit out Sunday 's game . 	 UP NEXT 	 Astros : RHP Zack Greinke ( 12 - 4

column2: Fla. -- Mike Brosseau came through in the 13th inning to finish a long night and end an extended scoring drought by the Tampa Bay Rays . 	 Brosseau 's pinch - hit RBI single in the 13th drove in Eric Sogard to give the Rays a 1 - 0 win over the Detroit Tigers on Saturday in a game in which the Rays struck out 24 batters without walking any . 	 Sogard doubled off Matt Hall ( 0 - 1 ) with two outs
column3: and Tommy Pham was intentionally walked . Brosseau
column5: singled to right - center field for the Rays ' first run since Wednesday
column6: ending a streak of 29 scoreless innings . 	 " Obviously a long game
column7: right ? So you want to be the one to end it in that situation
column8: " Broussard said after his first walk - off hit . 	 Six Tampa Bay pitchers combined to set a major league record for strikeouts without a walk
column9: and the game set a franchise record for the Tigers
column10: who have struck out 37 times in the first two games of the three - game series without a base on balls . 	 " I know we struck out as many times as I 've ever seen in a baseball game
column11: " Detroit manager Ron Gardenhire said . " A lot of outs were being made
column12: and that 's probably because the pitching was pretty good on both sides . " 	 Sogard 's double off the wall was the only hit that came close to a home run on a night when plenty of hitters were trying to hit one . 	 " I think in those situations
column13: everybody wants to hit the game winner
column14: " Gardenhire said . " When you start swinging hard and out of the [ strike ] zone trying to do those things
column15: it really works against you . Both teams kind of got involved in that a little bit . " 	 Rays relievers struck out 14 in 20 hitless at bats . Six Tigers hitters struck out at least three times . 	 " [ Rays starter Ryan ] Yarbrough set the tone from pitch one
column16: " said reliever Emilio Pagan
column17: who struck out four in two innings . " We were in a lot of plus counts
column18: and we were able to execute when we were ahead . That was a special game for sure . " 	 Poche ( 3 - 4 ) got the win after striking out two of the three Tigers he faced in the 13th . 	 The win kept the Rays a half - game ahead of the Oakland Athletics for the American League 's second wild - card spot . 	 Detroit 's final hit was Niko Goodrum 's one - out double in the seventh off Yarbrough . The next eight Tigers struck out against three different relievers . 	 Yarbrough
column19: who came one out short of pitching the Rays ' first complete game in three years on Sunday
column20: is 6 - 0 with a 1.43 ERA over 56 2/3 innings in his past 11 appearances . He gave up three hits while striking out 10 in 6 1/3 innings . 	 Detroit starter Jordan Zimmermann allowed only one baserunner -- on Tommy Pham 's double -- in five innings
column21: throwing 63 pitches and striking out five . 	 ANDERSON 'S K 's 	 Since allowing a double to Boston 's Andrew Benintendi

column1: CINCINNATI --   Aristides Aquino keeps hitting historic home runs . 	 Cincinnati 's red - hot rookie had a three - run homer
column2: Nick Senzel added a leadoff shot and the Reds dropped the St. Louis Cardinals back into a tie with Chicago for first place in the NL Central Division with a 6 - 1 victory on Saturday . 	 With the Reds leading 2 - 1 in the fifth
column3: Aquino followed two - out singles by Josh VanMeter and Freddy Galvis with a no - doubt drive to center field on Miles Mikolas ' first pitch for his second homer in two nights
column4: his 10th in his last 11 games and 11th in his 17th career games . 	 " I was ready for the fastball
column6: " Aquino said through an interpreter . " I put a good swing on it . " 	 Aquino is the first rookie since 1900 with 11 homers in his first 17 games
column7: according to the Elias Sports Bureau . 	 " I have a job to do
column10: " manager David Bell said . " We know what he 's capable of doing
column11: but it is fun to watch for me and the fans . He has an approach that he 's comfortable with . He 's locked in right now . That home run changed the complexion of the game . " 	 One day after being rocked for 18 hits and 13 runs
column12: Cincinnati pitching limited St. Louis to Matt Carpenter 's second - inning solo homer
column13: one of five hits and three walks allowed by Anthony DeSclafani in five innings . DeSclafani ( 8 - 7 ) struck out four . 	 DeSclafani 's seven career wins against St. Louis are three more than he has against any other team . 	 The Cardinals were 1 for 8 with runners in scoring position and left 10 runners on base . 	 " You ca n't pin everything on Miles
column14: " St. Louis manager Mike Shildt said . " It was a group effort . We left 10 guys out there . We were n't able to push anything across . " 	 The Cardinals loaded the bases against Lucas Sims with one out in the sixth
column15: but he struck out pinch - hitter Paul DeJong and got Dexter Fowler to pop up . 	 Michael Lorenzen allowed one hit and had three strikeouts in two innings . He also had two hits . R.J. Alaniz finished up . 	 The Reds roughed up Mikolas ( 7 - 13 ) for seven hits and five runs with two walks and five strikeouts in five innings . He is 1 - 4 over his last six starts . 	 " I felt like I did n't have my best stuff
column16: " said Mikolas
column17: 0 - 3 in four starts against Cincinnati this season . " I had trouble keeping the ball down . Then you make one mistake to one of their best hitters and that 's the ballgame . " 	 Senzel led off the bottom of the first with his third leadoff home run and 10th overall . 	 Phillip Ervin and Tucker Barnhart singled to lead off the fourth
column18: setting up Jose Iglesias ' tiebreaking sacrifice fly . 	 ON SECOND THOUGHT 	 Fowler was thrown out at third base by center fielder Senzel trying to go from first to third on Marcell Ozuna 's two - out single in the fifth inning . Yairo Munoz was thrown out at second by Ervin trying to stretch his two - out single off the left - field wall into a double in the eighth . 	 BARE CUPBOARD 	 With LHP Amir Garrett suspended and 1B Joey Votto ( back )
column19: OF Jesse Winker ( back ) and 3B Eugenio Suarez ( left thumb sprain ) nursing injuries
column20: the Reds went into Saturday 's game with 21 healthy players
column21: including the four other pitchers in the starting rotation . 	 BULLPEN SHUFFLE 	 Trying to have as many fresh arms available as possible in a depleted bullpen
column22: the Reds optioned RHP Matt Bowman to Triple - A Louisville and recalled RHP R.J. Alaniz
column23: whose first appearance will be his Cincinnati debut . 	 THROWBACK SATURDAY 	 The Reds wore replicas of the uniforms worn by the 1976 team
column24: the 11th in a series of 15 throwback outfits the team is wearing to help celebrate the 150th anniversary of baseball 's first all - professional team . The Cardinals wore for the 10th time this season the road alternate " victory " blue uniforms the team wore in the 1980s . St. Louis is 1 - 9 in those uniforms . 	 CONTROL FREAK 	 Mikolas set a club record with his 40th consecutive start with no more than two walks . He 'd been tied at 39 with Curt Davis in 1938 and 1939 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds : RHP Tyler Mahle ( left hamstring strain ) allowed three runs on three hits with a walk and two strikeouts while throwing 37 pitches in 1 1/3 innings in the first appearance of his rehab assignment with Triple - A Louisville on Friday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Cardinals : RHP Jack Flaherty ( 6 - 6 ) has allowed 10 hits and three walks with 11 strikeouts in 11 1/3 shutout innings over two starts against Cincinnati this season . column1: WASHINGTON --   After witnessing two dozen runs and multiple comebacks over nine innings
column2: Milwaukee manager Craig Counsell knew he had never seen something quite like the Brewers ' game against the Washington Nationals . 	 He could n't have guessed there would be another five innings of back - and - forth wackiness between the two National League playoff contenders . 	 Eric Thames hit a go - ahead
column3: two - run homer in the 14th inning
column4: and Milwaukee finally held on for a wild 15 - 14 victory Saturday night . 	 " It 's one of the cliches in baseball : You never know what you 're going to see every day when you come to the field
column5: " Brewers outfielder Christian Yelich said . " I think that holds pretty true today . " 	 Yelich hit two home runs
column6: tying for the major league lead with 41
column7: Ryan Braun smacked two as well and the Brewers equaled their franchise record with seven . Thames ' blast off Javy Guerra ( 1 - 1 ) was the last of them in a 5 - hour
column10: 11 home runs and blown saves by both teams ' closers . 	 Yelich went 5 for 6 with four RBI
column11: breaking out of a 1 - for-16 slump since returning from a back injury that cost him four games . 	 " This was a huge night
column13: but like I said : If he has an 0 - for on his tab the night before
column14: then watch out the next night
column15: " Counsell said . " He backed that up tonight . " 	 Milwaukee earned its seventh victory in 10 games while setting a season high in runs and snapping Washington 's five - game winning streak . 	 Junior Guerra ( 7 - 4 ) pitched 1 2/3 innings
column16: but nearly squandered a two - run lead in the 14th . Keston Hiura 's two - out throwing error allowed a run to score and extended the game
column17: but two batters later Guerra struck out pinch - hitter Joe Ross
column18: a pitcher
column19: to end it . 	 " You did n't expect the 14th to go 1 - 2 - 3
column20: " Counsell said . 	 Staked to an 11 - 8 lead
column21: Washington closer Sean Doolittle yielded Yelich 's homer to open the ninth . After Hiura 's double
column22: Mike Moustakas and Braun went deep on consecutive pitches to give the Brewers the lead . 	 " I 'm still searching for answers
column24: who blew his sixth save and is 0 - 2 with a 7.36 ERA since the All - Star break . " I do n't know . . It just was n't coming out tonight . That part of the order
column25: that team
column26: there 's just nowhere to hide . " 	 Milwaukee 's advantage did n't last . Josh Hader entered and gave up a walk
column27: a double and Victor Robles ' game - tying single . But after an intentional walk to load the bases
column28: Hader struck out the top third of Washington 's order to preserve a 12 - 12 tie . 	 Yelich homered again in the 13th to give Milwaukee a 13 - 12 lead
column29: but again the Nationals came back to prolong it with a walk
column30: a single and Robles ' sacrifice fly . 	 " I ca n't really think of another game that was crazier that I 've ever played in
column31: " Yelich said . " Just going back and forth
column32: both teams making comebacks and just improbable ties and all that stuff . " 	 Milwaukee scored five runs in the third off Anibal Sanchez as seven consecutive batters reached safely . Sanchez lasted only four innings
column33: his shortest outing since May 16 . 	 The Nationals rallied to tie it on Juan Soto 's two - run homer in the third and Adam Eaton 's three - run blast in the fourth . Both came off Brewers starter Jordan Lyles
column34: who also departed after four innings . 	 Braun and Trent Grisham homered in consecutive innings off Nationals reliever Matt Grace to make it 8 - 5 . Trea Turner and Howie Kendrick homered in the sixth and seventh
column36: as Washington took an 11 - 8 lead . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Brewers : LHP Brent Suter ( Tommy John surgery ) threw 50 pitches over 2 2/3 scoreless innings in a rehabilitation appearance for Triple - A San Antonio on Thursday . " We 'll give him a good break before his next appearance
column37: " Counsell said . " We 'll kind of keep him at that point . He needs to pitch
column38: and as much as pitch

column40: " manager Dave Martinez said . " He threw 64 pitches . He felt good

column1: PHILADELPHIA --   Dinelson Lamet and the San Diego Padres finally cooled off Philadelphia 's lineup . 	 The right - hander pitched six solid innings
column2: Ty France hit a tiebreaking single and the Padres beat the Phillies 5 - 3 on Saturday night . 	 Lamet ( 2 - 2 ) allowed three runs and six hits with six strikeouts and a walk . The 27 - year - old was making his eighth start since missing last season due to Tommy John surgery . 	 " I felt good
column3: " Lamet said through a translator . " Every outing I 'm feeling better . " 	 J.T. Realmuto homered for the Phillies
column4: who lost for the first time since former manager Charlie Manuel returned as hitting coach on Tuesday . Philadelphia dropped one game out of the second NL wild - card spot . 	 " He had good stuff
column5: " Philadelphia 's Corey Dickerson said about Lamet . " He can get it up there 97
column6: 98 ( mph ) when he wanted it . Good breaking ball . Mixed it pretty well and he threw it for strikes . Throwing it for strikes really helped him a lot . " 	 The Phillies had outscored opponents 30 - 12 while winning their previous four games
column7: and they had batted .337 with 35 hits
column8: seven homers and 25 RBI in the three games since Manuel joined the staff . 	 But they managed just six hits against Lamet and three Padres relievers . 	 " It 's a mentality
column9: " Lamet said . " And it 's the work you put in beforehand
column10: understanding where to attack these guys
column11: where can I get a swing and miss and where can I go to avoid damage so they 're not getting their best swing ? " 	 Eric Hosmer had three hits for the Padres
column12: and Josh Naylor tied the game with a two - run double in the fourth . 	 " We needed that
column13: " Padres manager Andy Green said . " Naylor 's swing was the biggest swing of the day for us . " 	 Kirby Yates pitched a scoreless ninth for his 34th save in 37 chances . 	 The Padres went in front with a pair of runs in the fifth off reliever Nick Pivetta ( 4 - 5 ) . 	 Hosmer led off with his third single and scored on France 's one - out single to right field . Luis Urias followed and made it 5 - 3 with another opposite - field RBI single to right . 	 San Diego tied the game with three runs in the fourth off Phillies starter Zach Eflin . 	 Pitching against the club that selected him in the first round of the 2012 draft
column14: Eflin was sailing along with two outs in the fourth and Lamet at the plate . But the pitcher singled up the middle and Manuel Margot followed with an RBI single before Naylor 's two - run double made it 3 - all . Both RBI hits came with two strikes . 	 " You have to fight down to your last strike and your last out every inning
column15: and I thought we did that really well that inning
column16: " Green said . 	 Said Eflin : " Just horrible two - strike pitches . It 's something that I really need to get on top of . " 	 Philadelphia got a pair of runs in the second on Scott Kingery 's RBI double and Eflin 's RBI single . The Phillies went up 3 - 0 in the third on Realmuto 's 415 - foot drive to deep left . It was the 19th homer for the streaking Realmuto
column17: who has homered in four of the last five contests and is batting .522 with four doubles
column18: four homers and nine RBI in his last six games . 	 START ME UP 	 Eflin returned to the rotation for the first time since July 27 after being sent to the bullpen due to ineffectiveness . He replaced Jake Arrieta
column19: who will have season - ending surgery to remove bone spurs in his pitching elbow later this month . 	 Eflin continued to struggle
column20: allowing three runs and seven hits in 3 2/3 innings . The right - hander has a 10.09 ERA in his last seven starts dating to June 24 . 	 ON A ROLL 	 Hosmer is hitting .524 in his last five games . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Phillies : Placed OF Roman Quinn on the 10 - day IL with a right groin strain . Quinn was hurt trying to beat out a grounder in the eighth inning Friday night . ... The 33 - year - old Arrieta
column21: who is 8 - 8 with a 4.64 ERA in 24 starts
column22: has been trying to pitch through the injury for the last month . ... Right - handed reliever David Robertson had Tommy John surgery Thursday . Robertson was signed to a two - year
column24: but was able to pitch just 6 2/3 innings for the Phillies this year . In addition to being sidelined for the rest of this year
column25: Robertson likely will miss all of the 2020 season . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres LHP Joey Lucchesi ( 7 - 7
column26: 4.25 ERA ) will oppose Phillies LHP Jason Vargas ( 6 - 6
column27: 4.03 ) in the rubber game of the three - game set Sunday afternoon . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: BOSTON --   Eduardo Rodriguez 's role in Boston 's rotation just got a lot bigger . 	 Judging by his first start since ace lefty Chris Sale went on the 10 - day injured list
column2: he looks like he can take on the added responsibility . 	 Rodriguez pitched 7 1/3 stellar innings
column3: red - hot Rafael Devers belted a two - run homer and the Red Sox beat the Baltimore Orioles 4 - 0 on Saturday night for their fourth straight victory . 	 The win came a few hours after Boston had to put Sale on the IL due to inflammation in his left elbow . Red Sox president Dave Dombrowski said Sale felt stiffness after his start Tuesday in Cleveland and did n't tell the team until Friday before he was sent for an MRI . 	 " He 's a big part of the rotation
column4: " Rodriguez said . " He 's the best pitcher we have here as a starter . We know how good he is . " 	 Trey Mancini had a double -- his eighth straight game in Fenway Park with an extra - base hit -- for the Orioles
column5: who have dropped six straight . 	 Rodriguez ( 14 - 5 ) allowed four hits
column7: walked two and hit a batter in setting his career high for wins in a season . He 's 6 - 0 with a 1.30 ERA in his last eight starts against Baltimore
column8: the team that originally signed him . 	 " I do n't think I 've ever seen the guy pitch bad in person
column9: " Baltimore manager Brandon Hyde said . " He 's just got four pitches that he can ( throw ) . He really locates well . " 	 Devers ' two - run shot went into the Green Monster seats and made it 4 - 0 in the seventh . In his last four games
column10: he 's 11 for 18 with two homers and seven RBI . 	 Dombrowski said that in addition to the team 's doctors
column11: Sale will also have the results looked at by orthopedist Dr. James Andrews
column12: but probably not until Monday . Dombrowski was n't certain if Sale would visit Andrews . 	 " It 's always tough
column13: but we 've got to keep going
column14: " Boston manager Alex Cora said . " We 'll find out more in the upcoming days . As of now
column15: somebody 's got to step up . That 's the way it works in this business . " 	 The Red Sox will be waiting for more news . 	 " There 's going to be further evaluations
column16: " Dombrowski said before the game . " We 're in a situation where I do n't know where it 's really going to take us at this point . " 	 Asher Wojciechowski ( 2 - 6 ) gave up two runs in 4 1/3 innings
column17: striking out four and walking three . In his only other career start against the Red Sox
column18: he held them to one hit over 7 1/3 shutout innings
column19: striking out 10 on July 21 at Camden Yards . 	 Brock Holt homered into Boston 's bullpen over the leaping bid by right fielder Anthony Santander leading off the fifth . Jackie Bradley Jr. followed with a triple off the Monster and scored on Wojciechowski 's wild pitch . 	 TAKE A PEEK 	 Cora said he frequently looks at the scoreboard to monitor teams Boston 's trying to catch in the AL 's wild - card race . 	 " Why not ? That 's the way it is
column20: " he said . " That 's part of baseball . Whoever says they do n't look
column21: they 're lying . You always pay attention . " 	 They remained 6   1/2 games behind Tampa Bay
column22: the second wild - card team . 	 LOOK OUT 	 Third - base umpire Joe West was hit on the right leg in foul territory by a hard grounder from Baltimore 's Richie Martin . West got a nice hand from the fans after they noticed he was OK . 	 LOOK AT THAT 	 Orioles CF Stevie Wilkerson made a leaping catch up against the wall on Mitch Moreland 's drive to end the fourth
column23: falling to the track after the grab . 	 Wilkerson probably knew how Moreland felt after his grounder that was going up - the - middle for a hit was snared by SS Xander Bogaerts
column24: who left slid before getting up and throwing to first . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Orioles : Promoted RHP Hunter Harvey from Triple - A Norfolk before the game after sending RHP Tom Eshelman there following Friday 's loss . Harvey
column25: who has battled injuries since being selected with their first pick in 2013
column26: made his major league debut
column27: working a scoreless inning with two strikeouts and a walk . " Everything that 's led me up to this point

column1: ATLANTA --   Braves reliever Luke Jackson summed up his team 's mindset against the Los Angeles Dodgers . 	 " They 're kind of like our David and Goliath
column2: you know ? " Jackson said . " Whenever we 've gone out there it 's been rough . They 're a good team
column5: just duking it out . It 's nice to pull out wins like this . " 	 Josh Donaldson and Adam Duvall hit consecutive homers off Hyun - Jin Ryu in the sixth inning
column6: the faulty Atlanta bullpen redeemed itself for a change
column7: and the Braves finally beat Los Angeles 4 - 3 on Saturday night . 	 Donaldson stirred the largest crowd in SunTrust Park 's three - year history when his 29th homer landed in the Atlanta bullpen in right - center . Duvall added on by going deep into the left - center seats to make it 4 - 2 . 	 Atlanta won the matchup of NL division leaders one night after the Dodgers ' powerful offense homered four times
column8: sending the Braves to a 27th loss in the last 37 regular - season games between the teams . With their first win in five meetings this season
column9: the Braves are trying to stand up to the club that eliminated them from the playoffs last year . 	 " It gives us an opportunity to win a series tomorrow
column10: " Atlanta manager Brian Snitker said . " That 's the big thing . " 	 Ryu ( 12 - 3 ) lost for the first time in seven starts as his ERA
column11: still best in the major leagues
column12: rose 19 points to 1.64 . 	 " I think there were some changeups that kind of cut a little bit on him and did n't stay true and got to the barrel
column13: " Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said . " But it was still good enough for us to win
column14: and unfortunately we came up a little bit short . " 	 Sean Newcomb ( 6 - 3 ) turned in a promising performance after allowing consecutive homers the night before that left him with a 13.49 ERA in his last eight outings . He bailed out Braves starter Mike Foltynewicz in the fifth
column15: getting Edwin Rios to fly out with runners at the corners . 	 Newcomb faced the minimum in 1 1/3 innings . Jackson
column16: who lost the closer 's job last month
column17: allowed Max Muncy 's 31st homer before stranding a runner he walked in the seventh . 	 Shane Greene
column18: another former closer
column19: struck out the side in the eighth . Mark Melancon earned his third save of the season
column21: when Cody Bellinger popped up with a runner at first to end it . 	 Atlanta 's bullpen has been battered over the last two weeks with Greene
column22: Melancon and Chris Martin -- all acquired at the trade deadline to steady the relief corps -- beginning the game with a combined 10.47 ERA in seven appearances apiece . 	 " We 've got three new guys here
column24: you 'll see that we 're going to come together as the team within the team and make sure that when we 've got the lead and they go to us
column25: we 'll get the job done . " 	 The Braves led 2 - 0 in the third on Ozzie Albies ' two - run double . Ryu
column26: who had a streak of 15 scoreless innings snapped
column27: struck out Donaldson to strand Albies at third . 	 Matt Beaty provided Los Angeles ' early offense
column28: hitting his seventh homer to make it 2 - 1 in the fourth and lining a run - scoring single to make it 2 - all in the fifth and chase Foltynewicz . 	 Foltynewicz labored through 4 2/3 innings on 107 pitches . He gave up seven hits and two runs . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Dodgers : Roberts said INF Jedd Gyorko will be activated Sunday and start at first base . Gyorko has dealt with back
column29: hamstring and hand injuries this year and was on the 60 - day injured list when Los Angeles acquired him from St. Louis at the July 31 trade deadline . 	 Braves : CF Ender Inciarte will miss four to six weeks after straining his right hamstring while running the bases Friday . Duvall
column30: optioned to Triple - A the day before
column31: replaced Inciarte on the roster . 	 GOING DEEP AGAIN 	 With two more homers
column32: the Dodgers have connected 24 times over the last six games . Los Angeles leads the NL in home runs and set a major league record Friday with 22 in a five - game span . 	 SLICK GLOVES 	 Braves 1B Freddie Freeman snared Muncy 's liner in the first to double up Joc Pederson

column2: Texas --   Tyler Duffey 's season win total increased before the game while he was sitting in the clubhouse and again Saturday night after he was back out on the mound for the Minnesota Twins . 	 Duffey got the decision in the Twins ' latest win by retiring the last two batters of the fifth inning and leaving the bases loaded in a 12 - 7 victory over the Texas Rangers . Hours before the first pitch
column3: he was awarded a win for Minnesota 's 4 - 3 victory Friday night that originally was credited to Sam Dyson . 	 " Tonight
column4: I did n't even think about the chance that I could ( get another win )
column6: who struck out the lone batter whom he faced Friday to end the sixth inning . " It 's great . To contribute to wins is what we want to do . " 	 C.J. column7: their largest since Aug. 6 . 	 The Rangers have lost nine of their last 11 games and are three games under .500 for the first time since May 18 . 	 Ariel Jurado ( 6 - 9 ) nearly escaped the first inning scoreless
column8: but a relay throw to him to complete what would have been an inning ending 3 - 6 - 1 double play skipped off the top of his glove as he ran across the bag . Jurado allowed a career - high eight runs -- including the six unearned in the first -- for the second straight start in two innings . 	 " We did n't do anything to win the game
column9: " Texas manager Chris Woodward said . " We did n't get guys out we needed to
column10: especially early . We let one mistake kind of snowball into a bunch of runs after that . " 	 Miguel Sano also homered in the ninth for Minnesota . It gave the Twins a major league leading 240 home runs
column11: keeping them on pace to break the record of 267 set last season by the New York Yankees . 	 Jose Berrios lasted only 4 1/3 innings
column12: his shortest start of the season . Berrios allowed seven runs
column14: and seven hits with three walks . 	 " I think we could have made more plays for him in the field

column16: giving him 21 this season after going into the year with 13 in 364 career games . Santana became the fourth player in the history of the Rangers - Washington Senators franchise to homer in each of the first two innings

column20: Jorge Polanco and Jake Cave each had three hits for Minnesota . 	 HEATED EXCHANGE ? NOT REALLY 	 The benches cleared after Gonzalez 's ground out to end the top of the eighth when he and Rangers reliever Shawn Kelley appeared to exchange words . Except they did n't . 	 Gonzalez was upset about grounding out . Kelley was upset at previously allowing a run to score . They just happened to express their dissatisfaction in the direction of each other

column1: PHOENIX --   Logan Webb found himself in the middle of a playoff race
column2: and was up to the challenge . 	 The 22 - year - old right - hander survived a rocky start and pitched five innings to win his major league debut
column3: leading the San Francisco Giants to an 11 - 6 victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Saturday night . 	 " It was awesome . Everyone here wants to win . I want to win more than anything
column4: " Webb said . " So if I can help out in any way possible
column5: that 's the main goal . " 	 Brandon Belt hit a grand slam and tied a career high with six RBI as the Giants won their third straight game and sixth in the past seven to continue their surge into serious National League wild - card contention . 	 " It 's good to see him have a big day . I know it 's been a little tough sledding for him
column7: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " It 's got to be good for his confidence . " 	 Kevin Pillar had a career - high five hits for the Giants . 	 Webb ( 1 - 0 ) allowed one unearned run on five hits with seven strikeouts . Pillar scored three runs in going 5 for 5 with an RBI
column8: and Mike Yastrzemski had three hits a night after hitting three home runs . 	 The Diamondbacks have lost the first three games of a key four - game set with the Giants and dropped four in a row overall . Arizona 's Taylor Clarke ( 4 - 4 )
column9: liked Webb called up from the minors to make the start Saturday
column10: lasted just 1 2/3 innings and was charged with three earned runs on five hits . 	 " We have to figure it out . We 've got to pitch better . We have to do a lot of things better
column11: " Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo said . " These guys are not trying to make mistakes . They 're not trying to lose baseball games . They 're not trying to throw bad pitches
column12: it 's just the nature of the beast right now and it 's on us . " 	 Belt 's slam quickly erased a 2 - 0 Arizona lead . The first three Giants hitters of the second inning reached base on a walk
column14: and bloop single . Belt then cleared the bases for his second career grand slam
column15: his 14th home run of the season and second in two days . 	 The Giants loaded the bases again on Clarke in the second inning
column16: and added a fifth run in the inning on Evan Longoria 's sacrifice fly . 	 Webb became the third Giants pitcher to make his major league debut as a starter this season
column17: joining Shaun Anderson and Conner Menez . 	 Christian Walker and Nick Ahmed homered for the Diamondbacks
column18: and Wilmer Flores had four hits . San Francisco scored two runs in both the seventh and eighth innings and totaled 18 hits for the game . 	 Alex Avila
column19: who started the game as the Diamondbacks ' catcher
column20: pitched the top of the ninth inning and got a called third strike on Yastrzemski before retiring the side in order . 	 MEDICAL EMERGENCY 	 A man in attendance had a medical issue and was given CPR in the stands behind home plate at Chase Field during the game . 	 The game was delayed briefly before the start of the third inning while emergency medical personnel attended to the man in a section of field - level seats . It was n't clear how the man ended up on the concrete beneath his seat
column21: but the section was cleared quickly while security workers and EMTs rushed to the man 's side . 	 The medical workers administered CPR to the man before strapping him to a long stretcher and taking him out of the seating area . Fans applauded as the man was rushed up the steps to the concourse . 	 Stadium staff said the man
column22: who was sitting in an area typically for baseball scouts and executives
column23: was taken to a hospital and was breathing on his own . 	 Diamondbacks players stopped their warmups on the field and looked into the stands to see what happened . 	 CALL UPS 	 The Diamondbacks called up Clarke and pitcher Joel Payamps from Triple - A Reno before Saturday 's game
column24: with right - hander Jon Duplantier sent back to Reno . 	 With Webb 's addition to the Giants roster
column25: outfielder Joey Rickard was optioned to Triple - A Sacramento . 	 BASEBALL RARITY 	 The Giants ' Scooter Gennett struck out swinging at a wild pitch in the fifth inning
column26: then was thrown out at second base by Avila trying to advance . The ball rolled all the way to the fence behind the Arizona on - deck circle before Avila spotted it
column27: retrieved it and threw to Ahmed for the tag . 	 TRAINER 'S   ROOM 	 Diamondbacks : All - Star IF - OF Ketel Marte was scratched from the lineup Saturday with minor lower back tightness . Lovullo said Marte will likely return to the lineup on Sunday . ... Relief pitcher Yoshihisa Hirano was placed on the 10 - day injured list with right elbow soreness after an MRI on Saturday . Hirano said he felt discomfort after his outing Friday night . He was to receive a cortisone injection . 	 UP NEXT 	 Giants : LHP Madison Bumgarner ( 8 - 7
column28: 3.63 ERA ) is set to start Sunday in the series finale . The Giants are 16 - 10 in his starts this season and have won each of his last six and nine of his last 10 . 	 Diamondbacks : RHP Merrill Kelly ( 8 - 12
column29: 4.75 ERA ) is set for his fourth start against the Giants this season
column30: with a 1 - 1 record . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings
column31: landing lefty Eduardo Rodriguez . We break down the deal . 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers
column32: Detroit added one of the most undervalued pitchers available this winter . 	 Joon Lee breaks down how Eduardo Rodriguez signing with Detroit affects the Tigers and Red Sox . 	 Check out some of the most electric moments from Vladimir Guerrero Jr. 's career . 	 Former Boston Red Sox left - hander Eduardo Rodriguez and the Detroit Tigers are in agreement on a five - year deal worth $ 77 million

column1: DENVER --   Ryan McMahon is emerging as another home run hitter in a Colorado lineup loaded with big bats . 	 The second baseman continued his power surge with two more long balls to help the Rockies beat the Miami Marlins 11 - 4 on Saturday night for their first three - game winning streak in two months . 	 McMahon has homered in three straight games and four of his last five to set a career high with 17 . He has four home runs on the current homestand . 	 " I feel like I 'm in a good spot
column2: " he said . " We 've won the last couple of games
column4: good vibe around here now and hopefully we keep that rolling . " 	 The Rockies have a chance to sweep a series for the first time since taking three games against Arizona from June 18 - 20
column5: which is the last time they had a three - game winning streak . 	 Despite sitting nine games back in the NL wild - card standings with 38 to play
column6: they 're not giving up on the season . 	 " You never go away
column7: " McMahon said . " A lot of baseball left
column8: all we can focus on is trying to win ballgames and hope it works out . " 	 Charlie Blackmon
column9: Ian Desmond and Trevor Story also went deep in support of starter German Marquez
column10: who left after five innings with cramps . Marquez ( 12 - 5 ) doubled and struck out eight . 	 Marquez also exited his July 31 start against the Dodgers because of full - body cramping . 	 " It was n't similar at all
column11: " he said through a translator . " I felt a little cramp and I did n't want the same thing to happen . " 	 Jon Berti homered on Marquez 's second pitch but the Rockies scored one in the first and three in the second off Hector Noesi ( 0 - 3 ) to take control . It was 6 - 3 in the sixth when McMahon led off with his first homer of the night to spark a three - run inning . He and Desmond went back - to - back in the seventh . 	 McMahon has three multihomer games this season
column12: his first full one in the majors . 	 " In the second half he 's gained some momentum
column13: " Colorado manager Bud Black said . " He 's doing it at the highest level . " 	 Garrett Cooper homered and doubled for Miami
column14: which is 3 - 12 in August . 	 " We started great but we did n't get a lot going after the leadoff homer
column15: " manager Don Mattingly said . " Hector hung in there and tried to mix and match
column16: but it did n't work out . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : Mattingly said RHP Jose Urena ( lower back soreness ) had a successful rehab start for Class A Jupiter on Friday night and will make another minor league start soon . ... RHP Pablo Lopez ( right shoulder strain ) needed just 10 pitches to get through one inning for Triple - A New Orleans on Friday night . 	 Rockies : RHP Chad Bettis ( left hip impingement ) was placed on the 10 - day injured list
column17: retroactive to Wednesday . Colorado recalled RHP Chi Chi Gonzalez from Triple - A Albuquerque . ... OF David Dahl ( high right ankle sprain ) has had the boot removed from his injured leg and is starting some activity . 	 DEJ VU All OVER AGAIN 	 Desmond stole a home run from Marlins outfielder Lewis Brinson when the teams played on opening weekend in Miami
column18: and Brinson fell victim again Saturday . He hit a drive to straightaway center field in the fourth inning that Raimel Tapia caught with a leap as the ball was going over the fence . 	 " It 's definitely the best one
column19: " Tapia said through a translator when asked about the play . " I 've had a couple in the minor leagues but the competition up here
column20: that 's probably the best one . " 	 Brinson got some payback when he threw out Tapia at second trying to stretch a single in the seventh . 	 Brinson was 0 for 4 but could easily have had three hits . In the second inning he hit a ball just foul down the third base line and struck out on the next pitch . Blackmon made a diving catch of Brinson 's sinking liner to right in the ninth . 	 " The ball to center he hit well
column21: but Tapia made a nice play
column22: " Mattingly said . " Lew continues to play good defense out there . He made some great plays . He had some good swings and the ball will fall if he continues to hit the way he did tonight . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Miami will send RHP Jordan Yamamoto ( 4 - 4
column23: 4.42 ERA ) to the mound against Colorado RHP Peter Lambert ( 2 - 3
column24: 6.75 ) in a matchup of rookies to wrap up the weekend series . Yamamoto has taken the loss in four of his last five starts
column25: while Lambert has n't won since his second career start in June . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . 	 From MVP to Cy Young and more

column2: Calif. --   Brian Goodwin 's playing time has decreased since Justin Upton returned to the Los Angeles Angels ' lineup . Still
column3: the outfielder is making the most of his opportunities when he does get to start . 	 Goodwin homered and walked with the bases loaded to bring in the go - ahead run as the Angels rallied for a 6 - 5 victory over the Chicago White Sox on Saturday night . 	 " It seems like every time he plays
column4: he makes it more difficult . But I guess it 's a very good problem to have
column5: " manager Brad Ausmus said . " When you do put him in there
column6: he 's going to fill the role . " 	 Goodwin played in all but eight of the Angels ' first 72 games ( including 54 starts ) while Upton was on the injured list with turf toe . Since the slugger came back
column7: Goodwin has seen action in only 36 games -- and Saturday marked just his 19th start . 	 " It ai n't easy
column9: " Goodwin said . " I 'm just trying to stay close to coaches and teammates
column10: get the same work in day in and day out . " 	 Goodwin tied the game at 1 in the second inning when he drove Hector Santiago 's fastball over the wall in center field for his 11th home run of the season . Upton also homered early
column11: but the Angels trailed 5 - 2 going into the seventh . 	 Los Angeles sent 10 batters to the plate in the inning and scored off four Chicago pitchers . Mike Trout lined a bases - loaded single to knock in two runs
column12: and Upton tied it with a sharp grounder that went under the glove of third baseman Ryan Goins for an error . 	 Trout scored the go - ahead run when Goodwin drew a bases - loaded walk from Evan Marshall ( 3 - 2 ) with two outs . It was the fourth walk of the inning issued by a White Sox pitcher . 	 " We had a lot of base on balls that particular inning
column13: " manager Rick Renteria said . " All in all it 's a ` pen that has been really good and today had a little problem . " 	 It was the fifth time in 63 games the Angels won when trailing after six innings . Taylor Cole ( 3 - 4 ) got the win with 1 2/3 innings of scoreless ball
column14: and Hansel Robles retired the side in order in the ninth for his 18th save . 	 Eloy Jimenez homered during a four - run third inning for the White Sox
column15: who lost for just the second time in 44 games when leading after six . 	 Jimenez hit a two - run shot to center off Jose Suarez for his 21st of the season
column16: which leads AL rookies . His drive came after James McCann gave the White Sox a 3 - 1 lead with a double to left . 	 STREAKS AND STATS 	 Shohei Ohtani came on as a pinch - hitter in the seventh and singled to extend his hitting streak to eight games
column17: which matches a season high . ... Upton homered in the third for his ninth of the season . He has 17 RBI this month after having just eight in July . ... White Sox RF Leury Garcia has reached base safely in 22 of the last 23 games after he led off with a triple . ... C Welington Castillo had a season - best seven - game hitting streak snapped . 	 FOR STARTERS 	 Santiago went 4 2/3 innings in his second start this season for the White Sox and yielded two runs on four hits . 	 The Angels went with an opener for the 23rd time this season . Noe Ramirez got the start for the fifth time and allowed a run on two hits in 1 1/3 innings before giving way to Suarez . The left - hander went four innings and was tagged for four runs and six hits . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 White Sox : LHP Manny Banuelos ( shoulder inflammation )
column18: on the 60 - day injured list
column19: has started a rehab assignment at Class A Winston - Salem with no timetable for a return . . RHP Carson Fulmer continues to feel tightness in his strained right hamstring
column20: limiting his activity . 	 Angels : Ohtani threw curveballs for the first time since Tommy John surgery last fall during a 40 - pitch session . The right - hander said he threw 10 - 12 curves and his fastball reached 85 mph . ... SS Andrelton Simmons ( left ankle sprain ) took swings in a batting cage for the first time since going on the injured list Aug. 4 . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox : RHP Dylan Cease ( 6 - 9
column21: 5.10 ERA ) will face the Angels for the first time . 	 Angels : RHP Griffin Canning ( 4 - 6
column22: 4.86 ERA ) has allowed three runs or fewer in all but four of 16 starts this season . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column1: BOSTON --   Standing in the middle of Boston 's clubhouse answering questions
column2: a baby - faced Rafael Devers found himself immersed in Red Sox history . 	 Devers went 4 for 5 with a homer
column3: two doubles and four RBI to reach 101 this season
column4: and Boston rallied from an early six - run deficit for a 13 - 7 victory Sunday that completed a three - game sweep of the Baltimore Orioles . 	 The 22 - year - old Devers joined Hall of Famers Ted Williams
column5: Bobby Doerr and Jim Rice as the only Red Sox players to have a 100 - RBI season before turning 23 . He also has already scored 100 runs this year
column6: matching Williams ( 1939 and ' 40 ) as the only two to post those totals before their 23rd birthday . 	 " The kid just keeps working . He 's not taking anything for granted
column7: " Boston manager Alex Cora said . " Every day he shows
column9: he studies and goes out there and performs the way he 's doing . It 's fun to watch . " 	 J.D. Martinez added three hits and two RBI
column10: and Sam Travis hit a solo homer for the Red Sox
column11: who won their fifth straight as they try to climb out of a deep hole for the second AL wild card . Boston trails Tampa Bay by 6 1/2 games . 	 In his last eight games
column12: Devers is 20 for 37 with 12 extra - base hits and 14 RBI . 	 " Obviously
column13: it feels good to be a part of that group
column14: but overall I 'm just trying to help the team win
column15: " he said through a translator . " That 's what I 'm more focused on . " 	 Renato Nunez had a three - run homer and four RBI
column16: and Trey Mancini hit a two - run single for last - place Baltimore
column17: which dropped its seventh in a row . 	 Trailing 6 - 3 in the sixth inning
column18: the Red Sox completed their comeback and took the lead with six runs . Christian Vazquez drove in the first with an RBI double . Pinch - hitter Mitch Moreland followed with a shallow fly against Paul Fry ( 1 - 5 ) that dropped in behind shortstop between three players with a shifted infield . 	 Travis scored easily from third and Vazquez raced home when shortstop Jonathan Villar threw wildly to the plate . Devers followed with a go - ahead double off the Green Monster before Xander Bogaerts and Martinez each had a run - scoring infield hit . The second came when reliever Shawn Armstrong was late covering first . 	 " Should 've been out of there with a two - run lead and unfortunately it steamrolled on us
column19: " Baltimore manager Brandon Hyde said . 	 Marcus Walden ( 8 - 2 )
column21: got the win by working a scoreless inning . 	 Held to one run over the first two games of the series
column22: the Orioles jumped ahead when Nunez 's drive left Fenway Park over the Monster . Mancini 's single made it 5 - 0 and Hanser Alberto added an RBI double . 	 Boston chipped away with two in the third before Travis homered into the center field batter 's eye an inning later . 	 LACKING COMMAND 	 Making his first start since April 17
column23: Boston 's Nathan Eovaldi was roughed up for five runs in two innings . 	 He did n't look sharp from the beginning
column24: giving up a double to Villar on his third pitch before walking Mancini . Overall
column25: the right - hander walked three and threw two wild pitches . 	 The 29 - year - old Eovaldi was sidelined for nearly three months and made 11 relief appearances after surgery to remove a loose body from his right elbow in April . 	 " I felt fine physically
column26: " he said . " I was just all over the place . I was n't able to execute my pitches when I needed to . " 	 HOPE YOU DIDN'T MAKE PLANS 	 Boston 's half of the sixth lasted 39 minutes
column27: with the Red Sox getting six hits and three walks before it finally ended when Travis struck out with the bases loaded . 	 They followed with another four runs in the seventh
column28: with Devers ' two - run homer the key hit . 	 WASTED EFFORT 	 Baltimore starter Ty Blach left with a 6 - 3 lead and two on in the sixth . 	 " You control the things that you can control as a pitcher and go out there and try to execute as many pitches as you can
column29: " he said . " That 's how you have to evaluate it . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Orioles : C Chance Sisco was shaken up after Travis collided with him
column30: scoring a run . Sisco stayed in
column31: but later in the inning was hit by a foul ball in the midsection and had to come out . 	 Red Sox : Cora said LHP Chris Sale will see Dr. James Andrews in Florida on Monday . Sale was put on the 10 - day injured list Saturday after an MRI showed inflammation in his pitching elbow . The lefty has n't spoken to reporters since going on the IL . " He just wants to be straight up and have all the information when he talks to you guys
column32: " Cora said . ... LHP David Price ( left wrist cyst ) played catch in the outfield after throwing a bullpen Saturday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Orioles : LHP John Means ( 8 - 8
column33: 3.76 ERA ) starts the opener of a three - game series against Kansas City at Camden Yards on Monday night . RHP Jorge Lopez ( 1 - 7
column34: 6.51 ) goes for the Royals . 	 Red Sox : Begin a two - game interleague series versus Philadelphia at Fenway Park on Tuesday . Cora had n't announced a starter yet . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . column1: NEW YORK --   Mike Freeman found out Saturday night he was going to pick up a rare start in place of Cleveland Indians star infielder Jose Ramirez . 	 A couple of hours before Sunday 's game
column2: the 32 - year - old career minor leaguer took a walk out to an empty Monument Park in Yankee Stadium to check out the plaques of past Yankees greats . 	 Freeman looked like a star
column4: on Sunday when he hit a three - run homer and two doubles as the Indians tamed the New York Yankees 8 - 4 for a four - game split between AL pennant contenders . 	 " That 's just baseball history right there
column6: who 's spent the bulk of his 10 - year professional career in the minors with five organizations . 	 " My grandfather on my mom 's side was a huge baseball fan . I always loved the game early on and he was one that would save the clippings and was a big fan of the history of the game . He passed away many years ago . I think that 's where I get it from . I kind of do those type of things because I know how much he would appreciate it and want to do it
column7: " he said . 	 Oscar Mercado homered and drove in three runs and Francisco Lindor also connected for Cleveland to back Mike Clevinger ( 8 - 2 ) . 	 Clevinger struck out 10 in five shutout innings . He won his seventh straight decision
column8: limiting New York to three hits and walking two . 	 A day after manager Aaron Boone
column9: outfielder Brett Gardner and pitcher CC Sabathia were ejected for again ranting against umpires
column10: it was a relatively quiet afternoon . 	 Miffed by a strike three call against rookie Mike Ford
column11: Boone merely threw his hands up and walked down the dugout steps without saying a word . 	 Sabathia ( 5 - 7 ) came off the injured list after being out with knee tendinitis . He lasted only three innings
column12: allowing four runs and four hits while walking three and striking out five . 	 Sabathia
column13: ejected by umpire Phil Cuzzi the day before
column14: bickered a bit with him behind the plate before Cleveland scored four times in the second . 	 Greg Allen plated the first run of the game on a grounder and then Freeman a drive into the Yankees bullpen for his fourth home run . 	 " Just a little rusty
column15: but I felt really good
column16: " Sabathia said . 	 It was the veteran lefty 's first start since July 27 . Sabathia is 0 - 3 in his last five starts
column17: and has n't won a game since June 24 against Toronto . 	 Lindor hit 21st homer off Nestor Cortes Jr. in the fourth . Mercado increased the lead 6 - 0 with an RBI single in the sixth and added a two - run homer
column18: his 10th
column19: in the eighth to make it 8 - 2 . 	 New York 's streak of 207 consecutive games without being shut out was in danger until DJ LeMahieu connected a two - run shot in the seventh . It was his 21st . 	 The Yankees cut the deficit to 8 - 4 on a pair of run - scoring hits from LeMahieu and Aaron Judge off reliever Brad Hand in the ninth before he struck out Didi Gregorius and got Gio Urshela to fly out to end it . 	 PUIG 'S POSE 	 Indians star Yasiel Puig provided a playful moment by copying -- for a moment -- an unusual batting stance from the Little League World Series that 's getting a lot of looks . Deivis Ordonez of Venezuela has drawn attention for his exaggerated crouch that leaves him nearly sitting down in the batter 's box . Puig mimicked the stance in his first at - bat
column20: then straightened up before Sabathia threw the first pitch . 	 GOING BATTY 	 Boone said he talked to Gardner about the outfielder 's recent habit of banging the bat against the dugout roof to express displeasure with decisions by umpires . Gardner was ejected for doing that Saturday
column21: and Boone suggested umps might be watching him in the future . 	 " We 'll try and not escalate situations
column23: different than when we 're rallying or getting guys excited
column24: " Boone said . 	 Boone said he had n't talked to anyone at MLB about " no
column25: you hard and fast can not " do what Gardner has been doing . 	 Gardner 's dent - dinging routine might be a new rally symbol for the team with the best record in the majors . When Judge singled in the third
column26: he looked into the dugout and imitated grabbing a bat the way Gardner did a day earlier . 	 ON HIS WAY BACK 	 RHP Luis Severino ( right shoulder inflammation ) threw a 15 - pitch simulated game with Yankees general manager Brian Cashman and Boone looking on . The 25 - year - old
column27: who is recuperating from an injured right rotator cuff
column28: faced assistant hitting coach P.J. Pilittere
column29: who hit a changeup back at him
column30: and bullpen catcher Radley Hadaad shortly after going through a 25 - pitch bullpen session . 	 " It 's something different . You want to visualize the batters at home plate that way they can see what 's going on
column31: " said Severino
column32: who has not appeared in a game this season after going 19 - 8 in 2018 . 	 " You 're just not throwing at the mitt
column34: making swings . So right there you know the progress you 're making
column37: who suffered a lat muscle injury in spring training
column38: will report to Tampa
column39: Florida
column40: this week to continue his rehab program and is expected to throw in another simulated game . He said he hopes to make a start in " high " Class A before moving on to Double - A. 	 " You can tell just talking to Sevy how good he feels and this has been building now for a while where he 's starting to really start to gain some confidence in his mind about being sound
column41: being sharp
column42: being healthy and continuing to take these next steps
column43: " Boone said . The two - time Cy Young Award winner will return to Cleveland for evaluation . column1: PHILADELPHIA --   Austin Hedges celebrated his birthday in style . 	 Hedges had four hits
column2: including a tiebreaking homer in the seventh
column4: and Joey Lucchesi pitched six strong innings to lead the San Diego Padres to a 3 - 2 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies on Sunday . 	 " Go 4 - for-4 and catch a winning ballgame
column5: that 's as good as it gets
column6: " Padres manager Andy Green said . " It 's a day he wo n't forget . It was awesome for us
column7: led us to a win . " 	 Hedges ' other three hits were singles . 	 " I 've been working on a lot of things
column8: and it 's nice to go out and execute them
column10: 78 - mph curveball from Jared Hughes ( 3 - 5 ) over the wall in left with one out in the seventh to put San Diego up a run . 	 " I felt like I picked it up out of the hand and I put a good swing on it
column11: " he said . 	 Luis Urias also went deep for the Padres
column12: who had lost seven consecutive rubber games before taking two of three in Philadelphia . 	 " It 's a great feeling
column14: " Lucchesi said of the series win . 	 Phillies outfielder Bryce Harper left after the fifth inning because of dehydration . Harper had blurred vision
column15: received an IV and was much improved after the game . 	 " I feel better now
column16: " he said . " It 's weird . An hour ago
column17: I could n't see in front of me kinda . " 	 On a hot
column18: muggy afternoon with a gametime temperature of 90 degrees
column19: Harper was lifted prior to taking the field in the sixth . Harper
column21: $ 330 million contract in the offseason
column22: has played in 123 of 124 games this season . 	 Harper singled in the fourth inning
column23: pulling up abruptly after rounding first base while considering trying for a double . He later slid hard into second base while breaking up a potential double play . 	 Harper also made a strong throw in the top of the fourth
column24: nailing Hedges at second base as he tried to stretch a single into a double . 	 Lucchesi ( 8 - 7 ) gave up two runs on three hits with four strikeouts and two walks
column25: halting his second - half struggles . Lucchesi entered 0 - 3 with a 6.15 ERA in six starts since the All - Star break
column26: and San Diego had lost all six of those games . But he kept the Phillies off - balance with a fastball that tops out in the low 90 's and a slow
column27: sinking changeup . 	 " I felt like I got in a rhythm
column28: getting the ball and going
column29: " he said . 	 Jean Segura had a pair of RBI doubles for the Phillies
column30: who lost their second straight after tying their season high with four consecutive wins . Philadelphia entered Sunday a game behind the Cubs for the NL 's second wild - card berth . 	 " We were n't able to consistently get the barrel on the ball
column31: " Phillies manager Gabe Kapler said . 	 Kirby Yates struck out the side in a perfect ninth for his NL - leading 35th save in his 38th chance . 	 The Phillies had tied it in the sixth on Segura 's two - out double to left - center that scored Adam Haseley
column32: who walked after replacing Harper in the batting order . 	 Jason Vargas
column33: in his fourth start since being acquired from the Mets
column34: allowed two runs on six hits with four strikeouts and two walks in 5 2/3 innings . The 36 - year - old Vargas has a 3.91 ERA with Philadelphia . 	 Philadelphia went ahead in the first on the first of Segura 's two - out RBI doubles
column35: this one scoring Harper . 	 San Diego took the lead with a pair of runs in the fourth on Urias ' opposite - field shot to right field . It was the second home run of the season and fourth in 143 career at - bats for Urias . 	 HOSKINS SLUMPING 	 Rhys Hoskins nearly tied it in the eighth
column36: but his drive to deep center was caught at the wall by Manuel Margot . Hoskins went 0 - for-4 and has one hit in his last 24 at - bats . The slugger has gone 14 games without a homer . 	 " Rhys had great at - bats today even though the results are n't there
column37: " Kapler said . " I know this is going to turn around for him . " 	 HOSMER STREAKING 	 Eric Hosmer doubled in the sixth inning and has hit safely in seven consecutive games . He is batting .448 with four doubles and a homer over that stretch . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : Josh Naylor called out the trainer during his at - bat in the eighth inning and appeared to be flexing his right side after swinging through a 1 - 1 pitch . After popping out to short
column38: Naylor was replaced in left field by Travis Jankowski . Green downplayed any potential injury after the game . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres : San Diego opens a three - game set at Cincinnati on Monday night with LHP Eric Lauer ( 6 - 8

column1: TORONTO --   After watching his team use seven pitchers Saturday
column2: Seattle 's Yusei Kikuchi wanted to give the bullpen a break . 	 His first big league shutout fit the bill perfectly . 	 Kikuchi needed just 96 pitches to complete a two - hitter Sunday that led the Mariners over the Toronto Blue Jays 7 - 0
column3: Seattle 's third shutout of the season . 	 Kikuchi ( 5 - 8) struck out eight
column4: walked one and retired the final 14 batters in his first win since beating Baltimore on June 23 . The rookie left - hander went 0 - 3 with a 6.53 ERA in eight starts covering 40 innings between victories . 	 " It being a bullpen day yesterday for the team
column5: I felt like I was able to step up
column6: " Kickuchi said through a translator . " I have n't been getting the results I 've wanted to and I felt like I was good for the team today
column7: so I was proud of that . " 	 The 28 - year - old Kikuchi was a star in Japan before signing a $ 56 million
column8: four - year deal with Seattle in the offseason . This was his 26th start for the Mariners and first complete game . 	 " Yusei was really focused today
column9: " manager Scott Servais said . " Outstanding . Heck of an outing . If you can throw a complete game anywhere at any time in the big leagues in less than 100 pitches
column10: it really does n't get any better than that . " 	 Tom Murphy hit a two - run homer and the Mariners went deep four times . Kyle Seager
column11: Austin Nola and Keon Broxton added solo home runs for Seattle . 	 " Up and down the lineup
column14: " Servais said . " That 's what it takes . " 	 Toronto was held scoreless for the 10th time and second time in six games . The Blue Jays
column15: who were blanked 11 times all of last season
column16: lost 1 - 0 last Sunday in a game started by Masahiro Tanaka of the Yankees . 	 Blue Jays manager Charlie Montoyo
column17: who was without injured sluggers Vladimir Gurrero Jr. ( left knee ) and outfielder Lourdes Gurriel Jr. ( left quadriceps )
column18: said Kikuchi was able to take advantage of Toronto 's depleted lineup . 	 " It was a combination of him doing his job and our approach was not that great today
column19: " Montoyo said . 	 Seager extended his hitting streak to a season - high 12 games with a leadoff homer against Toronto opener Wilmer Font in the second
column20: his 16th of the season and second in two games . Seager has homered seven times during his hitting streak
column21: and 10 times during a stretch in which he 's hit safely in 22 of 23 games . 	 Seager 's homer was the first run off Font in five opening appearances this month . The right - hander had gone 9 1/3 innings without giving up a run . Font is 2 - 1 with Toronto and Tampa Bay this season and 3 - 3 overall after going 1 - 1 in 15 games with the New York Mets in April and May. 	 Thomas Pannone took over in the third
column22: and the Mariners connected twice off the left - hander in a three - run fourth . Nola hit a leadoff shot
column24: and Murphy hit a two - out drive
column25: his 13th . 	 Broxton made it 5 - 0 with a leadoff drive off right - hander Sam Gaviglio in the seventh . 	 Kikcuhi set down the first six batters before Brandon Drury doubled to begin the third . Drury was nearly doubled off when shortstop Dee Gordon made a sliding catch on Billy McKinney 's short flare into left
column26: but second baseman Nola could n't hold Gordon 's throw . Bo Bichette flied out to end the inning . 	 Randal Grichuk hit a one - out single in the fourth but Kikuchi struck out Teoscar Hernandez and got Justin Smoak to fly out . 	 Toronto 's Rowdy Tellez walked to begin the fifth but was erased one out later when Danny Jansen grounded into a double play . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Mariners : SS J.P. Crawford got the day off . 	 Blue Jays : An MRI on Guerrero 's left knee showed no major damage
column27: and the rookie slugger will not require a stint on the injured list . Guerrero tweaked his knee playing defense Saturday and left after two innings . He is day to day . Speaking through a translator
column28: Guerrero said the injury is not as bad as the left knee strain that sidelined him for more than a month at Double - A last season . 	 FEATS OF FELIX 	 Kikuchi threw the fewest pitches in a Mariners shutout since Felix Hernandez threw 95 in a 2 - 0 win over the Los Angeles Angels on Aug. 28
column29: 2006 . Richie Sexson and Kenji Johjima drove in the runs that game while Angels RHP Kelvim Escobar took a complete - game loss . 	 SEE YOU SOON 	 The Blue Jays visit Seattle for a three - game series that begins Friday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mariners : LHP Marco Gonzales ( 12 - 10
column30: 4.26 ) starts Monday as Seattle opens a three - game series at Tampa Bay . LHP Brendan McKay ( 2 - 2
column31: 5.08 ) starts for the Rays . 	 Blue Jays : Toronto is off Monday . RHP Sean Reid - Foley ( 2 - 3
