column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   Kyle Gibson made a mistake
column2: and Jose Abreu was ready . 	 Abreu hit a towering three - run homer in Chicago 's four - run second inning
column3: helping Ivan Nova and the White Sox beat the Twins 6 - 4 on Monday night . 	 Minnesota returned home after a 5 - 1 road trip helped re - establish its control of the AL Central . But the loss to Chicago trimmed the Twins ' advantage in the division to two games over idle Cleveland . 	 " In this case
column4: I picked the wrong time to not execute a pitch
column5: " Gibson said . " When I look back at how many pitches I executed and where my stuff was
column6: it 's one of those weird nights where I felt like I threw the ball pretty well and unfortunately got beat by the wrong guy at the wrong time . " 	 Nova ( 9 - 9 ) allowed 10 hits and two runs in 5 1/3 innings
column7: with both runs scoring among Minnesota 's first three batters of the game . 	 Nova improved to 5 - 0 with a 0.85 ERA in his last six starts . Alex Colome worked a rocky ninth for his 24th save in 25 chances . 	 " This was one of the best games I pitched the whole year
column9: ` Why ? ' The way that I was throwing the first two innings it felt like I did n't have my best stuff . I was able to get to the sixth and only give up two runs . They got 10 hits
column10: and to be able to keep them to two runs with a lineup like this it 's a lot of hard work . " 	 Abreu connected for his 27th homer
column11: driving a Gibson offering deep to the second deck above the bullpens in left - center field . 	 Jorge Polanco hit his 18th homer for Minnesota
column12: which leads the league with 241 homers and has an extra - base hit in 79 straight games
column13: the fourth - longest streak in team history . 	 Gibson ( 11 - 6 ) surrendered five runs in 6 2/3 innings . 	 Eddie Rosario hit an RBI single in the ninth
column14: but Colome struck out Miguel Sano with two runners on to end the game . 	 " I did n't see anything wrong with the at bats we took tonight
column15: " Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said . " Sometimes you put them on and do n't bring them in when you need to . It 's tough
column16: it 's frustrating . But I thought the quality of the at - bats were good . " 	 SURPRISE
column17: SURPRISE 	 Chicago got a run in the seventh when Tim Anderson scored on Yolmer Sanchez 's suicide squeeze on an 0 - 2 count . 	 " We gambled
column18: it worked
column19: we tacked on the run
column21: " White Sox manager Rick Renteria said . 	 MISSED OPPORTUNITY 	 The Twins could n't continue their momentum against distant third - place Chicago
column22: which Minnesota had beaten 11 of the previous 14 meetings . Starting Monday
column23: the Twins ' next 13 games are against the White Sox and Detroit Tigers . 	 " We 're trying to approach it the same every day
column24: " Gibson said . " If we win and we beat the teams we 're supposed to beat
column25: we feel pretty good about our chances . We 're two games up and we 're in control of whatever happens . We 've got to come out and play well
column26: and give ourselves a chance by playing solid games . We feel pretty confident how it 's going to shake out . " 	 SQUIRREL ! 	 During Cruz 's at - bat in the first inning
column27: a squirrel ran onto the field near Cruz before running into the Minnesota dugout
column28: sending several players and coaches scurrying away . Sano ran out of the dugout to get out of the way before the squirrel disappeared . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 White Sox : 3B Yoan Moncada was scheduled to play nine innings in the field for Triple - A Charlotte on Monday . It would be Moncada 's first full game in the field since going on the injured list with a right hamstring strain on Aug. 1 . The plan is for Moncada to play nine innings again Tuesday with a potential return to Chicago 's lineup on Thursday . 	 Twins : Cruz was reinstated from the injured list after the minimum 10 - day absence and he will play through the ruptured tendon in his wrist . Cruz has reported being pain - free . ... OF Max Kepler was out of the starting lineup after leaving Sunday 's game due to heat exhaustion . Baldelli said Kepler was available . ... OF Byron Buxton ( left shoulder subluxation ) has taken light swings and reported no issues . Buxton played catch on the field before Monday 's game and has hit off a tee and soft toss . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox : RHP Reynaldo Lopez ( 7 - 10
column29: 5.29 ERA ) will start Tuesday evening
column30: looking to keep his strong run intact . Lopez owns a 2.91 ERA ( 14 earned runs in 43 1/3 innings ) in seven starts since the All - Star break . 	 Twins : RHP Michael Pineda ( 8 - 5
column31: 4.20 ERA ) will make his second start since coming off the injured list after being sidelined by a right triceps strain . column1: PHOENIX --   Carson Kelly is looking more and more like the big - hitting catcher the Arizona Diamondbacks have sought for some time . 	 Kelly 's tiebreaking homer in the eighth inning was part of a three - run rally that sent the Diamondbacks to a 5 - 3 victory over the Colorado Rockies on Monday night . 	 " When you get an offensive catcher as capable as Carson
column2: it adds a whole new dimension and some thickness to your lineup
column3: " Arizona manager Torey Lovullo said . " They do n't come around very often . " 	 Kelly 's 18 home runs are tied with Miguel Montero ( 2011 ) for the most by a catcher in one season in club history . The 25 - year - old who was part of the Paul Goldschmidt trade with St. Louis last offseason has 13 homers while hitting eighth in the order
column4: the highest total in the majors . 	 " Cool ! " Kelly said when told he matched Montero
column5: a two - time All - Star . " Early on
column6: as a young player not having a ton of success
column7: and then finally seeing the work that you put in over the years pay off at the highest level
column8: it just makes me motivated to continue getting better . " 	 David Peralta added a two - run triple in the eighth
column9: making a winner of reliever Yoan Lopez ( 2 - 5 ) after he got two outs in the top of the inning . 	 Wade Davis ( 1 - 6 ) took the loss after giving up Kelly 's home run . 	 " He would like to have that pitch back
column10: " Rockies manager Bud Black said . " If you get back that hanging breaking ball to Kelly
column11: that was sort of the back - breaker for Wade . " 	 Ketel Marte also homered and starter Zac Gallen allowed a run and five hits over six innings in his third start for the Diamondbacks since arriving in a trade with Miami on July 31 . He struck out eight and walked six . 	 Archie Bradley allowed Charlie Blackmon 's 27th home run in the ninth -- Blackmon 's third straight game with a homer -- but earned his fifth save . Arizona climbed back to .500 at 63 - 63
column12: while the Rockies ' four - game winning streak ended . 	 Tony Wolters had two hits and two RBI for Colorado . Chi Chi Gonzalez held the Diamondbacks hitless for five innings before Kelly lined a first - pitch single to center field to open the sixth . 	 The next batter
column14: hit a fly ball toward the left - field corner that looked as though it would fall for a hit . But outfielder Raimel Tapia made a long run and a diving catch as he hit the turf . 	 One out later
column15: Marte drove Gonzalez 's fastball beyond the pool deck in right - center for his 26th home run to give Arizona a 2 - 1 lead . 	 The Rockies tied it in the eighth against reliever Andrew Chafin . Daniel Murphy led off with a single
column16: Ryan McMahon singled with one out and Wolters drove in Murphy with a base hit . 	 But then Diamondbacks shortstop Nick Ahmed
column17: who an inning earlier leaped to catch Trevor Story 's line drive
column18: keyed a 1 - 6 - 3 double play with a rushed but accurate throw . 	 After three scoreless innings
column19: Gallen struggled to find the strike zone . He struck out the first two hitters in the fourth
column20: but loaded the bases on a single and two walks . Wolters drew the third walk of the inning
column21: allowing Murphy to trot home with the game 's first run . 	 " Six walks is not going to sit well with me
column22: but we got a win and that 's what matters
column23: " Gallen said . " Just got to keep us in the game so we can do things like that . " 	 The announced attendance of 15
column24: 443 was the second - smallest crowd of the season for a Diamondbacks home game . 	 ROSTER MOVES 	 The Rockies claimed right - hander Wes Parsons off waivers from Atlanta and optioned him to Triple - A Albuquerque . Parsons was designated for assignment Friday by the Braves . Right - hander Scott Oberg was transferred from the 10 - day injured list to the 60 - day IL after being treated for a blood clot in his pitching arm for the second time in his career Saturday . 	 SPRING FOES AND MATES 	 The Diamondbacks and Rockies announced their 2020 spring training schedules Monday
column25: and will open exhibition play against each other on Feb. 22 at Salt River Fields in nearby Scottsdale
column26: a facility the two teams share . It will mark the 10th season of spring training at the complex
column27: which the two teams have shared since it opened in February 2011 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Rockies : Wolters came up limping with a twisted ankle after trying to throw out Jarrod Dyson at second base on a steal attempt in the eighth . Wolters ' throw sailed into center field for an error
column28: his first of the season . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rockies : LHP Kyle Freeland ( 3 - 10

column2: Texas --   Andrew Heaney was focused on going as deep as he could for the Los Angeles Angels in the opener of a hot day - night doubleheader . 	 After the Angels used eight pitchers in an 11 - inning series - opening loss
column3: and then flipped their scheduled starters Tuesday because of Jaime Barria 's fever
column4: Heaney got an earlier start than expected . The lefty had a career - high 14 strikeouts without a walk over eight innings in a 5 - 1 win over the Texas Rangers in the doubleheader opener . 	 " Considering the circumstance of the extra - inning game last night
column6: he gave us exactly what we needed
column7: " manager Brad Ausmus said . 	 Mike Trout matched the MLB lead with his career - best 42nd homer
column8: a two - run shot in the first inning that put the Angels up 3 - 0 before Heaney ( 3 - 3 ) even threw his first pitch on a day with temperatures in the upper 90s -- it reached 100 degrees during the game . 	 " I was able to keep all of my pitches on line ... tried to just get ahead early obviously
column9: " Heaney said . " Everybody knows it 's hot
column10: just trying to get as deep into the game as I can
column12: all of those things . I think sometimes that should be the mentality you have every single time you go out . " 	 Ausmus said Heaney was able to sit in the shade between innings
column13: and was n't ever on the mound very long . Heaney retired 16 batters in a row after allowing consecutive one - out singles in the first
column14: and allowed only two more hits after that . 	 " He was very methodically going about his business . I think that probably played into him being able to be effective and efficient
column15: " Ausmus said . 	 " Early in the game
column16: I was trying to kind of conserve a little bit
column17: " Heaney said . " Until I got guys on
column18: or two strikes
column19: I just tried to just sort of work ahead . " 	 The doubleheader opener was the makeup of the July 1 game that was postponed after pitcher Tyler Skaggs was found dead in his hotel room the last time the Angels played in Texas . The coroner has n't released a cause of death for Skaggs
column21: who was one of the Skaggs ' best friends
column22: had 10 of his strikeouts during the stretch of 16 consecutive retired batters before Willie Calhoun 's homer with two outs in the sixth . Heaney threw 79 of his 108 pitches for strikes . 	 " He was able to locate all of his pitches today . He was able to go in and out
column23: " Calhoun said . " When you 're able to do that and you 're able to control the ball and manipulate it wherever you want it to go
column24: that 's always a good day for a pitcher . Yeah
column25: he had a really good day . " 	 Luis Rengifo also homered
column26: his two - run shot in the fifth making it 5 - 0 . 	 Joe Palumbo ( 0 - 2 ) was added from Triple - A Nashville as the 26th player for the doubleheader . The lefty lasted only 1 2/3 innings
column27: leaving because of a blister on his left thumb after a 1 - 2 pitch to Trout in the second inning . 	 10 AGAINST TEXAS 	 Trout has 10 homers this year against the Rangers
column28: matching the most ever by an opponent against them in the same season . Oakland 's Khris Davis hit 10 homers against Texas in both 2016 and 2018 . Trout just missed two more homers in the doubleheader opener . He pulled a towering flyball in the fourth that went just left of the foul pole -- there was a crew chief review by the umpires just to make sure -- and he tripled high off the 14 - foot wall in left in the ninth . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : Barria ( 4 - 6 ) had a fever Monday night
column29: so the Angels switched the order of their starters to give him more rest . The right - hander was set to start the nightcap . 	 Rangers : RF Nomar Mazara was put on the 10 - day injured list with a left oblique strain suffered Monday . Infielder Nick Solak was called up and made his major league debut as the DH ; he had a single in the seventh . 	 UP NEXT 	 The Rangers play the nightcap of their third doubleheader since early June
column30: while the Angels wrap up their first twinbill since September 2015 . Lefty Brock Burke is set to make his MLB debut for the Rangers
column31: and he will be the third consecutive Texas starter under age 25 -- the first time that has happened for the Rangers since July 2008 . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third base coach on Monday . column1: BALTIMORE --   It had been a while since the Baltimore Orioles celebrated a victory
column2: so forgive them for getting carried away after finally nabbing their 40th win of a very long season . 	 Rookie Hunter Harvey got a ride in a laundry cart and wheeled into the shower
column3: where he got drenched in the wake of his first big league victory . 	 The celebration was put into motion after the Orioles used Hanser Alberto 's tiebreaking three - run homer in the eighth inning to beat the Kansas City Royals 4 - 1 Tuesday night
column4: ending an eight - game skid . 	 Royals reliever Jacob Barnes ( 1 - 2 ) sandwiched a pair of walks around two outs before Alberto hit a 1 - 1 pitch into the Baltimore bullpen for his eighth home run . As the ball cleared the wall
column5: Alberto raised his right arm in the air and smiled broadly approaching second base . 	 " I saw that big gap between left and center field . I just want to hit the ball over the shortstop
column7: I put in a little more power and I get the home run . " 	 Harvey ( 1 - 0 ) worked a perfect eighth
column8: notching two strikeouts in his first appearance at Camden Yards . 	 Drafted in the first round of the 2013 draft
column9: Harvey endured Tommy John surgery and a variety of before finally making his major league debut last week in Boston . After working a scoreless inning in Fenway Park
column10: the right - hander came up with a heck of an encore against the Royals . 	 " He 's thrown twice and it 's been electric stuff both times
column11: " Orioles manager Brandon Hyde said . 	 " It was awesome
column12: " Harvey said . " When Hanser hit that home run I kind of got little chill bumps and a little wave went over me for a second because it did n't even feel real . " 	 Mychal Givens got three outs for his 10th save . 	 Baltimore had lost 13 of its previous 14 games
column13: including the series opener to Kansas City on Monday . 	 " It 's been tough . It 's not a secret
column15: things changed from tonight
column16: and tomorrow we can win the game and win the series . " 	 Both starters were very sharp
column17: and neither factored in the decision . 	 Dylan Bundy allowed the Royals one run and five hits over seven innings with seven strikeouts . 	 Brad Keller did n't let a runner get past first base until the sixth
column18: when Chance Sisco drew a leadoff walk and went to second on a single . With one out
column19: right fielder Bubba Starling ran far to his right to make a diving catch of a sinking liner by Anthony Santander
column20: and Keller finished his outing by retiring Renato Nunez on a fly ball . 	 " I had a good game plan going in . I really just stuck with my fastball today
column21: " the right - hander said . 	 Keller gave up three hits and left with a 1 - 0 lead
column22: but his bid to earn his first win since July 24 ended when reliever Richard Lovelady allowed a game - tying single to Rio Ruiz in the seventh . 	 Royals manager Ned Yost wants to limit Keller 's activity to preserve his arm for when Kansas City 's rebuild pays off . 	 " He is one of our main guys moving forward . He 's already 20 - something innings past what he threw last year and we 're not even into September yet
column23: " Yost said . " I 'm not going to push him for the rest of this year . " 	 RUTSCHMAN ON RISE 	 Catcher Adley Rutschman
column24: the No . 1 overall pick in the 2019 draft
column25: is moving quickly up Baltimore 's minor league chain . 	 Less than 24 hours after going 5 for 5 for short - season Class A Aberdeen
column26: Rutschman received a promotion to Class A Delmarva on Tuesday . The 21 - year - old is expected to join the Shorebirds on Wednesday . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Royals : RHP Danny Duffy ( left hamstring strain ) threw 65 pitches in a simulated game Tuesday . " We 'll see ( Wednesday ) how he feels and we 'll evaluate after that
column27: " manager Ned Yost said . Duffy has n't pitched since Aug. 3 . ... SS Adalberto Mondesi ( shoulder ) began his rehab assignment with Triple - A Omaha by playing DH and striking out his first three trips to the plate . 	 Orioles : OF Mark Trumbo has missed the entire season while recovering from knee surgery but still has hopes of returning when rosters expand in September . " Probably have to send him out to play some ( rehab ) games prior to that
column28: but as of right now everything is one track
column29: " manager Brandon Hyde said . ... OF Dwight Smith Jr. ( left calf strain ) went 3 for 5 for Triple - A Norfolk on Monday to open his rehab assignment . " There 's no problem at all . He came out healthy
column30: " Hyde said . Smith went 1 for 2 at the DH Tuesday night and will move to the outfield Wednesday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Royals : Mike Montgomery ( 3 - 5

column32: 6.49 ) remains in search of his first win since April 11

column1: PITTSBURGH --   After having little success in his first three times up
column2: Starling Marte came up in the eighth inning with two men on base and the score tied . This time
column3: Stephen Strasburg was n't on the mound and Marte took advantage . 	 Marte hit a tiebreaking
column4: three - run homer off reliever Daniel Hudson and the Pittsburgh Pirates beat the Washington Nationals 4 - 1 Tuesday night . 	 " I 've been doing a good job
column5: " Marte said . " Everybody pushed me to continue to do what I do . But the season 's not over . ... I have to push myself the best I can every night and try to get the support for the other guys . " 	 After watching Pittsburgh struggle against Strasburg through seven innings
column6: Nationals manager Dave Martinez turned to Wander Suero ( 3 - 7 ) to face the left - handed bats coming up in the eighth . Adam Frazier bunted a single past the mound to load the bases with nobody out before Bryan Reynolds tied it 1 - 1 with a sacrifice fly . 	 Marte then drove a fastball from Hudson 397 feet to right - center for his 22nd homer of the season . 	 Despite leaving after throwing just 94 pitches
column7: Strasburg did n't question Martinez ' decision . 	 " ( Martinez ) thought it was enough
column8: " Strasburg said . " I think we win as a team and we lose as a team . Just did n't work out for us tonight . " 	 Suero
column9: who gave up two hits and one walk
column10: was responsible for three of Pittsburgh 's four eighth - inning runs . 	 " My plan was just to get the three outs that I needed to get out of the inning
column12: things did n't go the way I wanted to . " 	 Pirates closer Felipe Vazquez ( 3 - 1 ) went 1 1/3 inning
column13: allowing one hit with one strikeout . 	 Pittsburgh
column14: which is 8 - 28 since the All - Star break
column15: had scored one total run in its previous three games . 	 " The vibe does n't match the record
column16: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " The effort and the energy do n't match the record . We know that . You do n't win games on vibe and you do n't win games on effort . You win games with results . " 	 The Nationals are 1 1/2 games ahead of the Cubs for the NL 's first wild card
column17: and entered having won seven of their previous eight games . They had scored at least 13 runs in each of their previous three games
column18: totaling a franchise - record 43 runs during that stretch . 	 " It 's just weird
column19: baseball
column21: we just could n't get any runs but one . But Strasburg was good . " 	 Strasburg allowed four hits and had six strikeouts in seven innings
column22: and left the game on track for what would have been his career - high 16th win . He has 15 wins in four of his first 10 major league seasons . 	 Pirates reliever Clay Holmes hit Adam Eaton with a pitch before being replaced by Michael Feliz in the fifth . Anthony Rendon drove a double to the gap in right - center field off Feliz

column1: NEW YORK --   Commit a mistake against the New York Mets these days and they are poised to make you pay . 	 Michael Conforto hit a tiebreaking homer moments after an embarrassing error by Cleveland Indians left fielder Oscar Mercado
column2: and the resurgent Mets rolled from there to a 9 - 2 victory Tuesday night . 	 " We just have guys stepping up left and right
column3: " Conforto said . " Just guys getting big hits in big situations . That 's what it 's all about . " 	 J.D. Davis also launched a two - run shot and Steven Matz ( 8 - 7 ) permitted one earned run in 6 1/3 innings as the Mets opened a critical homestand against a trio of pennant contenders with a resounding performance . New York ( 65 - 60 )
column4: which remained two games out of a wild - card spot
column5: has won 19 of 24 to match a season high at five games over .500 . 	 " I think we all knew that even ( though ) it 's August
column7: " Davis said . " We have to have that playoff mentality
column8: that playoff atmosphere that every game counts -- especially the hole that we dug ourselves into . " 	 Pete Alonso hit a two - run double to cap a four - run seventh that broke it open
column9: and Mets manager Mickey Callaway bested former boss Terry Francona in Cleveland 's first trip to Citi Field . 	 Before getting the New York job
column10: Callaway enjoyed an extremely successful five - year stint as Indians pitching coach under Francona . The two still keep in touch regularly
column11: and they had a warm visit in a coaches ' room at the ballpark in the early afternoon . 	 " It 's kind of cool
column12: " Callaway said before the game . " It 'll be fun to be across the field from him . " 	 All - Star Game MVP Shane Bieber ( 12 - 6 ) gave up four runs -- two earned -- and four hits in six innings for the Indians
column13: who fell three games behind first - place Minnesota in the AL Central . Cleveland still leads the wild - card standings . 	 Mercado flubbed an easy fly in shallow left in the sixth
column14: and the Mets took advantage . 	 " I just dropped it
column15: " Mercado said . " I thought I had it just like with every other flyball I 've caught in my life
column16: but it just popped out of my glove . " 	 With two outs
column17: Conforto clocked his 27th homer on a 1 - 2 slider from Bieber for a two - run drive that gave the Mets a 4 - 2 lead . 	 " From there
column18: the game just got away from us
column19: " Francona said . 	 New York reliever Justin Wilson struck out Francisco Lindor and Mercado with two on to end the seventh . 	 Amed Rosario and Joe Panik each had an RBI single in the bottom half before Alonso 's double gave the rookie 97 RBI . 	 " They 're relentless
column20: " Callaway said about his lineup . " That 's what good teams do -- they add on . " 	 Jason Kipnis homered early and hit an RBI single for the Indians
column21: who split a four - game series at Yankee Stadium last weekend to begin an eight - day stay in New York City . 	 LAST STOP 	 Cleveland 's only other road series against the Mets came in June 2004 at Shea Stadium . The only current major league ballpark the Indians have never played in is SunTrust Park in Atlanta . 	 KINGS OF QUEENS 	 New York has won 11 of 12 at Citi Field . ... Matz is 6 - 0 with a 2.07 ERA at home this season . ... Davis is batting .390 with a 1.186 OPS in 48 home games . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Indians : Two - time Cy Young Award winner Corey Kluber was shut down for two weeks with an abdominal strain
column22: an injury he sustained in Sunday 's minor league rehab start during his comeback from a broken arm . Francona said it would n't be fair to speculate about the likelihood of Kluber returning in time to impact Cleveland 's playoff push . ... RHP Jefry Rodriguez ( strained shoulder ) pitched 1 2/3 innings in a rehab appearance for Double - A Akron . OF Bradley Zimmer ( shoulder
column23: oblique ) went 1 for 3 with two RBI as the DH . ... RHP Dan Otero ( shoulder inflammation ) threw two scoreless innings for Triple - A Columbus . ... LHP Tyler Olson ( shingles ) was pulled off his rehab assignment because he was n't feeling well . ... RHP Carlos Carrasco
column24: diagnosed in June with a treatable form of leukemia
column25: is scheduled to pitch Thursday in relief for Akron after making his first appearance Monday . ... OF Jordan Luplow ( strained right hamstring ) resumed sprinting in Cleveland and will be re - evaluated in a week for a return to baseball activities . He has been hitting and throwing . 	 Mets : Right - handed reliever Robert Gsellman
column26: placed on the injured list last weekend
column27: has a partially torn lat muscle that puts the rest of his season in jeopardy . ... Davis returned to the lineup after missing two starts last weekend while nursing a sore calf . ... OF Brandon Nimmo moved to Triple - A Syracuse on his rehab assignment and played center field for five innings . He went 2 for 3 with an RBI . Nimmo has been sidelined since May 21 because of a bulging disk in his neck . ... INF Jed Lowrie began a rehab assignment as the DH for Class A St. Lucie and went 1 for 4 with an RBI . column1: BOSTON --   Phillies shortstop Jean Segura was throwing out Red Sox baserunners from both sides of the infield . 	 Segura made a quick flip to throw out Xander Bogaerts for the first out in the ninth when he attempted go from second to third on a grounder to short . Then
column2: while covering the second base position in a shift
column3: Segura gloved a hard liner and threw to first to double off pinch - runner Chris Owings and end the game . 	 " Segura was on top of his game in that inning
column4: " Philadelphia manager Gabe Kapler said after beating Boston 3 - 2 on Tuesday night . " Real quick reactions
column5: and certainly good positioning by ( infield coach Bobby Dickerson ) . " 	 Segura added a two - run double in the first inning and Aaron Nola ( 12 - 3 ) pitched seven innings of four - hit ball to help Philadelphia snap a two - game losing streak . Nola allowed two runs and one walk while striking out seven to win for the sixth time in his last seven decisions . 	 Kapler said he plans to pitch the right - hander every fifth day
column7: through the end of the season . 	 " We 're in a playoff race and he 's far and away our best and most dependable pitcher
column9: whose team remained two games behind the Cubs and tied with the Mets in the NL wild - card race after both Chicago and New York also won Tuesday night . " It 's time to take that liberty . " 	 In the opener of a two - game interleague series
column10: three of the first four Philadelphia batters reached base
column11: including back - to - back doubles by Bryce Harper and Segura . Boston made it 3 - 2 on Jackie Bradley Jr. 's homer in the third but managed just four more hits the rest of the game . 	 Jose Alvarez and Mike Morin shared the eighth before Hector Neris came on for the ninth and gave up a leadoff double to Bogaerts . 	 Bogaerts was out trying to advance to third on a grounder to the shortstop
column12: and then Owings was doubled off first on a hard liner to Segura
column13: who was shifted between first and second
column14: to end the game . 	 " That 's a no - no and he knows it
column15: " Red Sox manager Alex Cora said about Bogaerts . " That ball was right in front of him and that 's a big mistake right there . " 	 Neris earned his 22nd save . 	 Red Sox starter Brian Johnson ( 1 - 2 ) allowed three runs
column16: six hits and two walks
column17: striking out four in 3 2/3 innings as Boston ended a five - game winning streak . 	 NEAR MISSES 	 Boston 's leadoff batter reached safely five times in nine innings but only one scored . The Red Sox had the potential tying run at second in the fifth and sixth innings with nobody out but both times failed to score . 	 Bogaerts said that was on his mind when he doubled to lead off the ninth . 	 " Probably not the best way to think
column18: but based on how the game was going
column19: I felt like we were on second base a lot and we kind of got stranded the whole game . It was just a risk that I took to try and get to third
column20: " Bogaerts said . " Obviously it was n't the right decision . " 	 FOUL CALL 	 Cora was upset about a call in the fourth inning
column21: when Rhys Hoskins hit a chopper right down the line that was fielded by third baseman Rafael Devers behind the bag . Third base umpire Vic Carapazza spread his arms -- apparently signaling a foul ball -- but the play continued . 	 Devers threw to second
column22: but did not get the runner retreating to the bag ; there was no play at first . Hoskins was credited with a single . 	 J.T. Realmuto struck out to end the inning . 	 RELIEF 	 The Boston bullpen kept up its strong run
column23: allowing just one baserunner in 5 1/3 innings . Over the past six games
column24: the Red Sox relievers have allowed only two earned runs in 26 2/3 innings pitched . They have not allowed a homer in 102 batters . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Phillies : RHP Jake Arrieta ( elbow ) was transferred to the 60 - day injury list . 	 Red Sox : LHP David Price ( wrist ) threw in the bullpen before the game and could return to the roster as soon as this weekend in San Diego . 	 UP NEXT 	 Phillies : LHP Drew Smyly ( 2 - 6
column25: 7.09 ERA ) is 1 - 1 in five starts for Philadelphia since being acquired from Texas in July . The Phillies are 4 - 1 in the games Smyly has started . 	 Red Sox : RHP Rick Porcello ( 11 - 9
column26: 5.49 ) has won six of his last eight starts and is second on the club in victories . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column2: Fla. --   Tom Murphy is on a power surge unprecedented for a Seattle catcher
column3: and it is coming at a bad time for the Tampa Bay Rays . 	 Murphy hit a tiebreaking homer
column4: his sixth in the last four games
column5: in the sixth inning Tuesday night to lift the Mariners to a 7 - 4 win over the Rays . 	 Murphy 's 16th homer of the season came off Jalen Beeks ( 5 - 3 ) after a walk to Kyle Seager . Murphy became the first Mariners catcher to homer in four straight games . He said it is a matter of " staying within the strike zone
column6: " like he did for two months in Triple - A back in 2016 . 	 " I can see it like it was yesterday
column7: " Murphy said . " It was the best I 've ever hit in my life
column8: that 's for sure . ... I do n't have the numbers off the top of my head
column9: but it feels like everything I hit was hard hit . " 	 That 's the same way it looks now to Seattle manager Scott Servais while watching Murphy and Seager
column10: who also homered . 	 " Those guys are really locked in right now
column12: " Servais said . 	 Tommy Milone ( 3 - 7 ) got the win after giving up four runs in five innings of relief
column13: helping Seattle to its sixth victory in eight games . Matt Magill pitched the ninth for his second save in two tries . 	 The Rays
column14: who have dropped to 33 - 31 at home by losing three of five games to last - place teams on their current homestand
column15: began the day one game ahead of Oakland for the AL 's second wild card . The Athletics hosted the New York Yankees later . 	 " We 've been in a rut here for a little while . To be honest
column16: it 's been a grind here since we 've gotten back home
column17: " said Rays manager Kevin Cash . 	 " We 're not playing good baseball right now
column18: that 's fair to say
column19: " said center fielder Kevin Kiermaier . " I think it all stems from our offense . We just do n't have a lot of guys locked in right now
column20: to be quite honest . " 	 Seager 's 17th home run off Rays opener Diego Castillo drove in Seattle 's first two runs . It was Seager 's eighth homer during a 14 - game hitting streak
column21: and he drove in another run with a double in the seventh . 	 Willy Adames and Kiermaier had back - to - back hits in the second inning and again in the fourth
column22: helping Tampa Bay take a 4 - 2 lead off Milone . 	 Austin Nola 's two - out double brought the Mariners back to a 4 - 4 tie in the fifth . 	 MCKAY MOVEMENT 	 Cash said two - way player Brendan McKay
column23: optioned to Triple - A Durham after allowing seven runs over two innings in Monday 's 9 - 3 loss to Seattle
column24: will likely be called back up around Sept. 1 . " We 've got a lot of confidence in Brendan
column25: he 's going to be really good for us
column26: " Cash said . " He 's just hitting a little bit of a speed bump where he lost his way with his command . " The lefty was 1/3 with an 8.69 ERA in last his five starts after allowing a combined three runs over his first three big league outings . 	 MARINER PITCHING PLANS 	 The Mariners will call up 23 - year - old LHP Justus Sheffield for his first major league start Friday night against Toronto . With RHP Felix Hernandez plugged back into the rotation Saturday

column1: CINCINNATI --   Freddy Galvis has spent less than two weeks with the Cincinnati Reds . Manager David Bell is already a big fan . 	 Bell 's appreciation for Galvis grew Tuesday when the   second baseman hit a tie - breaking two - run homer in the sixth inning
column2: and Aristides Aquino added an RBI single as Cincinnati beat the San Diego Padres 3 - 2 . 	 " Freddie Galvis just likes to play
column3: " Bell said . " He shows you that in a number of ways . He is a guy that always wants the ball hit to him . He always wants to be the one at the plate in important situations . " 	 Galvis
column4: claimed off waivers from Toronto on August 12
column5: followed Josh VanMeter 's second hit of the game with an opposite - field drive to left off Cal Quantrill . It was his second home run in two nights and career - high 21st of the season . 	 " It 's tough when your team gives you a chance to win
column6: " Quantrill said . " ( Manager ) Andy Green trusted me to go out for the sixth
column7: and I did n't do the job . Different ballparks play differently . If you do n't like it
column8: make a better pitch . " 	 Aquino went 1 for 4 and his streak of consecutive plate appearances without a home run increased to 13
column9: the longest of his brief career . 	 Sonny Gray struck out 10 batters in six innings
column10: reaching double figures for the third time this season and seventh in his career . He won his third consecutive start and improved to 4 - 0 in his last five outings . Gray ( 9 - 6 ) gave up four hits and three walks . 	 " My fastball had a lot of life early on
column12: 6 - 1 in his last nine starts overall and 7 - 0 in his last seven home starts . " I have to do a better job doing that longer . In the last inning
column13: I started pulling my fastball a little bit
column14: trying to make the perfect pitch . That 's why I had those two walks in that inning . " 	 " Sonny Gray was good tonight
column15: " Green said . " His slider
column16: his curve and his command in to lefties which is something you do n't see too much . " 	 Robert Stephenson pitched a perfect seventh inning . Amir Garrett
column17: in his first appearance after serving an eight - game suspension for precipitating a brawl with Pittsburgh on July 30
column18: walked the two batters he faced on nine pitches and was charged with an unearned run on Jose Iglesias 's throwing error before Michael Lorenzen prevented further damage . 	 Raisel Iglesias pitched the ninth for his 24th save . 	 Quantrill ( 6 - 4 ) almost matched Gray strikeout - for - strikeout . He tied a career - high with nine strikeouts with no walks in six innings
column19: allowing five hits and three runs . 	 VanMeter led off the bottom of the first with a single to right field . He stole second and went to third on a throwing error by catcher Austin Hedges before scoring on Aquino 's bloop single to right field . 	 Naylor tied it with his seventh homer
column20: a two - out shot to center in the sixth . The Padres loaded the bases in the inning
column21: but Manuel Margot lined out to center fielder Nick Senzel
column22: ending the threat . 	 IMPRESSIVE COMPANY 	 Naylor 's homer snapped Gray 's streak of consecutive scoreless innings at a career - high 23 . The streak was the longest by a Reds pitcher since reliever J.J. Hoover 's 26 1/3 inning stretch in 2013
column23: the longest by a Cincinnati starter since Tom Browning 's 23 - inning streak in 1990
column24: and the longest by a Reds right - handed starter since Tom Seaver went 27 innings in 1977 . 	 MORE IMPRESSIVE COMPANY 	 Gray and Trevor Bauer
column25: who had 11 strikeouts on Monday
column26: are the first Reds pitchers to reach double figures in strikeouts in back - to - back games since Gary Nolan and Jim Maloney in September 1968 . 	 FIRST STARTS 	 Quantrill 's start was his first in an NL Central ballpark . Gray 's was his first against San Diego
column27: giving him at least one start against all 30 major league teams . 	 STRUGGLING 	 San Diego 's team batting average with the bases loaded slipped to .205
column28: lowest in the National League and ahead of only Tampa Bay and Detroit . The Padres ' 16 bases - loaded hits lead only the Tigers . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Padres : RHP Jacob Nix ( elbow strain ) allowed three hits and one walk with six strikeouts over five scoreless innings in the first start of his rehab assignment with Triple - A El Paso on Monday . 	 Reds : 2B Jose Iglesias was shaken up when he was smacked in the face by SS Jose Iglesias while they were chasing a pop in short center field . Both players went down and several divots were kicked up
column29: but Galvis stayed in the game after being looked at by a trainer . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres : No starter for Wednesday 's series finale was announced . 	 Reds : RHP Luis Castillo set single - game career highs by allowing nine hits
column30: eight runs and three home runs in his last start on Friday against St. Louis . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 In a free - agent field filled with future Hall of Famers

column1: ATLANTA --   Freddie Freeman took an unintended break this past weekend . 	 He was back at work Tuesday night . 	 The Atlanta slugger homered twice and drove in four runs
column2: leading the Braves past the Miami Marlins 5 - 1 in another testy game between the NL East rivals . 	 After going 0 - for-12 with five strikeouts during a three - game series against the Dodgers
column3: this was more line with what the Braves expect from Freeman . 	 " You knew somebody was going to pay
column4: " Atlanta manager Brian Snitker said . " It was inevitable . You 're not going to keep that guy down . " 	 Freeman sent one went the opposite way into the Marlins bullpen against Elieser Hernandez in the fourth . The next inning
column5: he went deep again with two outs to break a 1 - 1 tie
column6: launching a pitch from Tyler Kinley ( 1 - 1 ) into the right - field seats for his 33rd homer of the season . 	 The third Miami pitcher
column8: did n't fare any better against Freeman
column9: giving up a two - run single in the seventh . 	 Freeman now has 102 RBI -- the second 100 - RBI season of his career . He had 109 in 2013 . 	 " That was a long three days
column11: referring to his struggles against the Dodgers . " I took the weekend off . " 	 Dallas Keuchel ( 4 - 5 ) went six innings
column12: limiting the Marlins to Jon Berti 's third - inning homer -- quite an improvement from the eight runs and 10 hits he surrendered in 3 2/3 innings at Miami on Aug. 8 . The left - hander benefited from a pair of double plays and stranded six runners
column13: four of them in scoring position . 	 His last pitch was a high fastball that fanned Jorge Alfaro with runners at first and third . 	 " We had some chances
column14: " Marlins manager Don Mattingly said . " The double - play balls hurt us more than anything else . " 	 Hernandez plunked Atlanta star Ronald Acuna Jr. in the back with his very first pitch of the game
column15: rekindling tensions between the teams and leading to Snitker 's ejection . 	 Last season
column16: Jose Urena was suspended after he drilled Acuna with a pitch . In May
column17: then - Braves pitcher Kevin Gausman was kicked out for throwing behind Urena . 	 Acuna lingered in front of home plate
column18: staring down Hernandez
column19: before being ushered to first . When plate umpire Alan Porter warned both teams against further retaliation
column20: Snitker popped out of the dugout and was given the heave by crew chief Mark Wegner . 	 " I felt like if they needed to give him a warning
column21: they should 've thrown him out of the game
column22: " Snitker said . " Especially in light of the past things that happened . " 	 Mattingly said there was " zero intent . " 	 " There 's no reason for us to hit Acuna
column23: " the manager said . 	 Hernandez struck another hitter in the fourth
column24: getting Adeiny Hechavarria on the left elbow
column25: but the umpires took no action . Acting Braves manager Walt Weiss emerged from the dugout and could be seen asking Porter
column26: " What did you give the warning for ? " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : Hernandez was lifted after four innings and 68 pitches because of a blister on his right middle finger . He was listed as day to day . ... RHP Pablo Lopez ( shoulder strain ) is set to throw a rehab start at Triple - A New Orleans on Wednesday
column27: which could be one of his final tuneups before a return to the rotation . 	 Braves : C Brian McCann left the game after the third inning because of left knee soreness
column28: another potential blow to a team already reeling from a rash of injuries . ... OF Austin Riley ( knee ) worked out on the field before the game and may be able to begin a rehab stint in the minors by the weekend . ... SS Dansby Swanson ( foot ) is set to take batting practice and run the bases before Wednesday 's game
column29: though there 's still no timetable for his return . 	 MILESTONE 	 Keuchel recorded the 1
column30: 000th strikeout of his career when he fanned Hernandez on three pitches to start the third . 	 The Braves lefty tossed the ball into the dugout as a souvenir
column31: while the crowd gave him a short ovation . 	 NET GAIN 	 Snitker praised the Braves ' decision to add protective netting all the way to the foul poles at SunTrust Park . 	 While Major League Baseball has yet to require netting beyond the dugouts
column32: the Braves joined a growing list of teams by announcing Monday that extra protection will go up by the end of September . 	 " I do n't know of anybody who puts a uniform on that does n't embrace it
column33: " Snitker said . 	 New Braves outfielder Billy Hamilton agreed . 	 " You never want to see someone get hurt at a baseball game
column34: " he said . " If a kid comes to his first game and gets hit
column35: he 'll never want to come to a game again . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Braves RHP Julio Teheran will look to bounce back from the shortest start of his career when he goes Wednesday in the second of three games between the teams . Teheran ( 7 - 8
column36: 3.71 ERA ) lasted just 1 1/3 innings against the New York Mets last Thursday
column37: surrendering six runs . The Marlins will go with LHP Caleb Smith ( 8 - 6
column39: who is 1 - 2 with a 5.73 ERA in four career starts vs. Atlanta . 	 --- 	 Follow Paul Newberry on Twitter at https://twitter.com/pnewberry1963 and find his work at https://apnews.com 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Braves added depth at catcher by signing Manny Pina to a two - year

column1: ST . LOUIS --   Dexter Fowler was focused more on his team getting a win rather than his own production . 	 Fowler hit a bases - loaded double and drove in four runs
column2: leading the St. Louis Cardinals past the Milwaukee Brewers 9 - 4 on Tuesday night in the second game of the series between NL Central contenders . 	 " It 's awesome to win games like this
column3: " Fowler said . " Any time you get division wins against a top - tier team in your division
column4: that 's a plus . " 	 Tyler Webb ( 1 - 1 ) earned his first major - league victory with one - third inning of work in his 79th career game . He struck out pitch - hitter Ben Gamel on four pitches . Six Cardinals combined to throw 170 pitches in the game . 	 The Cardinals have won nine of their last 11 games
column5: while the Brewers have lost six of their last eight . St. Louis remained in first place by a half - game over the Chicago Cubs
column6: who beat San Francisco 5 - 3 . Third - place Milwaukee is four games back . 	 St. Louis broke the game open with a four - run sixth against three Milwaukee relievers . Jeremy Jeffress ( 3 - 4 ) loaded the bases . Alex Claudio came in and struck out Kolten Wong . Junior Guerra entered and walked Harrison Bader
column7: who was recalled earlier in the day . After striking out pinch - hitter Matt Carpenter
column8: Fowler hit a 3 - 2 pitch into short left field that fell between three Brewers for a double and a 5 - 2 lead . 	 " That was a huge play play
column9: " Cardinals manager Mike Shildt said . " I knew it had a chance and that it was falling fast . We got the carousel going . And we kept adding on from there . " 	 The Brewers believed the ball should have been caught . 	 " That was a tough ball to get to but I think we need to make that play
column10: " Milwaukee shortstop Orlando Arcia said . " I think that was the play of the game . If we make that play
column11: everything changes . Somebody has to call that ball . " 	 Milwaukee manager Craig Counsell agreed . 	 " Fowler just hit it between our guys
column12: " Counsell said . " We did n't catch the ball and they scored a bunch of runs . Three guys going for it and nobody could get to it . " 	 Wong hit a two - run single in the seventh
column13: making it 7 - 2 . The Cardinals added two more runs when Fowler and Tommy Edman drew bases - loaded walks . 	 Milwaukee went ahead 2 - 1 in the sixth . A two - out
column14: run - scoring single by Eric Thames off reliever John Gant was charged to rookie Ryan Helsley
column15: who pitched 1 1/3 innings . Gant allowed back - to - back singles by Hernan Perez and Orlando Arcia for the second run before giving way to Webb . 	 Yadier Molina drove in the Cardinals ' first run
column16: scoring Marcell Ozuna in the fourth . St. Louis then loaded the bases with two outs . Lane Thomas hit for starter Michael Wacha but flew out to center . 	 " That 's life in the National League I guess
column17: " Wacha said . " You do n't know how many opportunities you 'll get in a game and that was his decision to make . Obviously
column18: I was feeling good out there . " 	 Wacha struck out five
column19: allowing three hits and a walk in throwing 73 pitches . 	 Milwaukee scored its final two runs in the eighth . 	 WALK THIS WAY 	 Six Milwaukee pitchers combined for nine walks . It was the most walks the Cardinals
column21: have received in a game this season . 	 LOOK WHAT I GOT 	 Bader displayed his signature defensive skills . The speedy Bader ran in from deep center
column22: dove and caught a sinking fly hit by Keston Hura just above the ground before landing hard in the sixth inning . Bader held up his glove the whole time to show he had the ball . 	 ROSTER MOVES 	 To make room for Bader
column24: the Cardinals optioned rookie outfielder Randy Arozarena
column26: to the Redbirds . Bader
column27: who appeared in 90 games with the Cardinals to begin the season
column28: was batting .317 with seven home runs and 15 RBI in 16 games with Memphis . He was batting .195 with six home runs and 19 RBI at the time of his option . Arozarena had two hits in eight at - bats in his week with the Cardinals . He is batting a combined .349 with 10 homers and 42 RBI in 80 games with Memphis and Double - A Springfield this season . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Brewers : OF Lorenzo Cain was back in the lineup . He did pinch - hit Monday and struck out . He sat out Milwaukee 's Saturday and Sunday games in Washington . He tweaked his oblique in Friday 's game against the Nationals . 	 Cardinals : OF Tyler O'Neill ( left wrist strain ) likely will head out Wednesday to Triple - A Memphis for a rehab assignment . He took batting practice Tuesday . 	 UP NEXT 	 Brewers : Adrian Houser ( 5 - 5
column29: 3.76 ) Houser is 0 - 1 with a 6.43 ERA in three career games against St. Louis . His April 22 start this season in St. Louis resulted in a 13 - 5 in which Houser went four innings
column30: allowing five runs on nine hits
column31: including two home runs . 	 Cardinals : Adam Wainwright ( 9 - 8
column32: 4.33 ) has nine career home victories over the Brewers are his most against any opponent and his 16 wins overall against Milwaukee are tied for tied for first ( with Cubs ) for his most wins against any opponent . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: CHICAGO --   Cole Hamels is searching for his usual form . It 's a work in progress . 	 He found a way Tuesday night . 	 Hamels pitched six innings for his first win in two months
column2: leading the Chicago Cubs to a 5 - 3 victory over the San Francisco Giants . 	 " It 's just kind of the baby steps and getting back to knowing what I 'm capable of doing
column3: " Hamels said . 	 Anthony Rizzo homered twice for Chicago
column4: and Nicholas Castellanos also went deep . Jonathan Lucroy contributed a key run - scoring single after Chicago won a replay challenge . 	 The Cubs ( 67 - 58 ) earned their third straight win and stayed a half - game back of NL Central - leading St. Louis
column5: which posted a 9 - 4 win over Milwaukee . 	 Hamels ( 7 - 4 ) permitted three runs and five hits in his first win since June 12 at Colorado . The left - hander went 0 - 2 with a 6.12 ERA in his previous six starts
column6: including a shaky performance at Philadelphia last week . 	 " It 's kind of like when you have that golf swing and you 're thinking about 10 different things and you ca n't hit the ball off the tee box
column8: I can get the ball off the tee box right now . " 	 San Francisco dropped to 3 - 2 on a nine - game trip . Austin Slater hit a two - run homer for the Giants ( 63 - 63 )
column9: and Kevin Pillar added a solo drive . 	 The game was tied at 3 when the Cubs went ahead to stay in the fifth
column10: helped by a successful challenge . 	 With no outs and Rizzo on first
column11: Javier Baez hit a hard grounder to first baseman Brandon Belt . Thinking Belt had already touched first
column12: Rizzo headed back to the bag as Baez motored down the line . 	 Rizzo and Baez bumped into each other just beyond the base as shortstop Abiatal Avelino made the relay to first . It was originally called a double play
column13: but Baez was ruled safe after the review . 	 " Could n't get that double play
column14: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " That hurt . " 	 Baez advanced on Kyle Schwarber 's walk and scored when Lucroy singled against Fernando Abad ( 0 - 1 ) . Lucroy 's liner went off Belt 's glove and into right field . 	 " I think I put all I had into it and just came up a little short
column15: " Belt said . 	 Kyle Ryan and Rowan Wick each got three outs before Craig Kimbrel finished for his 10th save in 12 chances . It was Kimbrel 's first save opportunity since he returned Sunday after being sidelined by right knee inflammation . 	 Rizzo went 3 for 3 and scored three times in his first multihomer game this season . Castellanos hit his seventh homer in 18 games since he was acquired in a July 31 trade with Detroit . 	 Castellanos " has great at - bats every at - bat
column16: " Rizzo said
column17: " and that 's big . You add another professional at - bat every time and he 's doing damage . " 	 Rizzo gave Chicago a 3 - 2 lead when he led off the third with his 23rd homer
column18: a drive to right off Tyler Beede . But Pillar responded with his team - high 18th homer in the fourth . 	 WATCHING ZOBRIST 	 The Cubs announced veteran infielder Ben Zobrist will play for Double - A Tennessee on Thursday and Triple - A Iowa on Friday and Saturday . 	 Zobrist is working his way back to the majors after going on the restricted list May 8 . Zobrist

column1: HOUSTON --   Houston 's win over Detroit on was tempered by news that shortstop Carlos Correa and starter Aaron Sanchez are both heading to the injured list . 	 George Springer
column2: Jose Altuve and Martin Maldonado homered to lead the Astros to a 6 - 3 victory Tuesday night before manager A.J. Hinch announced the impending moves . 	 Their early offensive surge against Spencer Turnbull ( 3 - 12 ) came on a night Sanchez did n't get out of the third inning . He allowed four hits and three runs with two walks in a season - low 2 1/3 innings in his fourth start since a trade from Toronto . The team did n't say he was injured during the game
column3: but Hinch said afterward that Sanchez had been dealing with a sore pectoral muscle for some time and that he would be placed on the injured list Wednesday . 	 " He did n't look like himself and the reason I took him out was I saw a little decline in ( velocity )
column4: " Hinch said . " He started going to his breaking ball all the time . We want him to throw more breaking balls
column5: but it looked like he was just trying to spin the ball in there . " 	 Sanchez said he 's been experiencing soreness in his pectoral muscle for six or seven starts and that he 'd been trying to work through it . 	 " It 's kind of been up and down and obviously today when my ( velocity ) drops the way it did
column6: there 's no sense in trying to push through it
column7: " he said . " Especially knowing where this team is going
column8: and I want to be a part of that down the stretch . So the best bet is just to figure out what 's going on and work from there . " 	 Correa will also be placed on the IL Wednesday after leaving Monday night 's game after the first inning with back discomfort . It will be the second stint on the IL this season for Correa
column9: who missed two months earlier this season after his rib was fractured during a massage . 	 Brad Peacock ( 7 - 6 ) took over for Sanchez and struck out three in 1 2/3 scoreless innings . Collin McHugh
column10: Joe Smith and Ryan Pressly combined to pitch four scoreless frames before Roberto Osuna collected his 29th save in 34 opportunities with a perfect ninth . 	 Turnbull allowed six hits and five runs in three innings
column11: losing his eighth straight decision . 	 Victor Reyes hit his first career leadoff homer for the Tigers . 	 The Astros tied it up when Springer went deep for his 10th leadoff homer this season . That 's a franchise record
column12: eclipsing the nine Springer hit in 2017 . Three pitches later
column13: Altuve launched a homer into the right - field seats . 	 " When we start the game with two homers that 's a great start
column14: and George and Jose both jump - started us a bit
column15: " Hinch said . " We do n't have to rely on the homer . I think that 's one of the beauties of this offense . But when we do homer everybody loves it . It 's part of our identity . It 's not our entire identity as an offense . " 	 Altuve had a two - out RBI single in the second
column16: and Michael Brantley followed with a two - run double that made it 5 - 1
column17: extending his hitting streak to 14 games . 	 Miguel Cabrera drew a bases - loaded walk in the third against Sanchez
column18: who was lifted one batter later . Peacock allowed Dawel Lugo 's RBI fielder 's choice to make it 5 - 3
column19: but the Tigers could n't draw closer . 	 Maldonado homered to left - center in the fifth . 	 It was the second straight night the Tigers lost despite finishing with more hits than Houston . Detroit had 10 hits
column20: but was 1 for 7 with runners in scoring position and left nine batters stranded as the team dropped its fourth straight . 	 " Turnbull was all over the place
column21: misfiring . ... There was a lot of traffic out there
column23: it kind of took us out of our flow of offense because we were playing so much defense
column24: " manager Ron Gardenhire said . " And that 's what normally happens . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : RHP Josh James ( right shoulder soreness ) is improving and could begin a rehabilitation assignment soon . Hinch said James

column26: likely wo n't rejoin the team until September . 	 HE SAID IT 	 Turnbull on giving up consecutive homers to start the game : " It was definitely a jolt . Definitely really frustrating . I was like ... ` That 's not how I want to start the game off . ' But I tried to shake it off as quick as I could . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Tigers : LHP Daniel Norris ( 3 - 10

column1: PHOENIX --   Eduardo Escobar is collecting some memorabilia to go along with the flashy statistics he 's posting this season . 	 Escobar had a lineup card and encased baseball Tuesday night
column2: keepsakes for his most recent accomplishments . 	 The ball was from the two - run triple Escobar hit in the sixth inning
column3: which gave him 100 RBI on the season . That triple was part of a five - run rally that gave the Diamondbacks a big lead
column4: and Arizona held on to beat the Colorado Rockies 8 - 7 . 	 " For sure I 'm going to put it in my office
column7: admitting he never imagined 100 RBI in a season . " I am so glad and so happy to play for this team . I love it here and I believe in my guys . " 	 Pinch - hitter Jake Lamb broke a 3 - 3 tie with pinch - hit single before Escobar came up
column8: and the Diamondbacks scored five runs in the sixth off Colorado starter Kyle Freeland ( 3 - 11 ) and reliever Bryan Shaw . 	 Escobar became the third player in Diamondbacks history with 20 - plus doubles
column9: 20 or more home runs and at least 10 triples in a season
column10: joining Steve Finley ( 1999 and 2003 ) and Stephen Drew ( 2008 ) . He also became the first National League switch - hitter with 100 RBI since Chase Headley accomplished the feat with the San Diego Padres in 2012 . 	 He 's the ninth Diamondbacks player to reach 100 RBI
column11: and he 's the only player in the major leagues with 10 or more doubles
column12: triples and home runs this season . 	 " What can you say about Eduardo Escobar ? We 've got to appreciate exactly what 's he 's done here in Arizona for us this year
column14: admitting he could have given his third baseman a little more rest earlier in the season . " This is n't the time to rest him
column15: so he 's got to grind through this and step up and do what he 's doing . " 	 Nick Ahmed homered and drove in two runs . He set a career high for home runs with his 17th and matched his career - best RBI total with 70 . 	 Arizona 's 34 home runs against the Rockies is a franchise record against an opposing team in a season . 	 Lamb
column16: batting for starting pitcher Alex Young ( 5 - 3 ) with one out and the bases loaded
column17: bounced a hit through the middle to drive in two runs
column18: and Ketel Marte followed with an RBI on a fielder 's choice ahead of Escobar 's triple . 	 David Peralta had three hits
column19: Young lasted six innings with three runs allowed and Archie Bradley got his sixth save . 	 " Any game where we can just grind out wins consecutively is huge
column20: " Young said . " It does n't matter how we win . " 	 Bradley gave up a run in the ninth inning after Charlie Blackmon led off with a double . 	 " We had a couple of chances throughout the game and could n't get that big knock
column21: " Rockies manager Bud Black said . " We got the tying run
column22: the go - ahead run to the plate a couple of different times and we could n't really capitalize . " 	 The Diamondbacks stayed within striking distance for an NL wild card
column23: four games behind the Chicago Cubs . 	 Nolan Arenado homered in his 1
column25: and Trevor Story had four hits and two RBI 	 The Rockies led 2 - 1 in the top of the fourth after Arenado 's 31st home run of the season
column26: a two - run shot . Down 8 - 3
column27: Colorado rallied with three runs in the seventh
column28: but could n't catch up . 	 Freeland left the game with one out in the bottom of the sixth with a strained groin . He allowed three earned runs on five hits . 	 STRANGE THINGS 	 Peralta stumbled in left field and fell as he set up to throw the ball to the infield on Tapia 's fifth - inning single . 	 It did n't cost the Diamondbacks for the moment
column29: and Peralta smiled as he got to his feet and waved to the cheering crowd . 	 The Rockies ' Daniel Murphy hit a ground rule double in the sixth because the ball got stuck under the padding of the right field foul pole . 	 And for good measure
column30: a Wilmer Flores foul ball knocked over a phone in the press box . 	 ROSTER MOVE 	 The Diamondbacks called up infielder Ildemaro Vargas from Triple - A Reno before Tuesday 's game after they optioned pitcher Bo Takahashi to Double - A Jackson following Monday 's game . 	 Vargas has split time between Arizona and Reno this season . Takahashi
column32: was brought up for his first Major League stint on Sunday
column33: but did not make an appearance in the brief time he was with the Diamondbacks . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rockies : RHP Jon Gray ( 11 - 8
column34: 3.84 earned run average ) is scheduled to start the series finale against Arizona
column35: and is coming off eight scoreless innings of five - hit ball in his last start
column36: Aug. 16 against Miami . 	 Diamondbacks : RHP Mike Leake ( 0 - 1
column37: 7.71 ERA with Diamondbacks ; 9 - 9

column2: Calif. --   The Oakland Athletics wasted little time responding to an early blow from the New York Yankees . 	 Matt Olson and Mark Canha hit back - to - back homers in the first inning to lead the A 's over the New York Yankees 6 - 2 on Tuesday night for their fifth win in six games . 	 " I feel like we 've been doing that lately
column3: " Olson said . " If we give up a run or two
column4: we find a way to come in and respond . To shut down any momentum is nice to do . " 	 Olson connected on a two - run shot down the right field line with two outs in the first off Domingo German ( 16 - 3 ) for his 26th homer
column5: and Canha followed with his 19th on a drive to right - center . 	 That helped carry the A 's to a win in the first meeting between the teams since the Yankees eliminated Oakland in the wild - card playoff last season . These teams could meet again come the postseason with New York holding the best record in the American League and the A 's moving one percentage point ahead of Tampa Bay in the race for the second wild - card spot . 	 This was the first of six games in less than two weeks between these teams with Oakland visiting New York next weekend . 	 " You 'd like to start out well
column6: especially at home knowing we 're going to play them six times in the next 12 days
column7: " Oakland manager Bob Melvin said . " It 's nice to get a first - game win . " 	 The early outburst proved to be more than enough for Homer Bailey ( 11 - 8)
column8: who shut the Yankees down after allowing a solo homer to Gary Sanchez in the first inning . Bailey allowed one run and seven hits in 5 2/3 innings to improve to 3 - 0 at home since joining Oakland last month in a trade from Kansas City . He walked none and struck out eight . 	 The Yankees have lost two straight after starting August with 15 wins in 18 games . 	 " We got a lot of hits but we just could n't get that hit to kind of put us over the top
column9: " manager Aaron Boone said . " Been a couple days of that where we 've had some opportunities and have n't been able to cash in . " 	 Marcus Semien added an RBI double in the second inning and Stephen Piscotty hit an RBI single in the sixth 	 German had his career - best seven - game winning streak snapped after allowing six runs -- five earned -- and eight hits in 5 1/3 innings . 	 Aaron Judge added a solo homer in the eighth for the Yankees
column10: a 467 - foot drive to left field that was the first long ball he has pulled all season . 	 " Direction does n't matter
column11: " Judge said . " As long as they go over the fence and it adds runs
column12: I 'm happy with it . Left or right or center . Just glad to get one . " 	 TRAINERS ROOM 	 Yankees : 1B Luke Voit ( sports hernia ) is slated to start a rehab assignment at Triple - A Scranton / Wilkes - Barre on Friday and could be back in the majors when the Yankees return home Aug. 30 . ... OF Giancarlo Stanton ( right knee sprain ) will ramp up his work on this road trip
column13: doing work on the field and taking BP . ... New York agreed to a minor league contract with RHP Trevor Rosenthal . 	 Athletics : Prized pitching prospect A.J. Puk was called up from Triple - A Las Vegas . Puk
column14: who underwent reconstructive elbow surgery last year
column15: is on a innings restriction and working out of the bullpen . ... The A 's released RHP Marco Estrada . 	 SCOREBOARD STREAK 	 The Yankees did n't take long to get on the board with Sanchez 's solo homer in the first inning marking the 209th straight game they had gone without being shut out . That broke a tie with Cincinnati ( 2000 - 01 ) for the third longest streak . Only Milwaukee with 212 straight in 1978 - 79 and the Yankees with 308 in 1931 - 33 had longer streaks . 	 HALL OF FAME 	 The A 's honored longtime sports writer Ron Bergman in a pregame ceremony as the first journalist inducted into the team 's Hall of Fame . Bergman covered the franchise during its win of three straight World Series titles in the 1970s and was the author of " Mustache Gang
column16: " which chronicled the first title team in 1972 . Bergman 's children
column17: Adam and Anne
column18: accepted the award on behalf of their late father . 	 UP NEXT 	 Mike Fiers ( 11 - 3 ) seeks to win his 10th straight decision when the A 's take on J.A. Happ ( 10 - 7 ) and the Yankees in the middle game of the three - game series . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday . column1: LOS ANGELES --   As good as he felt last week in Miami striking out 10 in seven scoreless innings
column2: Clayton Kershaw felt equally as bad back home at Dodger Stadium . 	 " It 's a humbling game
column4: Kershaw navigated his way through six innings to pass Sandy Koufax for most wins by a Dodgers left - hander and Los Angeles routed the Toronto Blue Jays 16 - 3 Tuesday night . 	 " It 's special
column6: who at the same time is loath to consider the big picture when it comes to his career achievements . " All the historical stuff is for me to look back on when I retire . I 'm not too focused on that
column7: but try not to take it for granted . " 	 Kershaw ( 13 - 2 ) earned his 166th career victory
column8: breaking a tie with Koufax for fifth on the club 's wins list . He allowed three runs and six hits -- including two homers by rookie sensation Bo Bichette . He struck out six and walked three . 	 " I was pretty bad
column9: so thankful we scored that many runs
column10: " Kershaw said . " You just got to compete . Try to focus on the next pitch as best you can . It 's not going to look pretty at times . " 	 Dodgers rookie Will Smith hit a go - ahead
column11: two - run homer in the third inning -- one of five by the National League leaders who have hit 223 . Cody Bellinger notched his NL - leading and career - high 100th RBI of the season
column12: driving in three with a double that extended the Dodgers ' lead to 8 - 2 in the fourth . He was thrown out at third to end the inning and walked off as fans chanted
column13: " MVP ! MVP ! " 	 " When you can drive in 100 runs before September
column15: " Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said . " That 's production . " 	 Bellinger was all smiles after getting caught at third
column16: and not just because of the MVP chants -- his pants fell down as he slid . 	 " That was funny
column17: " he said . " The belt did n't even break . My pants just fell
column18: do n't even know how . " 	 Bellinger is the first Dodger to reach the century mark since Adrian Gonzalez had 116 in 2014 . 	 Pitching on Lakers Night
column19: Kershaw allowed a homer to -- of all people -- Derek Fisher while falling into a 2 - 0 hole . But the Dodgers backed their eight - time All - Star with four double plays and slugged five homers while pounding out 15 hits . 	 Los Angeles broke out for five runs with two outs in the third to get the blowout going . 	 A.J. Pollock hit a solo shot
column20: Smith followed with his 11th homer and Corey Seager added a two - run double in the third that chased Sean Reid - Foley
column21: who entered in the second after Buddy Boshers served as the opener . 	 Reid - Foley ( 2 - 4 ) gave up five runs and five hits in 1 2/3 innings . He struck out two and walked two . 	 " If you walk people and against a good lineup like that
column22: you 're going to pay the price
column23: " Toronto manager Charlie Montoyo said . 	 Max Muncy added a solo shot
column25: in the sixth off Justin Shafer
column26: who then issued consecutive walks to Smith and Bellinger . That set up Chris Taylor 's three - run blast to left
column27: giving the Dodgers a 12 - 3 lead . 	 Taylor came off the injured list earlier in the day after being out since July 15 with a broken left forearm . 	 Kike Hernandez also returned from the IL after being out since July 29 with a sprained left hand . He was 1 for 5 with two strikeouts . 	 Visiting Los Angeles for the first time since 2007
column28: Toronto dropped its third in a row for the first time since July 4 - 6 . 	 The Blue Jays ran through six pitchers before sending newly called up shortstop Richard Urena to the mound in the eighth . That 's when the Dodgers tacked on four more runs
column29: extending their lead to 16 - 3 . Taylor had an RBI single before Joc Pederson 's three - run homer . 	 Bichette hit his first career leadoff homer in the first and did it again leading off the sixth against Kershaw
column30: giving the 21 - year - old rookie his first career multihomer game . He has seven homers through 21 career games . 	 He 's also just the sixth player with multiple homers off Kershaw in the same game . 	 " Being at Dodger Stadium
column31: facing Kershaw
column33: " Bichette said . " I 'll always remember this day . It 's a pretty cool thing . You can talk about him as being one of the best ever . " 	 Vladimir Guerrero Jr. returned to the Blue Jays ' lineup after dealing with left knee inflammation since last weekend . He had a pair of singles and two walks . column1: CINCINNATI --   Luis Castillo did n't have his best stuff
column2: but it was n't nearly as bad as his last start . 	 Cincinnati 's All - Star right - hander shook off his worst career start to pitch six solid innings
column3: Jose Iglesias hit a solo home run and the Reds beat the San Diego Padres 4 - 2 on Wednesday to win the three - game series . 	 " It was n't Luis ' best game
column4: but even without his best game
column6: " manager David Bell said . " That 's what it takes . Even when he 's not at his best
column9: who allowed nine hits and eight runs on Friday against St. Louis
column10: bounced back to limit San Diego to five hits and one run with four strikeouts . 	 " When your pitches are n't very good but you get a lot of soft contact
column11: you know you 're doing a good job
column12: " Castillo said . " I think the adjustments you make between starts helps . After the start against the Cardinals
column13: I had to work hard . " 	 The Reds sent nine batters to the plate while scoring three runs in a third inning started by Eric Yardley ( 0 - 1 )
column14: who got the loss in his major league debut after being promoted from Triple - A El Paso before the game . Nick Senzel led off with a line drive on Yardley 's first pitch that left fielder Josh Naylor misplayed for a two - base error . Senzel scored one out later on Eugenio Suarez 's single . 	 " He got a bad break on his first pitch
column15: " San Diego manager Andy Green said . " It 's tough when you get a fly ball on your first pitch and do n't get an out . You 've got to rise up . " 	 After laying down a sacrifice bunt in the third
column16: Iglesias lofted his ninth homer of the season into the seats down the left field line with one out in the fourth inning for a 4 - 1 lead . 	 " I just did my part
column17: " Iglesias said about his bunt . " It paid off . It set the table for the other guys
column18: and it was a huge inning . When you play the game the right way
column19: good things happen . " 	 Francisco Mejia led off the seventh inning for the Padres with his eighth homer of the season
column20: a solo shot off Lucas Sims . Greg Garcia drove in Ty France with a third - inning two - out double for San Diego 's other run . 	 Cincinnati 's Michael Lorenzen had two strikeouts in a perfect eighth . Raisel Iglesias had two strikeouts in the ninth on the way to his 26th save . 	 Matt Strahm made his 16th start of the season and first since July 2 as the first of five pitchers on a bullpen day for the Padres . 	 The Reds loaded the bases against Yardley before Trey Wingenter came in and issued two bases - loaded walks . 	 LONG TIME 	 The Reds finished 5 - 2 against San Diego this season to win their first season against the Padres since 2012 . 	 STOLEN GIFT 	 Reds C Tucker Barnhart picked up his sixth career stolen base in the second inning and first since Aug. 26
column22: when Padres C Francisco Mejia dropped the ball between his feet and could n't immediately locate it . 	 GIVE IT UP 	 Iglesias and Barnhart are the only two Reds non - pitchers to have sacrifice bunts this season . Each has one . 	 FEELING AT HOME 	 Mejia 's homer was the fourth of his career against the Reds
column23: all at Great American Ball Park . He has hit seven against the rest of the major leagues
column24: no more than one against any other team . 	 IN SIGHT 	 The Padres have hit 188 homers this season
column25: one short of matching the club record set in 2017 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Reds : C Curt Casali ( sprained right knee ligament ) started and caught six innings in the second game of his rehab assignment with Triple - A Louisville on Tuesday . . INF / OF Derek Dietrich ( left shoulder inflammation ) was 2 for 8 in the first two games of his rehab assignment with the Bats . 	 UP NEXT 	 Padres : RHP Chris Paddack ( 7 - 6 ) has a 7.98 ERA in three August starts going into Friday 's game against Boston in San Diego . 	 Reds : RHP Anthony DeSclafani ( 6 - 7 ) is 0 - 2 with an 8.10 ERA in two starts against the Pirates this season going into Friday 's series opener in Pittsburgh . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 The Yankees hired former Mets manager Luis Rojas as their new third - base coach on Monday .
