column2: Fla. --   The Tampa Bay Rays struggled during a six - game homestand against a pair of last - place teams but were able to break even due to three walk - off wins . 	 Kevin Kiermaier drove in four runs
column3: including a solo homer during a two - run ninth inning
column4: and the Rays avoided a three - game sweep by beating the Seattle Mariners 7 - 6 on Wednesday . 	 " We did enough to win today
column5: " Kiermaier said . " You can call it an ugly win or whatever
column6: we 'll take as many as we can . " 	 Kiermaier tied it at 6 - 6 on a leadoff homer against Matt Magill ( 3 - 1 ) . The Rays then loaded the bases on Willy Adames ' single
column8: and an intentional walk to pinch - hitter Ji - Man Choi with no outs before Magill 's wild pitch with Tommy Pham batting allowed Adames to score the winning run . 	 " Kind of a bummer
column9: " Magill said . " I cost my teammates a win . " 	 Daniel Vogelbach had a solo homer and Mallex Smith added a two - run triple off Emilio Pagan ( 3 - 2 ) as the Mariners went up 6 - 5 in the top of the ninth . 	 Tampa Bay entered the game a percentage point behind Oakland for the second AL wild card . The Athletics were at home later Wednesday against the New York Yankees . 	 Brosseau had a run - scoring single in the 13th inning of a 1 - 0 win over Detroit Saturday
column10: while Choi knocked in a pair with a ninth - inning single during a 5 - 4 victory Sunday over the Tigers . 	 Tim Lopes had two RBI for the Mariners
column11: who head home after a 6 - 3 road trip . 	 " We almost pulled off a sweep here
column13: " Seattle manager Scott Servais said . 	 Kiermaier put the Rays ahead 4 - 3 on a two - run single in the fourth and added a sixth - inning
column14: run - scoring groundout . 	 Seattle took a 3 - 2 advantage in the fourth on Kyle Seager 's RBI grounder and Lopes ' two - run single . Rays right fielder Guillermo Heredia prevented two more runs from scoring with a nifty running catch in the right - field corner on Jake Fraley 's drive . 	 Heredia
column15: mired in a 1 - for-23 slide
column16: made it 2 - 0 on his third - inning homer off Wade LeBlanc . 	 " I 've got to give Guillermo Heredia some love because he had a huge homer
column17: but he made a play down the right - field line
column18: " Kiermaier said . " Who knows what would have happened at that point in the game ? That changes everything . That was huge . " 	 Fraley made his major league debut starting in center and became the 63rd player used by the Mariners this season
column19: one away from the MLB record set by Texas in 2014 . 	 Seager went 0 for 4 and had a 14 - game hitting streak end . 	 Pham walked in the first
column21: and scored on Travis d'Arnaud 's sacrifice fly . 	 Tampa Bay ace Charlie Morton was bidding for his 14th win but struggled in a five - inning
column25: two walks and striking out three . The righty had struck out 29 and walked none in his three previous outings . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Mariners : OF Mitch Haniger ( ruptured testicle ) was the DH at Triple - A Tacoma Tuesday but will need to play a whole game defensively before returning . 	 Rays : RHP Yonny Chirinos ( right middle finger inflammation ) will play catch this weekend . ... RHP Tyler Glasnow ( right forearm ) had his second bullpen session . ... OF Avisail Garcia ( right oblique ) should be back Saturday . 	 BIG MEN 	 The Rays purchased the contract of RHP Aaron Slegers from Triple - A Durham . At 6 - foot-10
column26: he is the tallest player in team history and
column27: according to Baseball Reference
column28: tied for the second - tallest in the majors behind 6 - foot-11 Jon Rauch . " I saw ( college basketball analyst ) Jay Bilas at the barber shop
column29: " Slegers said . " I think he double - taked . He could n't believe he did n't know every seven - footer in the city . " 	 TOSSED 	 Rays 1B Jesus Aguilar was ejected for the first time in his career for arguing with home plate umpire John Libka after a called third strike in the sixth . column1: MINNEAPOLIS --   The Minnesota Twins have been in first place in the AL Central for all but 13 days this season
column2: a perch the Chicago White Sox have been aiming for during this extended rebuilding project . 	 If they can make that big jump in 2020
column3: Lucas Giolito will surely be a major factor . 	 Giolito pitched a three - hit shutout of the second - highest scoring team in the major leagues
column4: racking up 12 strikeouts for the White Sox on Wednesday in a 4 - 0 victory for their first series win over the Twins in two years . 	 " He 's a tough customer
column5: and he was on his game
column6: " Twins manager Rocco Baldelli said . " He pounded the strike zone
column7: but he also has elite stuff
column8: too . " 	 Giolito ( 14 - 6 ) allowed only runner past first base
column9: a double by Jonathan Schoop in the eighth . The 25 - year - old fanned Jake Cave to finish that inning and reach double - digit strikeouts for the third straight time
column10: the first White Sox starter to do so since Chris Sale did so in eight consecutive turns in 2015 . The last right - hander with a streak that long for the team was Edwin Jackson
column11: with three in a row in 2010 . 	 Giolito also matched Cleveland 's Shane Bieber for the major league lead with his third complete game this season
column12: though one was a five - inning
column13: rain - shortened contest against Toronto before he blanked Houston with a four - hit shutout on May 23 . Giolito got there this time with a career - high 115 pitches
column14: without a walk . 	 " If you asked me last year
column15: say you 'd throw two complete - game shutouts next season
column16: I do n't know if I would have believed it
column17: " Giolito said
column18: " but it 's the work I put in in the offseason
column19: coming in pitching with confidence every single time . " 	 The Twins beat the White Sox 10 - 3 on July 25
column20: and Giolito gave up seven hits
column21: seven runs and four homers in five innings in that game . Since then
column22: he 's 3 - 1 with a 2.12 ERA and 53 strikeouts in 34 innings . He said a recent change to his between - starts weight room routine has helped him increase his late - game velocity . 	 One of the myriad prospects collected by the White Sox during their systematic dump of high - priced veterans
column23: Giolito was one of three players acquired from Washington for outfielder Adam Eaton prior to the 2017 season . 	 " It was able to allow us replenish our system
column25: we 're moving forward in a positive direction just in general . " 	 The Twins were blanked for the third time this year
column26: all at home and also on April 30 by Houston and June 17 by Boston . They took a three - game lead on the Indians in the AL Central into the day . This 13 - game stretch entirely against the third - place White Sox and fifth - place Detroit Tigers that began this week looked like a favorable spot on the schedule
column27: but solid starting pitching can make quite the difference . 	 Jose Abreu went 3 for 5 with two RBI for the White Sox from his usual third spot in the lineup
column28: with Leury Garcia and Tim Anderson each producing two hits from their places in front of him . The first three batters scored all four runs against Twins starter Jake Odorizzi ( 13 - 6 )
column29: who was outdone by his fellow American League All - Star . 	 Though Odorizzi was bested by a bunch of rollers and bloops
column30: with six of eight hits allowed in five innings going for singles
column31: a sign he was not in form was a second wild pitch of the game that let Abreu score with two outs in the fifth . Odorizzi has three wild pitches in two starts after totaling just two over the last two years . 	 " I might have had the most weak contact I had all season
column32: and the results were n't there to go with it
column33: " Odorizzi said . " But that 's just how it goes sometimes . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 White Sox : 3B Yoan Moncada
column34: out for the last three weeks with a strained right hamstring
column36: six RBI and six runs in the first five games of a rehab assignment with Triple - A Charlotte . He 's expected to be reinstated from the injured list on Thursday . OF Ryan Cordell was sent down after the game . 	 Twins : LF Eddie Rosario was removed after the fifth inning as a precaution due to tightness in his right hamstring . " It was n't like an acute injury or anything that seems to be on the higher end of the serious scale
column37: but even something moderately serious is still something that we 're going to spend some time on
column38: " Baldelli said . 	 UP NEXT 	 White Sox : LHP Ross Detwiler ( 1 - 3
column39: 6.10 ERA ) was announced as the starter for Thursday night
column40: when the White Sox start a four - game series at Texas . Detwiler 's last appearance came in relief
column41: a three - inning outing on Sunday . RHP Areil Jurado ( 6 - 9
column42: 5.38 ERA ) will pitch for the Rangers . 	 Twins : After an off day

column44: 3.37 ERA ) on the mound . Berrios has an 8.44 ERA over his last three turns

column1: PHOENIX --   Tim Melville had to pause for a moment to clear his throat of some whipped cream . 	 He 'd gotten the traditional condiment treatment in the showers from his Colorado Rockies teammates
column2: in celebration of his first major league win . 	 Melville pitched seven innings of two - hit ball in his first big league appearance in almost two years
column3: and the Rockies cruised to a 7 - 2 win over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Wednesday . 	 Melville
column4: a 29 - year - old right - hander with just six previous major league appearances who started this season in independent ball
column5: limited Arizona to a first - inning double and a sixth - inning home run by Ketel Marte to go with four strikeouts and two walks . He also picked up his first hit -- a two - out
column6: fourth - inning single -- and his first two career RBI . 	 In April
column7: Melville was n't on a team when he came to a game as a fan at Chase Field . 	 " You win or you learn . I never look at it as losing
column8: " Melville said . " I 've had a lot of ups and downs throughout my career and other opportunities in the big leagues . I 'm very thankful for this one . " 	 Melville was an emergency call - up from Triple - A Albuquerque earlier Wednesday to start in place of Jon Gray
column9: whom the Rockies before the game placed on the 60 - day injured list with a left foot fracture . 	 " I told him after the game
column10: timeless . That 's a throwback pitching style game . He could have pitched in the ' 20s
column14: " Rockies manager Bud Black said . " That was fun to watch . A guy that understands how he gets his outs
column15: how he changes speeds . He stayed just within himself and did his thing . " 	 Colorado won the season series with Arizona
column16: 10 games to nine . Alex Avila also homered for the Diamondbacks
column17: who had their four - game win streak snapped . 	 The Rockies jumped on struggling Mike Leake ( 9 - 10 ) early with two runs on three straight singles and a fielder 's choice in the first . 	 In the fourth
column18: a hit batter
column19: four singles and a sacrifice fly produced three more runs and a 5 - 0 lead . Leake got through five innings and was charged with five runs on eight hits . He 's allowed 17 earned runs on 26 hits in 16 innings over his last three starts . 	 " Sometimes balls through holes can beat you
column20: " Leake said . " I got a little elevated towards that fourth inning . I could have stayed off the plate or more down . " 	 Melville executed a squeeze bunt in the sixth to drive in Yonathan Daza
column21: and Charlie Blackmon drove in his second run of the day with a single after Trevor Story led off the seventh with a walk and stolen base . 	 Marte hit his 27th home run of the season in the sixth
column22: a solo shot to right field . Avila took Jesus Tinoco deep in the eighth for his ninth of the year . 	 " The theme here is we never got anything going offensively
column23: " Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo said . " I think we were prepared
column24: we just went out of the zone ( swinging ) too often . " 	 PAYAMPS DEBUT 	 Diamondbacks right - hander Joel Payamps made his major league debut and allowed two runs on four hits in three innings . The 25 - year - old from the Dominican Republic also had three strikeouts
column25: with his first one as a big leaguer coming against the Rockies ' Garrett Hampson . 	 UP NEXT 	 Rockies : RHP German Marquez ( 12 - 5
column26: 4.71 ERA ) gets the call to open a four - game series at St. Louis on Thursday . Marquez is 4 - 0 over his last five starts . 	 Diamondbacks : After Thursday 's off day
column27: the Diamondbacks are off to Milwaukee for a three - game series with the Brewers in a matchup of teams trying to stay in the postseason hunt . Arizona has RHP Merrill Kelly ( 9 - 12
column28: 4.63 ) set to start Friday 's series opener . The Diamondbacks have lost five straight at Miller Park . 	 --- 	 More AP MLB : https://apnews.com/MLB and https://twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Randy Arozarena celebrates with his family at home after learning he won the 2021 AL Rookie of the Year . column2: Texas --   The old guys for the Texas Rangers got the big hits late for another win in their last at - bat . Another hard - throwing rookie reliever got his first big league victory . 	 Hunter Pence drove in three runs
column3: including a game - ending single in the ninth to score Elvis Andrus for an 8 - 7 victory over the Los Angeles Angels on Wednesday night . 	 " We 've got these young guys bringing a spark
column5: the 36 - year - old hometown outfielder . " It 's impressive to watch
column6: and these young pitchers as well . " 	 The Rangers won three times in the four - game series . All of the wins came in their final at - bat
column7: including 11 - inning wins in the series opener Monday and the second game of a doubleheader Tuesday . 	 Jonathan Hernandez ( 1 - 0 ) worked the final 2 1/3 scoreless innings to win in his major league debut . 	 " It could n't be a more difficult situation
column8: especially with the way the game was kind of going
column9: " manager Chris Woodward said . " It 's really cool to be a part of guys living out their dream . ... It 's pretty special
column11: I feel like it 's happening every night . " 	 It was the second night in a row for a Ranger to get his first big league win -- 21 - year - old Emmanuel Clase pitched the final two innings Tuesday night in his eighth appearance since his MLB debut earlier this month . Clase won the game started by Brock Burke
column12: who threw six scoreless innings in his big league debut . 	 Elvis Andrus
column13: the 31 - year - old shortstop and the longest - tenured Ranger in his 11th season
column14: led off the ninth with a single up the middle off Trevor Cahill ( 3 - 8) . After two wild pitches got Andrus to third
column15: Pence grounded a single through the left side of the infield . 	 Pence
column16: who struck out his first three at - bats
column17: had a two - out double in the seventh . Texas tied the game in the eight on an RBI single by Shin - Soo Choo
column18: a 37 - year - old outfielder . 	 " There 's a ton of energy in that clubhouse
column19: " Woodward said . " I do n't care how young you are . I do n't care how old you are for that matter . We want to win . " 	 Willie Calhoun
column21: hit his 13th homer in the Texas second . Rookie Nick Solak had two doubles
column22: scoring three times and drove in a run in his third big league game . 	 The Angels used seven pitchers
column23: and the last four relievers combined to give up four runs over two innings . There were only two walks
column24: but they were leadoff walks that both scored . 	 " Probably just ebbs and flows . You 're not going to be great every single month
column25: " manager Brad Ausmus said about the bullpen struggles . " I would n't really attribute it to anything in particular
column26: I think just a down month . " 	 Texas
column27: which twice earlier in the game blew two - run leads
column28: was down 7 - 4 after a three - run Angels sixth that included two runs coming home on the same play that Justin Upton had a sacrifice fly . 	 With the bases loaded with one out
column29: after an intentional walk to Mike Trout
column30: Upton hit his sac fly . Left fielder Calhoun 's throw home was well off target before catcher Jeff Mathis tried to pick off Trout
column31: but first baseman Danny Santana misplayed the ball for an error that allowed a second run to score . 	 That ended the night for All - Star lefty Mike Minor
column32: whose ERA rose from 2.94 to 3.17 after he allowed seven runs and 10 hits -- both season highs . He struck out seven and walked two . 	 The Angels tied the game 4 - all with two outs in the fifth when Albert Pujols had a tying two - run single that ricocheted off the top of the eight - foot wall in right . Pujols thought he had his 20th homer
column33: but the ball was ruled in play when it bounced back onto the field
column34: and that stood after a crew chief replay review . 	 WALK IT OFF 	 The Rangers have consecutive walk - off wins for the first time since May 2017 against San Diego . The last time they had three walk - off wins in the same series was in July 2013 against the Angels
column35: with game - ending homers three games in a row . 	 SHORT HOPS 	 Hernandez became the 13th pitcher to make his MLB debut with the Rangers this season . The previous club record had been 10 debuts in 2014 . ... The Angels finished 109 - 117 overall at the Rangers ' ballpark in its 26th season . They will be the first visitor when Texas plays its 2020 regular season home opener in a new stadium across the street . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Angels : RHP Griffin Canning ( elbow inflammation ) returned to California and will be placed on the injured list for the second time this month . 	 UP NEXT 	 Angels : After a day off Thursday
column36: the Angels open a three - game weekend series at AL West - leading Houston
column37: where they have lost seven of their last eight games . column1: BALTIMORE --   In his trying first season as the Orioles ' manager
column2: Brandon Hyde was not the least bit concerned about his team tying a dubious record on a night it cruised to an easy win . 	 Baltimore matched a major league mark by allowing its 258th homer this season
column3: but the Orioles hit four of their own in an 8 - 1 victory over the Kansas City Royals on Wednesday night . 	 " We 've given up a ton of homers
column4: " Hyde said . " What 's the record ... 258 ? So
column6: I do n't care . I just want us to get better on the mound and obviously finish this year and go into next year trying to do a better job of keeping the ball in the ballpark and staying off the barrel
column7: but home runs are up . ... We 're all tired of seeing them and hopefully we can get better going forward . " 	 Anthony Santander and Renato Nunez hit back - to - back home runs in the fifth inning for Baltimore
column8: which won its first series since July 25 - 27 at the Los Angeles Angels . 	 Jonathan Villar opened the scoring with a two - run shot
column9: while Hanser Alberto put the game away with a three - run blast in the sixth . 	 Whit Merrifield homered leading off the third for Kansas City . The 2016 Cincinnati Reds owned the previous record for home runs allowed in a season
column10: but the Orioles have 35 games to surpass them . 	 Long balls have hampered Baltimore throughout the year . The Yankees hit 61 homers off Orioles pitching this season
column11: a record for one team against another . 	 Aaron Brooks ( 3 - 7 ) picked up his first win in eight starts with the Orioles since being claimed on waivers from Oakland on July 6 . He allowed one run and seven hits with four strikeouts over five innings . It was also his first win since April 11 . 	 The last team Brooks beat ? The Orioles . 	 " For me coming over to a new organization
column12: I wanted to show positive movement forward and competitiveness
column13: " Brooks said . " I feel like I 'm finally moving towards that part of my game again . It feels good . " 	 Villar put the Orioles ahead 2 - 0 in the second with his homer off Mike Montgomery ( 3 - 6 )
column14: whose streak of 14 consecutive scoreless innings was snapped . Stevie Wilkerson later hit an RBI double . He finished with a career - high three hits . 	 " Credit them
column15: " Montgomery said . " They had a good game plan
column16: they did a good job of making me work
column17: chasing pitches that I wanted them to chase . I was n't executing pitches as well as I have the last few weeks
column18: but that happens . They did a good job
column19: just trying to battle . " 	 Santander and Nunez
column21: made it 5 - 1 in the fifth
column22: and Alberto increased the margin in the sixth . 	 " It feels good when you 're on the winning side
column23: " Alberto said . 	 The Royals fell to 1 - 11 in rubber games this year . 	 QUIET BATS 	 The Royals have scored one or zero runs in 25 games this season
column24: third most in the majors . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Royals : SS Adalberto Mondesi ( shoulder ) was fine after a rehab assignment Tuesday with Triple - A Omaha . Mondesi
column25: who served as DH
column26: was scheduled to play 3 - to-5 innings in the field on Wednesday . ... Manager Ned Yost has n't decided whether LHP Danny Duffy ( left hamstring strain ) will return to the rotation this weekend . Duffy threw 65 pitches in a simulated game Tuesday . " We could either have him do a live rehab or put him back in the rotation
column27: " Yost said . 	 Orioles : OF Dwight Smith Jr. ( left calf strain ) started in left field at Triple - A Norfolk on a rehab assignment Wednesday after serving as the DH the prior two games . 	 UP NEXT 	 Royals : Resume a suspended game Thursday in Boston with a 2 - 1 count on catcher Meibrys Viloria in the top of the 10th inning . The teams were tied 4 - 4 before the game on Aug. 7 was interrupted by rain . Zach Plesac ( 6 - 4

column29: 4.78 ) . 	 Orioles : RHP Asher Wojciechowski ( 2 - 6

column1: PITTSBURGH --   Patrick Corbin gave the Nationals another stellar outing in his first season in Washington . 	 Corbin
column4: pitched eight scoreless innings to remain unbeaten in more than two months
column5: and Asdrubal Cabrera had a three - run home run in a six - run third as the Nationals rolled to an 11 - 1 victory over the Pittsburgh Pirates on Wednesday night . 	 Corbin ( 10 - 5 ) struck out four and walked two while throwing 93 pitches to help the Nationals maintain their lead atop the National League wild - card standings . 	 " He was really good
column6: " Martinez said . " He pounded the strike zone and kept everything down . He was awesome . " 	 Corbin has not lost since June 11 . The left - hander is 5 - 0 with a 2.12 ERA in 12 starts since then . 	 " He just throttled us
column7: " Pirates manager Clint Hurdle said . " We had no answers . " 	 Corbin was three outs away from his second shutout this season and third of his seven - year career . However

column11: and give someone else some work ? " Corbin said . " I do n't blame ( Martinez ) . " 	 Joe Musgrove ( 8 - 12 ) gave up six runs and seven hits in five innings as Pittsburgh lost for the 29th time in 37 games since the All - Star break . 	 " I did n't really have good stuff tonight from the bullpen all the way out through the fifth inning
column12: " Musgrove said . " It was just one of those nights where I was battling the best I could . " 	 Adam Eaton opened the scoring in the third with an RBI double and Anthony Rendon followed with a two - run single

column15: who is on paternity leave . 	 Cabrera believes being reunited with hitting coach Kevin Long has helped . They also worked together with the New York Mets . 	 " He knows when I 'm swinging the ball well and when I 'm not

column17: Corbin escaped the jam by getting pinch - hitter Melky Cabrera to fly out and Kevin Newman to ground out . 	 Washington added three runs in the eighth when Yan Gomes hit a two - run double and scored on a double by Corbin . In the ninth

Josh Bell 's run - scoring double in the ninth prevented the Pirates from being shut out . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Nationals : RHP Joe Ross ( bruised right shin ) will throw a bullpen session Thursday before the team determines whether he can make his next scheduled start Saturday against the Cubs at Chicago . Ross left in the fourth inning of Monday 's game after being hit by a hard one - hopper by Pirates 1B Bell . If Ross is unable to pitch

column2: the New York Mets watched Cleveland hand it to them -- Brad Hand
column3: especially . 	 The Indians All - Star closer failed to cover first base on what could 've been a game - ending double play
column4: and moments later J.D. Davis lined an RBI single that capped a two - run rally in the 10th inning for a 4 - 3 win Wednesday night . 	 Davis
column5: like most everyone else at Citi Field
column6: thought the Mets might be doomed when Michael Conforto hit a sharp grounder to first baseman Carlos Santana . 	 " Off the bat
column10: no one saw that coming . 	 Santana 's solo homer in the 10th put the Indians ahead 3 - 2 . But then Amed Rosario opened the Mets half with a double off Hand ( 6 - 4 ) and went to third on a sacrifice by Joe Panik . 	 An intentional walk to Pete Alonso put runners at first and third
column11: and the Indians set their middle infield at double - play depth
column12: playing even with the bags at the corners . 	 Conforto followed with a hard grounder and Santana moved to his right to grab it in a hurry . Rather than try to get Rosario at the plate
column13: Santana had another thought . 	 " Making a double play
column14: " he said . 	 Santana zipped a throw to star shortstop Francisco Lindor
column15: who was in perfect position to make a relay and was set to let loose . But no one was covering first -- Hand initially watched the play
column16: then curiously headed toward the plate as the tying run scored -- and Lindor could only hold the ball . 	 Indians third baseman Jose Ramirez crouched in disbelief while Santana stayed bent over
column17: looking at first base for a throw that never came . 	 " I was n't looking at the runner . I did n't see if he was breaking right away
column18: " Hand said . " Obviously
column19: a one - run game
column20: you ca n't let that run score right there . I thought maybe he could 've gone home . " 	 " I kind of stopped
column21: expecting him to throw it home . But once he was n't throwing it home
column22: I did n't have a chance to get over there
column23: " he said . 	 Indians manager Terry Francona said he thought Santana should 've thrown home . 	 " With a lefty on the mound
column24: you 're not going to be able to get over there
column25: " he said . " So once he ca n't get back
column26: there 's nobody else there to take the throw . " 	 The Mets won their fourth in a row and for the 20th time in 25 games
column27: moving a season - high six over .500 . It was their 12th win in the last 13 at Citi Field -- they have more home games down the stretch than any team in the majors . 	 New York also improved baseball 's best interleague record this year to 14 - 5
column28: winning for the second straight day in a matchup of playoff contenders . 	 Cleveland leads the AL wild - card race and has played well on the road lately . But the Indians have won only once while visiting the Mets -- that was in 2004 at Shea Stadium
column29: with CC Sabathia getting the victory . 	 Santana hit his 30th home run

column1: BOSTON --   The Fenway fans were letting Bryce Harper have it
column2: calling the Phillies ' $ 330 million man " overrated " and other insults that Philadelphia manager Gabe Kapler could n't bring himself to repeat . 	 Harper then quieted them with one swing . 	 " He 's good at doing that
column4: " Phillies starter Drew Smyly said on Wednesday night after Harper 's two - run homer propelled Philadelphia to a 5 - 2 victory over the Boston Red Sox . " Especially on the road . " 	 Harper 's homer in the fifth inning turned a 2 - 1 deficit into a 3 - 2 lead
column5: and Corey Dickerson drove in two runs with a triple and a single to help the Phillies a sweep the two - game interleague series . Harper was not available to talk to reporters after the game
column6: but Kapler said there was an especially sweet celebration in the dugout after the home run . 	 " They were on him pretty good until that moment
column8: who was a member of Boston 's 2004 World Series championship team . " I 'm really happy for Bryce . " 	 Boston started the first inning with back - to - back doubles
column9: and Jackie Bradley Jr. homered for the second straight night to give the Red Sox a 2 - 0 lead against Smyly . Rick Porcello ( 11 - 10 ) allowed just one hit through four innings before Cesar Hernandez led off the fifth with a double . 	 Hernandez took off on a wild pitch and scored when the throw got past Rafael Devers at third base . After a walk
column10: Harper cleared the Green Monster with a two - run shot
column11: his 27th homer of the year . 	 The game was dampened by showers but never delayed . 	 Jared Hughes ( 4 - 5 ) earned the win with 1 1/3 hitless innings of relief after Smyly lasted just 3 2/3 innings
column12: allowing two runs and five hits with three walks while striking out four . Hector Neris pitched the ninth for his 23rd save . 	 Philadelphia made it 4 - 2 in the seventh on Dickenson 's RBI triple . The Red Sox put runners on second and third with two outs in the eighth
column13: but Jose Alvarez struck out pinch - hitter Chris Owings to end the threat . 	 Dickerson made it 5 - 2 with a single in the ninth . 	 SLOPPY NIGHT 	 One night after having two runners thrown out on the basepaths in the ninth inning
column14: the Red Sox committed two errors
column15: including the one that allowed Hernandez to score . There was a balk on Brandon Workman
column16: two wild pitches and a passed ball by Christian Vazquez . Red Sox pitchers walked eight . 	 " It was n't a great night
column17: " manager Alex Cora said . " The funny thing is we had a chance to win the game . We ca n't have nights like that as a team . " 	 BUNTS 	 The Red Sox have homered in 13 consecutive games
column18: their longest such streak of the season . ... Boston is 0 - 3 - 1 in interleague series after going 10 - 0 - 3 previous 13 series ( not counting the World Series victory over the Dodgers ) . column1: ATLANTA --   Julio Teheran and Ronald Acuna Jr. have flourished against the Miami Marlins this season . 	 That success has led to continued dominance for the Braves in the NL East rivalry . 	 Acuna and Adeiny Hechavarria each hit a two - run homer
column2: Teheran struck out a season - high nine and the Braves beat Miami 5 - 0 on Wednesday night despite being held to three hits . 	 Led by Teheran
column6: the Braves are 14 - 4 against Miami this year after winning the 2018 season series between the NL East rivals 14 - 5 . 	 Teheran ( 8 - 8) combined with Sean Newcomb and Josh Tomlin for a seven - hit shutout . The right - hander allowed five hits in seven innings . He improved to 3 - 0 with a 0.28 ERA in five starts against Miami this season . 	 " When you know that you 're pitching good against one team
column7: obviously that gives you more confidence
column8: " Teheran said . " That 's what I had coming into this game . " 	 Marlins manager Don Mattingly said Teheran " has kind of shut us down all year . " 	 " We have n't had any luck with him
column9: " Mattingly said . " A guy like that or a situation like that kind of ends up in your head . " 	 Acuna 's shot off Caleb Smith ( 8 - 7 ) in the fifth cleared the center field wall . He has 16 homers against Miami in his two - year career
column10: including nine this season . 	 " I think the confidence is always there
column11: " Acuna said through a translator when asked about his success against Miami . " As long as I 'm feeling good and confident I can give my best effort . That 's all I try to focus on . " 	 Acuna 's team - leading 36th homer came one night after he was hit by Elieser Hernandez 's first pitch
column12: leading to the ejection of Braves manager Brian Snitker . 	 The first - place Braves
column13: who had no singles or doubles
column14: have won four straight . The last - place Marlins have dropped five in a row . 	 Tyler Flowers and Hechavarria provided power from the bottom of the Atlanta lineup in the second . Flowers ' triple over right fielder Brian Anderson drove in Josh Donaldson
column15: who walked . Marlins rookie second baseman Isan Diaz dropped the relay throw from Anderson
column16: robbing Miami of a possible play on Flowers at third base . 	 Hechavarria 's homer into the left field seats was his sixth of the season and first since signing with Atlanta on Friday following his release from the Mets . 	 Smith permitted five runs on only three hits and four walks in six innings . Two walks led to runs . 	 " That basically sums it up right there
column17: " he said . 	 Smith led off the third with a double to left field for his first career extra - base hit . He then doubled down the right field line with one out in the fifth . Teheran has allowed 12 hits to pitchers this season
column18: most in the majors . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Marlins : RHP Pablo Lopez ( right shoulder strain ) allowed two runs
column19: one earned
column20: in six innings for Triple - A New Orleans against Omaha as he moved closer to a return to the rotation . He gave up eight hits and no walks . SS Dansby Swanson ( foot ) will start a rehab assignment with Class A Rome on Thursday . ... OF Austin Riley ( knee ) begins his rehab assignment with Rome on Friday . 	 BOUNCE - BACK WIN 	 Teheran rebounded nicely from the shortest start of his career . He lasted only 1 1/3 innings while allowing six runs in a loss to the New York Mets last Thursday . 	 " I know that I had a rough one and I needed to bounce back

column1: ST . LOUIS --   Mike Moustakas stopped short of calling Milwaukee 's rain - shortened victory over the St. Louis Cardinals a must win . 	 " But it was pretty important
column2: " he said . 	 Moustakas homered and Keston Hiura drove in a pair of runs to lead the reeling Brewers to just their third win in the last nine
column3: 5 - 3 over the Cardinals on Wednesday night . 	 The game was stopped after 7 1/2 innings and made official following a rain delay of 66 minutes . 	 Milwaukee broke a six - game losing streak against the Cardinals
column4: who were knocked out of first place in the NL Central -- falling one - half game behind the Cubs . Chicago beat San Francisco 12 - 11 . 	 The Brewers are in third
column5: 3 1/2 behind the Cubs . 	 Milwaukee lost four of the first five in the six - game trip including the opening two of the three - game set to the Cardinals . 	 " It was a tough trip
column6: but we ended on a good note
column7: " manager Craig Counsell said . 	 Adrian Houser ( 6 - 5 ) gave up three runs -- one earned -- and six hits in 5 1/3 innings . It marked the third straight start he 's allowed just one earned run . Houser struck out six and walked two . 	 " You lose those first two
column8: but you make some ground up by getting that last one
column9: " Houser said . " We ( did n't ) get swept
column10: it 's a big step . " 	 Junior Guerra got the last out in the bottom of the seventh and earned his third save . 	 Moustakas
column12: hit a three - run homer in the first off Adam Wainwright ( 9 - 9 ) to highlight a four - run outburst . Hiura had run - scoring hits in the first and fourth innings for a 5 - 0 lead . 	 " He made a really good pitch and I got lucky
column13: " Moustakas said of his 31st homer of the season . " I was able to stay back just enough and get the barrel to the ball . " 	 Wainwright gave up five runs and eight hits over five innings . 	 " I had horrible fastball command
column14: " Wainwright said . " Did not have good stuff and was just out there trying to battle . " 	 The Brewers needed just 17 pitches to go in front 4 - 0 as five of the first six hitters had hits . 	 " Great first inning
column15: " Counsell said . " That was the game for us offensively . " 	 Moustakas added : " This offense
column16: we can break out at any time . We put together some really good at - bats early in the game . " 	 St. Louis capitalized on a pair of errors to climb to 5 - 2 in the fifth . Yadier Molina 's double brought the Cardinals to 5 - 3 in the sixth . 	 GLOVE WORK 	 Milwaukee INF Orlando Arcia has gone 47 successive games without and error
column17: the second longest streak in franchise history . Mark Loretta went 63 straight games with an error from 2000 - 2001 . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Cardinals : St. Louis OF Tyler O'Neill went 1 for 3 in a rehab stint Wednesday for Triple - A Memphis . He missed the last 18 games with left wrist strain . " There 's no crystal ball on that . He 's missed some time so we think some at - bats are important
column18: " St. Louis manager Mike Shildt said . " Like most things
column19: the player will let you know when he 's ready . " 	 UP NEXT 	 Brewers : RHP Jordan Lyles ( 7 - 8
column20: 4.96 ERA ) will face Arizona RHP Merrill Kelly ( 9 - 12
column21: 4.63 ) on Friday in the first of a three - game series in Milwaukee . Lyles has a 7.23 ERA in 20 career games against Arizona . He is making his fifth start for the Brewers after being acquired from Pirrtsburgh in exchange for RHP Cody Ponce on July 29 . 	 Cardinals : RHP Miles Mikolas ( 7 - 13 ) squares off against Colorado RHP German Marquez ( 12 - 5
column22: 4.71 ERA ) on Thursday in the first of a four - game set in St. Louis . Mikolas is 0 - 0 with a 5.40 ERA in four career appearances vs the Rockies . 	 --- 	 More AP baseball coverage : www.apnews.com/MLB and www.twitter.com/AP-Sports 	 Detroit got a jump - start on the winter signings

column1: CHICAGO --   After watching the Cubs waste a couple of leads
column2: Kris Bryant felt a loss was almost inevitable . 	 That quickly changed with one swing by the Chicago slugger . 	 Bryant hit a go - ahead
column3: two - run homer in the eighth inning to give the Cubs a 12 - 11 comeback victory over the San Francisco Giants in a wild
column4: back - and - forth game Wednesday night at Wrigley Field . 	 " This is one of those games where you do n't feel like you 're going to win because you 're taking a lead and giving it back
column5: " Bryant said . " But we came out on top
column6: and definitely some good momentum here . " 	 Nicholas Castellanos and Kyle Schwarber also connected for Chicago
column7: which has won four straight . The Cubs moved back into first place in the NL Central by a half - game over St. Louis
column8: which lost to Milwaukee in a rain - shortened game . 	 Castellanos
column10: has homered in three consecutive games for the second time in his career -- he also did it with Detroit in 2016 -- and has eight in 19 games since being acquired in a trade before the July 31 deadline . He is batting .392 ( 31 for 79 ) with the Cubs . 	 Evan Longoria
column12: Stephen Vogt and Kevin Pillar homered for San Francisco
column13: which has dropped three in a row . 	 Castellanos led off the eighth with an infield single to set the stage for Bryant
column14: who stroked a 1 - 1 pitch from Reyes Moronta ( 3 - 7 ) into the left field bleachers . 	 Brandon Kintzler ( 3 - 2 ) pitched a scoreless inning and Craig Kimbrel worked a 1 - 2 - 3 ninth for his 11th save . 	 " That 's a tough one for us
column15: " Giants manager Bruce Bochy said . " You get that many runs
column16: that kind of production ... those are games that we 've been winning
column17: and this one got away from us . " 	 Cubs starter Yu Darvish tossed seven sharp innings against Philadelphia in his last outing and left with a 5 - 0 lead . But the bullpen blew the big advantage
column18: leaving the right - hander with a no - decision . 	 Chicago led 6 - 2 heading into the fifth on Wednesday . This time
column19: Darvish coughed up the lead himself . 	 After retiring 12 straight batters
column20: he gave up a double to Brandon Crawford with one out in the fifth . One out later
column21: Yastrzemski homered to make it 6 - 4 . 	 The Cubs got a run back in the bottom half
column22: but San Francisco scored five in the sixth to take the lead . 	 Darvish
column23: after dropping a routine throw from Anthony Rizzo at first base for an error with one out
column24: gave up a two - run homer to Vogt that made it 7 - 6 . Pillar followed with a solo shot to tie the score . 	 That was all for Darvish
column25: who allowed seven runs ( six earned ) and seven hits in 5 1/3 innings . He had eight strikeouts and walked none for a career - high fifth straight start . 	 Derek Holland took over in the sixth against his former team and did n't fare any better . He gave up three hits in two - thirds of an inning
column26: including a two - run double to pinch - hitter Austin Slater that gave the Giants a 9 - 7 lead . 	 The Cubs rallied for three runs in the bottom half against reliever Trevor Gott to grab a 10 - 9 advantage . Rizzo drove in the first with a double to left - center
column27: Javier Baez tied the game with an infield single and Schwarber drove in the go - ahead run with a groundout . 	 San Francisco scored twice in the seventh to grab an 11 - 10 lead . 	 Bryant believes this is a game to build on for the Cubs . 	 " We were high - fiving there and Riz told me
column28: ` This is a season - defining win
column29: " he said . " I ca n't disagree with him . " 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Giants : RHP Shaun Anderson ( blister ) allowed two hits with four strikeouts over 3 1/3 scoreless innings in a rehab start for Triple - A Sacramento on Tuesday . ... RHP Johnny Cueto ( Tommy John surgery ) made his fourth rehab appearance for Class A San Jose on Tuesday
column30: allowing five runs ( four earned ) and four hits with three strikeouts in 4 1/3 innings . " He threw fine ; he feels great
column31: " Bochy said . " He 's going to throw Monday for Sacramento . " 	 Cubs : Projected closer Brandon Morrow is out for the year following another setback in his recovery from right elbow surgery . Morrow had the arthroscopic procedure last November and has n't pitched since July 2018 . " He certainly worked really hard in an attempt to come back and tried a lot of different techniques and procedures
column32: and just was n't able to get over the hump
column33: " team president Theo Epstein said . 	 UP NEXT 	 Giants RHP Jeff Samardzija ( 9 - 9

column1: HOUSTON -- Justin Verlander was splendid against the Detroit Tigers
column2: pitching a two - hitter and fanning 11 in another dominant performance for the Astros . 	 Houston 's offense was n't nearly as sharp on Wednesday night
column3: and it led to an unusual
column4: tough - luck 2 - 1 loss . 	 " Just an incredible performance
column5: " manager A.J. Hinch said . " Just not one that we could help him with . We wasted a really good start by our starting pitcher . " 	 John Hicks and Ronny Rodriguez homered off Verlander -- the only two baserunners he allowed . 	 " The two times I gave in and gave them a fastball
column6: they hit a homer on it
column8: who has been critical of Major League Baseball for what he believes are intentional changes to the ball that have led to more home runs . " Baseball in 2019 . I did n't go out of the stretch at all the entire game
column9: and we lost . I do n't know what else to say . " 	 With Verlander on the mound at home against the worst team in the majors
column10: the Astros were more than a 5 - 1 favorite
column11: one of the biggest favorites in an MLB game that Las Vegas oddsmakers could remember . 	 Hicks led off the ninth with a tiebreaking blast to left - center field off Verlander ( 15 - 5 )
column12: who leads the majors in strikeouts with 239 but ranks second in homers allowed with 33 . 	 Hicks has a long history with Verlander . His brother Daniel went to high school with him and was in his wedding to supermodel Kate Upton in 2017 . 	 " It 's surreal for sure
column13: " Hicks said . " I remember being 10 years old watching him and my brother play in high school and watching him dominate . " 	 Verlander retired the first 14 batters
column15: before Rodriguez homered to the seats in right with two outs in the fifth . The veteran right - hander sat down another 10 straight before Hicks connected . 	 " That 's the biggest win for us in a long
column16: long time
column17: especially against a premium team like that
column18: a World Series contender and Verlander on the mound
column19: " Detroit manager Ron Gardenhire said . " In Detroit we got him last year at the All - Star break and we got him again
column20: but we really did n't get him very much tonight . " 	 Verlander
column21: who spent 13 seasons with the Tigers
column22: did n't fault the offense . 	 " I do n't blame anybody but myself
column23: " he said . " I could have done a better job executing pitches there in the ninth inning . " 	 He threw 99 pitches and extended his franchise record of games with 10 or more strikeouts to seven as he lost for the first time since June 18 . 	 Robinson Chirinos belted his 14th homer to left - center on Tyler Alexander 's first pitch of the seventh to tie it at 1 . Chirinos finished with four hits . Needing a triple for the cycle
column24: he doubled with two outs in the ninth but was thrown out trying to reach third to end the game . 	 " When you make a mistake like that
column25: you do n't deserve to win the game
column26: " Chirinos said . 	 Opener Daniel Norris allowed two hits in three innings for Detroit . Alexander worked four innings
column27: Buck Farmer ( 5 - 4 ) walked one in a scoreless eighth and Joe Jimenez finished the Tigers ' six - hitter for his fourth save . 	 Jose Altuve walked with one out in the eighth
column28: but was erased when he tried to go first to third on an infield grounder by Alex Bregman to end the inning . 	 TRAINER 'S ROOM 	 Astros : RHP Josh James ( shoulder soreness ) will begin a rehabilitation assignment with Triple - A Round Rock on Thursday night . Hinch said James
column29: who has been out since July 23
column30: likely wo n't rejoin the team until September . ... INF Aledmys Diaz took batting practice on Wednesday and could come off the injured list early next week . Diaz was hospitalized Aug. 17 after experiencing dizziness on the team bus in Oakland . 	 NATURE BOY CALLS 	 Houston outfielder Josh Reddick
column31: who has used WWE star Ric Flair 's signature yell of " Woooo ! " for years instead of walk - up music
column32: hosted the flamboyant Flair at the game on Wednesday night . Reddick
column33: who had a day off on Wednesday
column34: donned a wrestling robe and championship belt when he came on the field during batting practice to greet the 70 - year - old . Flair was decked out in gold jewelry
column36: a bracelet and a blinged - out watch
column37: and wore a white Astros jersey with his nickname
column38: " Nature Boy
column39: " printed on the back . 	 Reddick called Flair his hero and the wrestler was asked to describe the ballplayer . 	 " He 's married now
column40: but before he was married ... Josh Reddick would have been a kiss - stealing
column41: wheeling - dealing
column42: limousine - riding
column43: jet - flying
column45: " Flair said . 	 Flair bounced the ceremonial first pitch to Reddick
column46: who was crouched behind the plate . 	 UP NEXT 	 Tigers : RHP Jordan Zimmermann ( 1 - 8
column47: 6.66 ERA ) is scheduled to start for Detroit when the series wraps up on Thursday night . Zimmermann allowed just one hit in five scoreless innings in his last start against Tampa Bay
column48: but did not factor in the decision . 	 Astros : RHP Gerrit Cole ( 14 - 5

column2: Calif. --   When slugger Khris Davis cleared the fences again at last
column3: he gave it an animated trot around the bases complete with a salute approaching third before celebrating with his teammates back in the dugout . 	 When top pitching prospect A.J. Puk made his major league debut at last
column4: the crowd went crazy and he felt the love . His teammates razzed him afterward and he assured everybody
column5: " I can take it . " 	 Davis and Marcus Semien each hit a two - run homer to back Mike Fiers
column6: and the Oakland Athletics held off the New York Yankees 6 - 4 on Wednesday night to clinch another series win against an AL division leader after taking three of four games from Houston last weekend . 	 Oakland moved a percentage point in front of Tampa Bay for the second AL wild card . 	 Davis snapped an 0 - for-17 slump -- three at - bats shy of the longest hitless drought of his career -- with his first home run since July 30 and second since June 18 . He sent a full - count pitch down the right field line in the second inning for just his 18th homer after he led the majors last season with 48 for his third straight year with 40 or more . 	 " He needed that
